As [she]722-her spoke and moved forward , [he]723-he turned a little , so that now the edge of that hazel - coppice was within [his]723-he eye - shot , and [he]723-he deemed that once more [he]723-he saw the yellow - brown evil thing crawling forth from the thicket ; then , turning suddenly on [the Lady]576-the lady , [he]723-he met [her]576-the lady eyes , and seemed in one moment of time to find a far other look in them than that of frankness and kindness ; though in a flash they changed back again , and [she]722-her said merrily and sweetly : " So , so , [Sir Squire]61-squire , now art [thou]1942-my maid awake again , and mayest for a little while look on [me]722-her . "[722-her]

Now it came into [his]723-he head , with that look of hers , all that might befall [him]723-he and [the Maid]543-the maid if [he]723-he mastered not [his]723-he passion , nor did what [he]723-he might to dissemble ; so [he]723-he bent the knee to [her]722-her , and spoke boldly to [her]722-her in [her]722-her own vein , and said : " Nay , [most gracious of [ladies]1963-ladies]1962-most gracious of ladies , never would [I]723-he abide behind to - day since [thou]1942-my maid farest afield . But if [my]723-he speech be hampered , or [mine]723-he eyes stray , is it not because [my]723-he mind is confused by [thy]1942-my maid beauty , and the honey of kind words which floweth from [thy]1942-my maid mouth ? "[723-he]

[She]722-her laughed outright at [his]723-he word , but not disdainfully , and said : " This is well spoken , [Squire]61-squire , and even what [a squire]1964-a squire should say to [[his]1964-a squire liege lady]1965-his liege lady , when the sun is up on a fair morning , and [she]1965-his liege lady and [he]1964-a squire and all [the world]118-the world are glad . "[722-her]

[She]722-her stood quite near [him]723-he as [she]722-her spoke , [her]722-her hand was on [his]723-he shoulder , and [her]722-her eyes shone and sparkled . [Sooth]62-sooth to say , that excusing of [his]723-he confusion was like enough in seeming to the truth ; for sure never creature was fashioned fairer than [she]722-her : clad [she]722-her was for the greenwood as [the hunting - goddess of [the Gentiles]63-the gentiles]726-the hunting - goddess of the gentiles , with [her]722-her green gown gathered unto [her]722-her girdle , and sandals on [her]722-her feet ; a bow in [her]722-her hand and a quiver at [her]722-her back : [she]722-her was taller and bigger of fashion than [the dear Maiden , whiter of flesh , and more glorious , and brighter of hair]727-the dear maiden , whiter of flesh , and more glorious , and brighter of hair ; as a flower of flowers for fairness and fragrance .

[She]722-her said : " [Thou]1967-thou art verily [a fair squire]1968-a fair squire before the hunt is up , and if [thou]1967-thou be as good in the hunting , all will be better than well , and [the guest]1969-the guest will be welcome . But lo ! here cometh [[our]1970-our Maid]1971-our maid with [the good grey ones]1956-the good grey ones . Go meet [her]543-the maid , and [we]1970-our will tarry no longer than for [thy]543-the maid taking the leash in hand . "[722-her]

So [Walter]35-walter looked , and saw [the Maid]543-the maid coming with two couple of great hounds in the leash straining against [her]543-the maid as [she]543-the maid came along . [He]35-walter ran lightly to meet [her]543-the maid , wondering if [he]35-walter should have a look , or a half - whisper from [her]543-the maid ; but [she]543-the maid let [him]35-walter take the white thongs from [her]543-the maid hand , with the same half- smile of shamefacedness still set on [her]543-the maid face , and , going past [him]35-walter , came softly up to [the Lady]576-the lady , swaying like a willow - branch in the wind , and stood before [her]576-the lady , with [her]576-the lady arms hanging down by [her]576-the lady sides . Then [the Lady]576-the lady turned to [her]576-the lady , and said : " Look to [thyself]576-the lady , [[our]1973-our Maid]1971-our maid , while [we]1973-our are away . [This fair young man]1975-this fair young man [thou]576-the lady needest not to fear indeed , for [he]1975-this fair young man is good and leal ; but what [thou]576-the lady shalt do with [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son [I]576-the lady wot not . [He]1975-this fair young man is [a hot lover forsooth]1978-a hot lover forsooth , but [a hard man]1979-a hard man ; and whiles evil is [his]1975-this fair young man mood , and perilous both to [thee]576-the lady and [me]576-the lady . And if [thou]576-the lady do [his]1975-this fair young man will , it shall be ill for [thee]576-the lady ; and if [thou]576-the lady do it not , take heed of [him]1975-this fair young man , and let [me]576-the lady , and [me]576-the lady only , come between [his]1975-this fair young man wrath and [thee]576-the lady . [I]576-the lady may do somewhat for [thee]576-the lady . Even yesterday [he]1975-this fair young man was instant with [me]576-the lady to have [thee]576-the lady chastised after the manner of thralls ; but [I]576-the lady bade [him]1975-this fair young man keep silence of such words , and jeered [him]1975-this fair young man and mocked [him]1975-this fair young man , till [he]1975-this fair young man went away from [me]576-the lady peevish and in anger . So look to it that [thou]576-the lady fall not into any trap of [his]1975-this fair young man contrivance . "[576-the lady]

Then [the Maid]543-the maid cast [herself]543-the maid at [the Mistress]1828-the mistress 's feet , and kissed and embraced [them]733-us ; and as [she]543-the maid rose up , [the Lady]576-the lady laid [her]576-the lady hand lightly on [her]576-the lady head , and then , turning to [Walter]35-walter , cried out : " Now , [Squire]61-squire , let [us]733-us leave all these troubles and wiles and desires behind [us]733-us , and flit through the merry greenwood like [the Gentiles of old days]1980-the gentiles of old days . "[576-the lady]

And therewith [she]576-the lady drew up the laps of [her]576-the lady gown till the whiteness of [her]576-the lady knees was seen , and set off swiftly toward [the wood that lay south of [the house]112-the house]735-the wood that lay south of the house , and [Walter]35-walter followed , marvelling at [her]576-the lady goodliness ; nor durst [he]35-walter cast a look backward to [the Maiden]183-the maiden , for [he]35-walter knew that [she]183-the maiden desired [him]35-walter , and it was [her]183-the maiden only that [he]35-walter looked to for [his]35-walter deliverance from this house of guile and lies .

CHAPTER XIV : THE HUNTING OF [THE HART]64-the hart

As [they]738-they went , [they]738-they found a change in [the land]101-the land , which grew emptier of big and wide - spreading trees , and more beset with thickets . From one of these [they]738-they roused a hart , and [Walter]35-walter let slip [his]35-walter hounds thereafter and [he]35-walter and [the Lady]576-the lady followed running . Exceeding swift was [she]576-the lady , and well - breathed withal , so that [Walter]35-walter wondered at [her]576-the lady ; and eager [she]576-the lady was in the chase as the very hounds , heeding nothing the scratching of briars or the whipping of stiff twigs as [she]576-the lady sped on . But for all [their]738-they eager hunting , [the quarry]741-the quarry outran both dogs and [folk]598-folk , and gat [him]741-the quarry into a great thicket , amidmost whereof was a wide plash of water . Into the thicket [they]738-they followed [him]741-the quarry , but [he]741-the quarry took to the water under [their]738-they eyes and made [land on the other side]743-land on the other side ; and because of the tangle of underwood , [he]741-the quarry swam across much faster than [they]738-they might have any hope to come round on [him]741-the quarry ; and so were [the hunters left undone for that time]744-the hunters left undone for that time .

So [the Lady]576-the lady cast [herself]576-the lady down on [the green grass]746-the green grass anigh [the water]527-the water , while [Walter]35-walter blew the hounds in and coupled them up ; then [he]35-walter turned round to [her]576-the lady , and lo ! [she]576-the lady was weeping for despite that [they]738-they had lost the quarry ; and again did [Walter]35-walter wonder that so little a matter should raise a passion of tears in [her]576-the lady . [He]35-walter durst not ask what ailed [her]576-the lady , or proffer [her]576-the lady solace , but was not ill apaid by beholding [her]576-the lady loveliness as [she]576-the lady lay .

Presently [she]576-the lady raised up [her]576-the lady head and turned to [Walter]35-walter , and spake to [him]35-walter angrily and said : " [Squire]61-squire , why dost [thou]1981-thou stand staring at [me]576-the lady like [a fool]1982-a fool ? "[576-the lady]

" [Yea]1983-yea , [Lady]1863-lady , "[35-walter] [he]35-walter said ; " but the sight of [thee]576-the lady maketh [me]35-walter foolish to do aught else but to look on [thee]576-the lady . "[35-walter]

[She]576-the lady said , in a peevish voice : " [Tush]45-tush , [Squire]1985-squire , the day is too far spent for soft and courtly speeches ; what was good there is nought so good here . [Withal]59-withal , [I]576-the lady know more of thine heart than [thou]1981-thou deemest . "[576-the lady]

[Walter]35-walter hung down [his]35-walter head and reddened , and [she]576-the lady looked on [him]35-walter , and [her]576-the lady face changed , and [she]576-the lady smiled and said , kindly this time : " Look [ye]1985-squire , [Squire]61-squire , [I]576-the lady am hot and weary , and ill - content ; but presently it will be better with [me]576-the lady ; for [my]576-the lady knees have been telling [my]576-the lady shoulders that the cold water of [this little lake]1986-this little lake will be sweet and pleasant this summer noonday , and that [I]576-the lady shall forget [my]576-the lady foil when [I]576-the lady have taken [my]576-the lady pleasure therein . Wherefore , go [thou]1987-thou with thine hounds without the thicket and there abide [my]576-the lady coming . And [I]576-the lady bid [thee]749-her look not aback as [thou]1987-thou goest , for therein were peril to [thee]749-her : [I]576-the lady shall not keep [thee]749-her tarrying long alone . "[576-the lady]

[He]748-he bowed [his]748-he head to [her]749-her , and turned and went [his]748-he ways . And now , when [he]748-he was a little space away from [her]749-her , [he]748-he deemed [her]749-her indeed a marvel of [women]750-women , and wellnigh forgat all [his]748-he doubts and fears concerning [her]749-her , whether [she]749-her were [a fair image fashioned out of lies and guile]751-a fair image fashioned out of lies and guile , or it might be but an evil thing in the shape of [a goodly woman]752-a goodly woman . Forsooth , when [he]748-he saw [her]749-her caressing [the dear and friendly Maid]753-the dear and friendly maid , [his]748-he heart all turned against [her]749-her , despite what [his]748-he eyes and [his]748-he ears told [his]748-he mind , and [she]749-her seemed like as it were a serpent enfolding the simplicity of the body which [he]748-he loved .

But now it was all changed , and [he]748-he lay on the grass and longed for [her]749-her coming ; which was delayed for somewhat more than an hour . Then [she]749-her came back to [him]748-he , smiling and fresh and cheerful , [her]749-her green gown let down to [her]749-her heels .

[He]748-he sprang up to meet [her]749-her , and [she]749-her came close to [him]748-he , and spake from a laughing face : " [Squire]61-squire , hast [thou]748-he no meat in [thy]748-he wallet ? For , [meseemeth]65-meseemeth , [I]749-her fed [thee]748-he when [thou]748-he wert hungry the other day ; do [thou]748-he now the same by [me]749-her . "[749-her]

[He]748-he smiled , and louted to [her]749-her , and took [his]748-he wallet and brought out thence bread and flesh and wine , and spread them all out before [her]749-her on the green grass , and then stood by humbly before [her]749-her . But [she]749-her said : " Nay , [[my]749-her Squire]1938-my squire , sit down by [me]749-her and eat with [me]749-her , for to - day are [we]754-they both hunters together . "[749-her]

So [he]748-he sat down by [her]749-her trembling , but neither for awe of [her]749-her greatness , nor for fear and horror of [her]749-her guile and sorcery .

A while [they]754-they sat there together after [they]754-they had done [their]754-they meat , and [the Lady]576-the lady fell a - talking with [Walter]35-walter concerning the parts of [the earth]1629-the earth , and the manners of [men]165-men , and of [his]35-walter journeyings to and fro .

At last [she]749-her said : " [Thou]1989-thou hast told [me]749-her much and answered all [my]749-her questions wisely , and as [[my]749-her good Squire]1990-my good squire should , and that pleaseth [me]749-her . But now tell [me]749-her of [the city wherein [thou]1989-thou wert born and bred]1991-the city wherein thou wert born and bred ; [a city whereof [thou]1989-thou hast hitherto told [me]749-her nought]1992-a city whereof thou hast hitherto told me nought . "[749-her]

" [Lady]1863-lady , "[35-walter] [he]35-walter said , " [it]1991-the city wherein thou wert born and bred is a fair and [a great city]1994-a great city , and to [many]1596-many [it]1991-the city wherein thou wert born and bred seemeth lovely . But [I]749-her have left [it]1991-the city wherein thou wert born and bred , and now it is nothing to [me]749-her . "[749-her]

" Hast [thou]1989-thou not kindred [there]1739-there ? "[758-she] said [she]758-she .

" [Yea]1997-yea , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter , " and [foemen withal]1998-foemen withal ; and [a false woman]1999-a false woman waylayeth [my]35-walter life there . "[35-walter]

" And what was [she]1999-a false woman ? "[576-the lady] said [the Lady]576-the lady .

Said [Walter]35-walter : " [She]1999-a false woman was but [[my]35-walter wife]2000-my wife . "[35-walter]

" Was [she]1999-a false woman fair ? "[576-the lady] said [the Lady]576-the lady .

[Walter]35-walter looked on [her]576-the lady a while , and then said : " [I]35-walter was going to say that [she]1999-a false woman was wellnigh as fair as [thou]1989-thou ; but that may scarce be . Yet was [she]1999-a false woman very fair . But now , [kind and gracious Lady]2001-kind and gracious lady , [I]35-walter will say this word to [thee]576-the lady : [I]35-walter marvel that [thou]1989-thou askest so many things concerning [the city of [Langton]35-walter on [Holm]3-holm]2002-the city of langton on holm , where [I]35-walter was born , and where are [my]35-walter kindred yet ; for [meseemeth]2003-meseemeth that [thou]1989-thou knowest it thyself . "[35-walter]

" [I]576-the lady know it , [I]576-the lady ? "[576-the lady] said [the Lady]576-the lady .

" What , then ! [thou]1989-thou knowest it not ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

Spake [the Lady]576-the lady , and some of [her]576-the lady old disdain was in [her]576-the lady words : " Dost [thou]1989-thou deem that [I]576-the lady wander about [the world]118-the world and [its cheaping - steads]2005-its cheaping - steads like [one of [the chap - men]2007-the chap - men]2006-one of the chap - men ? Nay , [I]576-the lady dwell in [the Wood]14-the wood beyond [the World]1-the world , and nowhere else . What hath put this word into [thy]576-the lady mouth ? "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter said : " Pardon [me]35-walter , [Lady]1863-lady , if [I]35-walter have misdone ; but thus it was : [Mine]35-walter own eyes beheld [thee]576-the lady going down [the quays of [[our]2010-our city]2011-our city]2009-the quays of our city , and thence [a ship - board]2012-a ship - board , and [the ship]155-the ship sailed out of [the haven]1551-the haven . And first of all went [a strange dwarf , whom [I]35-walter have seen here]2015-a strange dwarf , whom i have seen here , and then [[thy]576-the lady Maid]1914-thy maid ; and then went [thy]576-the lady gracious and lovely body . "[35-walter]

[The Lady]576-the lady 's face changed as [he]35-walter spoke , and [she]576-the lady turned red and then pale , and set [her]576-the lady teeth ; but [she]576-the lady refrained [her]576-the lady , and said : " [Squire]1985-squire , [I]576-the lady see of [thee]1985-squire that [thou]1985-squire art [no liar]2018-no liar , nor light of wit , therefore [I]576-the lady suppose that [thou]1985-squire hast verily seen some appearance of [me]576-the lady ; but never have [I]576-the lady been in [Langton]35-walter , nor thought thereof , nor known that such a stead there was until [thou]1985-squire namedst it e'en now . Wherefore , [I]576-the lady deem that [an enemy]2019-an enemy hath cast the shadow of [me]576-the lady on [the air of [that land]342-that land]2020-the air of that land . "[576-the lady]

" [Yea]2022-yea , [[my]35-walter Lady]1767-my lady , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter ; " and what enemy mightest [thou]1985-squire have to have done this ? "[35-walter]

[She]764-her was slow of answer , but spake at last from a quivering mouth of anger : " Knowest [thou]1985-squire not the saw , that [[a man]229-a man 's foes]2025-a man 's foes are [they]2025-a man 's foes of [[his]229-a man own house]2026-his own house ? If [I]764-her find out for a truth who hath done this , [the said enemy]2027-the said enemy shall have an evil hour with [me]764-her . "[764-her]

Again [she]764-her was silent , and [she]764-her clenched [her]764-her hands and strained [her]764-her limbs in the heat of [her]764-her anger ; so that [Walter]35-walter was afraid of [her]764-her , and all [his]35-walter misgivings came back to [his]35-walter heart again , and [he]35-walter repented that [he]35-walter had told [her]764-her so much . But in a little while all that trouble and wrath seemed to flow off [her]764-her , and again was [she]764-her of good cheer , and kind and sweet to [him]35-walter and [she]764-her said : " But in sooth , however it may be , [I]764-her thank [thee]35-walter , [[my]764-her Squire]1938-my squire and friend , for telling [me]764-her hereof . And surely no wyte do [I]764-her lay on [thee]35-walter . And , moreover , is it not this vision which hath brought [thee]35-walter hither ? "[764-her]

" So it is , [Lady]1863-lady , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter .

" Then have [we]2030-we to thank it , "[576-the lady] said [the Lady]576-the lady , " and [thou]35-walter art welcome to [[our]2030-we land]2031-our land . "[576-the lady]

And therewith [she]764-her held out [her]764-her hand to [him]35-walter , and [he]35-walter took it on [his]35-walter knees and kissed it : and then it was as if a red - hot iron had run through [his]35-walter heart , and [he]35-walter felt faint , and bowed down [his]35-walter head . But [he]35-walter held [her]764-her hand yet , and kissed it many times , and the wrist and the arm , and knew not where [he]35-walter was .

But [she]764-her drew a little away from [him]35-walter , and arose and said : " Now is the day wearing , and if [we]2030-we are to bear back any venison [we]2030-we must buckle to the work . So arise , [Squire]61-squire , and take the hounds and come with [me]764-her ; for not far off is a little thicket which mostly harbours foison of deer , great and small . Let [us]2030-we come [our]2030-we ways . "[764-her]

CHAPTER XV : THE SLAYING OF [THE QUARRY]741-the quarry

So [they]767-they walked on quietly thence some half a mile , and ever [the Lady]576-the lady would have [Walter]35-walter to walk by [her]764-her side , and not follow a little behind [her]764-her , as was meet for [a servant]769-a servant to do ; and [she]764-her touched [his]35-walter hand at whiles as [she]764-her showed [him]35-walter beast and fowl and tree , and the sweetness of [her]764-her body overcame [him]35-walter , so that for a while [he]35-walter thought of nothing save [her]764-her .

Now when [they]767-they were come to the thicket - side , [she]764-her turned to [him]35-walter and said : " [Squire]61-squire , [I]764-her am [no ill woodman]2032-no ill woodman , so that [thou]2033-thou mayst trust [me]764-her that [we]767-they shall not be brought to shame the second time ; and [I]764-her shall do sagely ; so nock an arrow to [thy]2033-thou bow , and abide [me]764-her here , and stir not hence ; for [I]764-her shall enter [this thicket]2034-this thicket without the hounds , and arouse the quarry for [thee]2033-thou ; and see that [thou]2033-thou be brisk and clean - shooting , and then shalt [thou]2033-thou have a reward of [me]764-her . "[764-her]

Therewith [she]764-her drew up [her]764-her skirts through [her]764-her girdle again , took [her]764-her bent bow in [her]764-her hand , and drew an arrow out of the quiver , and stepped lightly into the thicket , leaving [him]770-he longing for the sight of [her]764-her , as [he]770-he hearkened to the tread of [her]764-her feet on the dry leaves , and the rustling of the brake as [she]764-her thrust through it .

Thus [he]770-he stood for a few minutes , and then [he]770-he heard a kind of gibbering cry without words , yet as of [a woman]526-a woman , coming from the thicket , and while [his]770-he heart was yet gathering the thought that something had gone amiss , [he]770-he glided swiftly , but with little stir , into the brake .

[He]770-he had gone but a little way ere [he]770-he saw [the Lady]576-the lady standing there in [a narrow clearing]773-a narrow clearing , [her]576-the lady face pale as death , [her]576-the lady knees cleaving together , [her]576-the lady body swaying and tottering , [her]576-the lady hands hanging down , and the bow and arrow fallen to the ground ; and ten yards before [her]576-the lady [a great - headed yellow creature crouching flat to the earth and slowly drawing nigher]774-a great - headed yellow creature crouching flat to the earth and slowly drawing nigher .

[He]770-he stopped short ; one arrow was already notched to the string , and another hung loose to the lesser fingers of [his]770-he string - hand . [He]770-he raised [his]770-he right hand , and drew and loosed in a twinkling ; the shaft flew close to [the Lady]576-the lady 's side , and straightway all the wood rung with a huge roar , as the yellow lion turned about to bite at the shaft which had sunk deep into [him]770-he behind the shoulder , as if a bolt out of the heavens had smitten [him]770-he . But [straightway]66-straightway had [Walter]35-walter loosed again , and then , throwing down [his]35-walter bow , [he]35-walter ran forward with [his]35-walter drawn sword gleaming in [his]35-walter hand , while the lion weltered and rolled , but had no might to move forward . Then [Walter]35-walter went up to [him]770-he warily and thrust [him]770-he through to the heart , and leapt aback , lest the beast might yet have life in [him]35-walter to smite ; but [he]35-walter left [his]35-walter struggling , [his]35-walter huge voice died out , and [he]35-walter lay there moveless before [the hunter]776-the hunter .

[Walter]35-walter abode a little , facing [him]770-he , and then turned about to [the Lady]576-the lady , and [she]576-the lady had fallen down in a heap whereas [she]576-the lady stood , and lay there all huddled up and voiceless . So [he]35-walter knelt down by [her]576-the lady , and lifted up [her]576-the lady head , and bade [her]576-the lady arise , for [the foe]557-the foe was slain . And after a little [she]576-the lady stretched out [her]576-the lady limbs , and turned about on the grass , and seemed to sleep , and the colour came into [her]576-the lady face again , and it grew soft and a little smiling . Thus [she]576-the lady lay awhile , and [Walter]35-walter sat by [her]576-the lady watching [her]576-the lady , till at last [she]576-the lady opened [her]576-the lady eyes and sat up , and knew [him]35-walter , and smiling on [him]35-walter said : " What hath befallen , [Squire]1985-squire , that [I]576-the lady have slept and dreamed ? "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter answered nothing , till [her]576-the lady memory came back to [her]576-the lady , and then [she]576-the lady arose , trembling and pale , and said : " Let [us]779-thou leave this wood , for [the Enemy]2036-the enemy is therein . "[576-the lady]

And [she]576-the lady hastened away before [him]35-walter till [they]779-thou came out at the thicket - side whereas the hounds had been left , and [they]779-thou were standing there uneasy and whining ; so [Walter]35-walter coupled [them]779-thou , while [the Lady]576-the lady stayed not , but went away swiftly homeward , and [Walter]35-walter followed .

At last [she]576-the lady stayed [her]576-the lady swift feet , and turned round on [Walter]35-walter , and said : " [Squire]61-squire , come hither . "[576-the lady]

So did [he]35-walter , and [she]576-the lady said : " [I]576-the lady am weary again ; let [us]779-thou sit under this quicken- tree , and rest [us]779-thou . "[576-the lady]

So [they]779-thou sat down , and [she]576-the lady sat looking between [her]576-the lady knees a while ; and at last [she]576-the lady said : " Why didst [thou]779-thou not bring the lion 's hide ? "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter said : " [Lady]1863-lady , [I]35-walter will go back and flay the beast , and bring on the hide . "[35-walter]

And [he]35-walter arose therewith , but [she]576-the lady caught [him]35-walter by the skirts and drew [him]35-walter down , and said : " Nay , [thou]779-thou shalt not go ; abide with [me]576-the lady . Sit down again . "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter did so , and [she]576-the lady said : " [Thou]779-thou shalt not go from [me]576-the lady ; for [I]576-the lady am afraid : [I]576-the lady am not used to looking on the face of death . "[576-the lady]

[She]576-the lady grew pale as [she]576-the lady spoke , and set a hand to [her]576-the lady breast , and sat so a while without speaking . At last [she]576-the lady turned to [him]35-walter smiling , and said : " How was it with the aspect of [me]576-the lady when [I]576-the lady stood before the peril of [the Enemy]2036-the enemy ? "[576-the lady] And [she]576-the lady laid a hand upon [his]35-walter .

" [O gracious one]2039-o gracious one , "[35-walter] quoth [he]35-walter , " [thou]779-thou wert , as ever , full lovely , but [I]35-walter feared for [thee]576-the lady . "[35-walter]

[She]576-the lady moved not [her]576-the lady hand from [his]35-walter , and [she]576-the lady said : " Good and true [Squire]61-squire , [I]576-the lady said ere [I]576-the lady entered the thicket e'en now that [I]576-the lady would reward [thee]35-walter if [thou]779-thou slewest the quarry . [He]35-walter is dead , though [thou]779-thou hast left the skin behind upon the carcase . Ask now [thy]779-thou reward , but take time to think what it shall be . "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter felt [her]576-the lady hand warm upon [his]35-walter , and drew in the sweet odour of [her]576-the lady mingled with the woodland scents under the hot sun of the afternoon , and [his]35-walter heart was clouded with manlike desire of [her]576-the lady . And it was a near thing but [he]35-walter had spoken , and craved of [her]576-the lady the reward of the freedom of [[her]576-the lady Maid]781-her maid , and that [he]35-walter might depart with [her]576-the lady into [other lands]1554-other lands ; but as [his]35-walter mind wavered betwixt this and that , [the Lady]576-the lady , who had been eyeing [him]35-walter keenly , drew [her]576-the lady hand away from [him]35-walter ; and therewith doubt and fear flowed into [his]35-walter mind , and [he]35-walter refrained [him]35-walter of speech .

Then [she]576-the lady laughed merrily and said : " [The good Squire]2040-the good squire is shamefaced ; [he]2040-the good squire feareth [a lady]150-a lady more than a lion . Will it be a reward to [thee]35-walter if [I]576-the lady bid [thee]35-walter to kiss [my]576-the lady cheek ? "[576-the lady]

Therewith [she]576-the lady leaned [her]576-the lady face toward [him]35-walter , and [he]35-walter kissed [her]576-the lady well - favouredly , and then sat gazing on [her]576-the lady , wondering what should betide to [him]35-walter on the morrow .

Then [she]576-the lady arose and said : " Come , [Squire]1985-squire , and let [us]784-they [home]1557-home ; be not abashed , there shall be other rewards hereafter . "[576-the lady]

So [they]784-they went [their]784-they ways quietly ; and it was nigh sunset against [they]784-they entered [the house]112-the house again . [Walter]35-walter looked round for [the Maid]543-the maid , but beheld [her]543-the maid not ; and [the Lady]576-the lady said to [him]35-walter : " [I]576-the lady go to [[my]576-the lady chamber]2044-my chamber , and now is [thy]35-walter service over for this day . "[576-the lady]

Then [she]576-the lady nodded to [him]35-walter friendly and went [her]576-the lady ways .

CHAPTER XVI : OF [THE KING]1780-the king 'S [SON]1556-son AND [THE MAID]543-the maid

But as for [Walter]35-walter , [he]35-walter went out of [the house]112-the house again , and fared slowly over [the woodlawns]792-the woodlawns till [he]35-walter came to another close thicket or brake ; [he]35-walter entered from mere wantonness , or that [he]35-walter might be the more apart and hidden , so as to think over [his]35-walter case . There [he]35-walter lay down under the thick boughs , but could not so herd [his]35-walter thoughts that [they]793-they would dwell steady in looking into what might come to [him]35-walter within the next days ; rather visions of [those two women]794-those two women and [the monster]1829-the monster did but float before [him]35-walter , and fear and desire and the hope of life ran to and fro in [his]35-walter mind .

As [he]35-walter lay thus [he]35-walter heard footsteps drawing near , and [he]35-walter looked between the boughs , and though the sun had just set , [he]35-walter could see close by [him]35-walter [a man]229-a man and [a woman]526-a woman going slowly , and [they]798-they hand in hand ; at first [he]35-walter deemed it would be [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son and [the Lady]576-the lady , but presently [he]35-walter saw that it was [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son indeed , but that it was [the Maid whom [he]35-walter was holding by the hand]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand . And now [he]35-walter saw of [him]35-walter that [his]35-walter eyes were bright with desire , and of [her]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand that [she]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand was very pale . Yet when [he]35-walter heard [her]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand begin to speak , it was in a steady voice that [she]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand said : " [[King]67-king 's Son]1928-king 's son , [thou]2046-thou hast threatened [me]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand oft and unkindly , and now [thou]2046-thou threatenest [me]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand again , and no less unkindly . But whatever were [thy]2046-thou need herein before , now is there no more need ; for [[my]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand Mistress , of whom [thou]2046-thou wert weary]2047-my mistress , of whom thou wert weary , is now grown weary of [thee]2046-thou , and belike will not now reward [me]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand for drawing [thy]2046-thou love to [me]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand , as once [she]2047-my mistress , of whom thou wert weary would have done ; to wit , before the coming of [this stranger]2048-this stranger . Therefore [I]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand say , since [I]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand am but a thrall , poor and helpless , betwixt [[you]2046-thou two mighty ones]2049-you two mighty ones , [I]804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand have no choice but to do [thy]2046-thou will . "[804-the maid whom he was holding by the hand]

As [she]805-she spoke [she]805-she looked all round about [her]805-she , as [one distraught by the anguish of fear]806-one distraught by the anguish of fear . [Walter]35-walter , amidst of [his]35-walter wrath and grief , had wellnigh drawn [his]35-walter sword and rushed out of [[his]35-walter lair]807-his lair upon [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son . But [he]35-walter deemed it sure that , so doing , [he]35-walter should undo [the Maid]543-the maid altogether , and [himself]35-walter also belike , so [he]35-walter refrained [him]35-walter , though it were a hard matter .

[The Maid]543-the maid had stayed [her]543-the maid feet now close to where [Walter]35-walter lay , some five yards from [him]35-walter only , and [he]35-walter doubted whether [she]543-the maid saw [him]35-walter not from where [she]543-the maid stood . As to [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , [he]35-walter was so intent upon [the Maid]543-the maid , and so greedy of [her]543-the maid beauty , that it was not like that [he]35-walter saw anything .

Now [moreover Walter]35-walter looked , and deemed that [he]35-walter beheld something through the grass and bracken on the other side of those two , an ugly brown and yellow body , which , if it were not [some beast of the foumart kind]815-some beast of the foumart kind , must needs be [the monstrous dwarf]816-the monstrous dwarf , or one of [[his]35-walter kin]817-his kin ; and the flesh crept upon [Walter]35-walter 's bones with the horror of [him]35-walter . But [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son spoke unto [the Maid]543-the maid : " [Sweetling]68-sweetling , [I]1781-the king 's son shall take the gift [thou]543-the maid givest [me]1781-the king 's son , neither shall [I]1781-the king 's son threaten [thee]543-the maid any more , howbeit [thou]543-the maid givest it not very gladly or graciously . "[1781-the king 's son]

[She]543-the maid smiled on [him]35-walter with [her]543-the maid lips alone , for [her]543-the maid eyes were wandering and haggard . " [[My]543-the maid lord]2050-my lord , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said , " is not this the manner of [women]750-women ? "[543-the maid]

" Well , "[35-walter] [he]35-walter said , " [I]35-walter say that [I]35-walter will take [thy]543-the maid love even so given . Yet let [me]35-walter hear again that [thou]543-the maid lovest [not that vile newcomer]2052-not that vile newcomer , and that [thou]543-the maid hast not seen [him]35-walter , save this morning along with [[my]35-walter Lady]1767-my lady . Nay now , [thou]543-the maid shalt swear it . "[35-walter]

" What shall [I]543-the maid swear by ? "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said .

Quoth [he]35-walter , " [Thou]543-the maid shalt swear by [my]35-walter body ; "[35-walter] and therewith [he]35-walter thrust [himself]35-walter close up against [her]543-the maid ; but [she]543-the maid drew [her]543-the maid hand from [his]35-walter , and laid it on [his]35-walter breast , and said : " [I]543-the maid swear it by [thy]35-walter body . "[543-the maid]

[He]35-walter smiled on [her]543-the maid licorously , and took [her]543-the maid by the shoulders , and kissed [her]543-the maid face many times , and then stood aloof from [her]543-the maid , and said : " Now have [I]35-walter had hansel : but tell [me]35-walter , when shall [I]35-walter come to [thee]543-the maid ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid spoke out clearly : " Within three days at furthest ; [I]543-the maid will do [thee]35-walter to wit of the day and the hour to - morrow , or the day after . "[543-the maid]

[He]35-walter kissed [her]543-the maid once more , and said : " Forget it not , or the threat holds good . "[35-walter]

And therewith [he]35-walter turned about and went [his]35-walter ways toward [the house]112-the house ; and [Walter]35-walter saw the yellow - brown thing creeping after [him]35-walter in the gathering dusk .

As for [the Maid]543-the maid , [she]543-the maid stood for a while without moving , and looking after [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son and the creature that followed [him]35-walter . Then [she]543-the maid turned about to where [Walter]35-walter lay and lightly put aside the boughs , and [Walter]35-walter leapt up , and [they]824-they stood face to face . [She]543-the maid said softly but eagerly : " [Friend]1695-friend , touch [me]543-the maid not yet ! "[543-the maid]

[He]35-walter spake not , but looked on [her]543-the maid sternly . [She]543-the maid said : " [Thou]35-walter art angry with [me]543-the maid ? "[543-the maid]

Still [he]35-walter spake not ; but [she]543-the maid said : " [Friend]1695-friend , this at least [I]825-i will pray [thee]35-walter ; not to play with life and death ; with happiness and misery . Dost [thou]35-walter not remember the oath which [we]824-they swore each to [each]2056-each but a little while ago ? And dost [thou]35-walter deem that [I]825-i have changed in these few days ? Is [thy]35-walter mind concerning [thee]35-walter and [me]825-i the same as it was ? If it be not so , now tell [me]825-i . For now have [I]825-i the mind to do as if neither [thou]35-walter nor [I]825-i are changed to [each other]421-each other , whoever may have kissed [mine]825-i unwilling lips , or whomsoever [thy]35-walter lips may have kissed . But if [thou]35-walter hast changed , and wilt no longer give [me]825-i [thy]35-walter love , nor crave [mine]825-i , then shall this steel "[825-i] and [she]825-i drew a sharp knife from [her]825-i girdle " be for [the fool]2058-the fool and [the dastard who hath made [thee]35-walter wroth with [me]825-i , [[my]825-i friend]1798-my friend , and [[my]825-i friend]1798-my friend that [I]825-i deemed [I]825-i had won . And then let come what will come]2059-the dastard who hath made thee wroth with me , my friend , and my friend that i deemed i had won . and then let come what will come ! But if [thou]35-walter be nought changed , and the oath yet holds , then , when a little while hath passed , may [we]2062-us thrust all evil and guile and grief behind [us]2062-us , and long joy shall lie before [us]2062-us , and long life , and all honour in death : if only [thou]35-walter wilt do as [I]825-i bid [thee]35-walter , O [[my]825-i dear]1794-my dear , and [[my]825-i friend]1798-my friend , and [[my]825-i first friend]2065-my first friend ! "[825-i]

[He]826-his looked on [her]827-i , and [his]826-his breast heaved up as all the sweetness of [her]827-i kind love took hold on [him]826-his , and [his]826-his face changed , and the tears filled [his]826-his eyes and ran over , and rained down before [her]827-i , and [he]826-his stretched out [his]826-his hand toward [her]827-i .

Then [she]827-i said exceeding sweetly : " Now indeed [I]827-i see that it is well with [me]827-i , [yea]826-his , and with [thee]826-his also . A sore pain it is to [me]827-i , that not even now may [I]827-i take [thine]2066-thine hand , and cast [mine]827-i arms about [thee]827-i , and kiss the lips that love [me]827-i . But so it has to be . [[My]827-i dear]1794-my dear , even so [I]827-i were fain to stand here long before [thee]827-i , even if [we]2068-we spake no more word to [each other]421-each other ; but abiding here is perilous ; for there is ever an evil spy upon [my]827-i doings , who has now as [I]827-i deem followed [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son to [the house]112-the house , but who will return when [he]1781-the king 's son has tracked [him]1781-the king 's son [home thither]2073-home thither : so [we]2068-we must sunder . But belike there is yet time for a word or two : first , the rede which [I]827-i had thought on for [our]2068-we deliverance is now afoot , though [I]827-i durst not tell [thee]827-i thereof , nor have time thereto . But this much shall [I]827-i tell [thee]827-i , that whereas great is the craft of [[my]827-i Mistress]1816-my mistress in wizardry , yet [I]827-i also have some little craft therein , and this , which [she]1816-my mistress hath not , to change the aspect of [folk]598-folk so utterly that [they]598-folk seem other than [they]598-folk verily are ; yea , so that [one]1940-one may have the aspect of another . Now the next thing is this : whatsoever [[my]827-i Mistress]1816-my mistress may bid [thee]827-i , do [her]1816-my mistress will therein with no more nay - saying than [thou]827-i deemest may please [her]1816-my mistress . And the next thing : wheresoever [thou]827-i mayst meet [me]827-i , speak not to [me]827-i , make no sign to [me]827-i , even when [I]827-i seem to be all alone , till [I]827-i stoop down and touch the ring on [my]827-i ankle with [my]827-i right hand ; but if [I]827-i do so , then stay [thee]827-i , without fail , till [I]827-i speak . The last thing [I]827-i will say to [thee]827-i , [dear friend]1824-dear friend , ere [we]2079-we both go [our]2079-we ways , this it is . When [we]2079-we are free , and [thou]827-i knowest all that [I]827-i have done , [I]827-i pray [thee]827-i deem [me]827-i not evil and wicked , and be not wroth with [me]827-i for [my]827-i deed ; whereas [thou]827-i wottest well that [I]827-i am not in like plight with [other women]2080-other women . [I]827-i have heard tell that when [the knight]2081-the knight goeth to the war , and [hath]2081-the knight overcome [[his]2081-the knight foes]1895-his foes by the shearing of swords and guileful tricks , and hath come back [home]1557-home to [[his]2081-the knight own folk]244-his own folk , [they]244-his own folk praise [him]2081-the knight and bless [him]2081-the knight , and crown [him]2081-the knight with flowers , and boast of [him]2081-the knight before [God]44-god in [the minster]2085-the minster for [his]2081-the knight deliverance of [friend]1695-friend and [folk]598-folk and [city]2088-city . Why shouldst [thou]828-she be worse to [me]827-i than this ? Now is all said , [[my]827-i dear]1794-my dear and [[my]827-i friend]1798-my friend ; farewell , farewell ! "[827-i]

Therewith [she]828-she turned and went [her]828-she ways toward [the house]112-the house in all speed , but making somewhat of a compass . And when [she]828-she was gone , [Walter]35-walter knelt down and kissed the place where [her]828-she feet had been , and arose thereafter , and made [his]35-walter way toward [the house]112-the house , [he]35-walter also , but slowly , and staying oft on [his]35-walter way .

CHAPTER XVII : OF [THE HOUSE]112-the house AND THE PLEASANCE IN [THE WOOD]14-the wood

On the morrow morning [Walter]35-walter loitered a while about [the house]112-the house till [the morn]833-the morn was grown old , and then about noon [he]35-walter took [his]35-walter bow and arrows and went into [the woods]834-the woods to [the northward]835-the northward , to get [him]35-walter some venison . [He]35-walter went somewhat far ere [he]35-walter shot [him]35-walter a fawn , and then [he]35-walter sat [him]35-walter down to rest under the shade of a great chestnut - tree , for it was not far past the hottest of the day . [He]35-walter looked around thence and saw below [him]35-walter [a little dale with a pleasant stream running through]836-a little dale with a pleasant stream running through [it]836-a little dale with a pleasant stream running through , and [he]35-walter bethought [him]35-walter of bathing therein , so [he]35-walter went down and had [his]35-walter pleasure of [the water]527-the water and [the willowy banks]838-the willowy banks ; for [he]35-walter lay naked a while on the grass by the lip of [the water]527-the water , for joy of the flickering shade , and the little breeze that ran over the down - long ripples of [the stream]459-the stream .

Then [he]35-walter did on [his]35-walter raiment , and began to come [his]35-walter ways up the bent , but had scarce gone three steps ere [he]35-walter saw [a woman]526-a woman coming towards [him]35-walter from downstream . [His]35-walter heart came into [his]35-walter mouth when [he]35-walter saw [her]526-a woman , for [she]526-a woman stooped and reached down [her]526-a woman arm , as if [she]526-a woman would lay [her]526-a woman hand on [her]526-a woman ankle , so that at first [he]35-walter deemed it had been [the Maid]543-the maid , but at the second eye - shot [he]35-walter saw that it was [the Mistress]1828-the mistress . [She]526-a woman stood still and looked on [him]35-walter , so that [he]35-walter deemed [she]526-a woman would have [him]35-walter come to [her]526-a woman . So [he]35-walter went to meet [her]526-a woman , and grew somewhat shamefaced as [he]35-walter drew nigher , and wondered at [her]526-a woman , for now was [she]526-a woman clad but in one garment of some dark grey silky stuff , embroidered with , as it were , a garland of flowers about the middle , but which was so thin that , as the wind drifted it from side and limb , it hid [her]526-a woman no more , but for the said garland , than if water were running over [her]526-a woman : [her]526-a woman face was full of smiling joy and content as [she]526-a woman spake to [him]35-walter in a kind , caressing voice , and said : " [I]526-a woman give [thee]35-walter good day , [good Squire]2091-good squire , and well art [thou]35-walter met . "[526-a woman] And [she]526-a woman held out [her]526-a woman hand to [him]35-walter . [He]35-walter knelt down before [her]526-a woman and kissed it , and abode still upon [his]35-walter knees , and hanging down [his]35-walter head .

But [she]526-a woman laughed outright , and stooped down to [him]35-walter , and put [her]526-a woman hand to [his]35-walter arms , and raised [him]35-walter up , and said to [him]35-walter : " What is this , [[my]526-a woman Squire]1938-my squire , that [thou]35-walter kneelest to [me]526-a woman as to an idol ? "[526-a woman]

[He]35-walter said faltering : " [I]35-walter wot not ; but perchance [thou]35-walter art [an idol]2093-an idol ; and [I]35-walter fear [thee]35-walter . "[35-walter]

" What ! "[526-a woman] [she]526-a woman said , " more than yesterday , whenas [thou]35-walter sawest [me]526-a woman afraid ? "[526-a woman]

Said [he]35-walter : " [Yea]2094-yea , for that now [I]35-walter see [thee]35-walter unhidden , and [meseemeth]2095-meseemeth there hath been [none such since the old days of the Gentiles]2096-none such since the old days of the gentiles . "[35-walter]

[She]526-a woman said : " Hast [thou]35-walter not yet bethought [thee]35-walter of a gift to crave of [me]526-a woman , a reward for the slaying of [[mine]526-a woman enemy]2097-mine enemy , and the saving of [me]526-a woman from death ? "[526-a woman]

" O [[my]35-walter Lady]1767-my lady , "[35-walter] [he]35-walter said , " even so much would [I]35-walter have done for [any other lady]2099-any other lady , or , forsooth , for [any poor man]2100-any poor man ; for so [my]35-walter manhood would have bidden [me]35-walter . Speak not of gifts to [me]35-walter then . Moreover "[35-walter] and [he]35-walter reddened therewith , and [his]35-walter voice faltered , " didst [thou]2101-thou not give [me]35-walter [my]35-walter sweet reward yesterday ? What more durst [I]35-walter ask ? "[35-walter]

[She]844-i held [her]844-i peace awhile , and looked on [him]35-walter keenly ; and [he]35-walter reddened under [her]844-i gaze . Then wrath came into [her]844-i face , and [she]844-i reddened and knit [her]844-i brows , and spake to [him]35-walter in a voice of anger , and said : " Nay , what is this ? It is growing in [my]844-i mind that [thou]2101-thou deemest the gift of [me]844-i unworthy ! [Thou]2101-thou , [an alien]1777-an alien , [an outcast]2103-an outcast ; one endowed with the little wisdom of [the World]1-the world without [the Wood]14-the wood ! And [here]2104-here [I]844-i stand before [thee]2101-thou , all glorious in [my]844-i nakedness , and so fulfilled of wisdom , that [I]844-i can make this wilderness to [any whom [I]844-i love more full of joy than [the kingdoms and cities of [the world]118-the world]2106-the kingdoms and cities of the world]2105-any whom i love more full of joy than the kingdoms and cities of the world - and [thou]2101-thou ! - Ah , but it is the Enemy that hath done this , and made the guileless guileful ! Yet will [I]844-i have the upper hand at least , though [thou]2101-thou suffer for it , and [I]844-i suffer for [thee]845-her . "[844-i]

[Walter]35-walter stood before [her]845-her with hanging head , and [he]35-walter put forth [his]35-walter hands as if praying off [her]845-her anger , and pondered what answer [he]35-walter should make ; for now [he]35-walter feared for [himself]35-walter and [the Maid]543-the maid ; so at last [he]35-walter looked up to [her]845-her , and said boldly : " Nay , [Lady]1863-lady , [I]35-walter know what [thy]2101-thou words mean , whereas [I]35-walter remember [thy]2101-thou first welcome of [me]35-walter . [I]35-walter wot , forsooth , that [thou]2101-thou wouldst call [me]35-walter base - born , and of no account , and unworthy to touch the hem of [thy]2101-thou raiment ; and that [I]35-walter have been over - bold , and guilty towards [thee]845-her ; and doubtless this is sooth , and [I]35-walter have deserved thine anger : but [I]35-walter will not ask [thee]845-her to pardon [me]35-walter , for [I]35-walter have done but what [I]35-walter must needs . "[35-walter]

[She]845-her looked on [him]847-him calmly now , and without any wrath , but rather as if [she]845-her would read what was written in [his]847-him inmost heart . Then [her]845-her face changed into joyousness again , and [she]845-her smote [her]845-her palms together , and cried out : " This is but foolish talk ; for yesterday did [I]845-her see [thy]2101-thou valiancy , and to- day [I]845-her have seen [thy]2101-thou goodliness ; and [I]845-her say , that though [thou]2101-thou mightest not be good enough for [a fool woman of the earthly baronage]2109-a fool woman of the earthly baronage , yet art [thou]2101-thou good enough for [me]845-her , [the wise and the mighty]2110-the wise and the mighty , and [the lovely]2111-the lovely . And whereas [thou]2101-thou sayest that [I]845-her gave [thee]2101-thou but disdain when first [thou]2101-thou camest to [us]2112-us , grudge not against [me]845-her therefor , because it was done but to prove [thee]2101-thou ; and now [thou]2101-thou art proven . "[845-her]

Then again [he]848-his knelt down before [her]849-she , and embraced [her]849-she knees , and again [she]849-she raised [him]848-his up , and let [her]849-she arm hang down over [his]848-his shoulder , and [her]849-she cheek brush [his]848-his cheek ; and [she]849-she kissed [his]848-his mouth and said : " Hereby is all forgiven , both thine offence and [mine]849-she ; and now cometh joy and merry days . "[849-she]

Therewith [her]849-she smiling face grew grave , and [she]849-she stood before [him]848-his looking stately and gracious and kind at once , and [she]849-she took [his]848-his hand and said : " [Thou]2101-thou mightest deem [[my]849-she chamber in [the Golden House of the Wood]2114-the golden house of the wood over - queenly]2113-my chamber in the golden house of the wood over - queenly , since [thou]2101-thou art [no masterful man]2115-no masterful man . So now hast [thou]2101-thou chosen well the place wherein to meet [me]849-she to - day , for hard by on [the other side of the stream]2116-the other side of the stream is a bower of pleasance , which , forsooth , not every one who cometh to [this land]1735-this land may find ; there shall [I]849-she be to [thee]2101-thou as one of [the up- country damsels of [thine own land]2119-thine own land]2118-the up- country damsels of thine own land , and [thou]2101-thou shalt not be abashed . "[849-she]

[She]849-she sidled up to [him]848-his as [she]849-she spoke , and would [he]848-his , would [he]848-his not , [her]849-she sweet voice tickled [his]848-his very soul with pleasure , and [she]849-she looked aside on [him]848-his happy and well - content .

So [they]850-they crossed [the stream]459-the stream by [the shallow below the pool wherein [Walter]35-walter had bathed]852-the shallow below the pool wherein walter had bathed , and within a little [they]850-they came upon a tall fence of flake - hurdles , and a simple gate therein . [The Lady]576-the lady opened the same , and [they]850-they entered thereby into a close all planted as [a most fair garden , with hedges of rose and woodbine]854-a most fair garden , with hedges of rose and woodbine , and with linden - trees a - blossom , and [long ways of green grass betwixt borders of lilies and clove - gilliflowers]855-long ways of green grass betwixt borders of lilies and clove - gilliflowers , and other sweet garland - flowers . And a branch of [the stream which [they]850-they had crossed erewhile]856-the stream which they had crossed erewhile wandered through [that garden]857-that garden ; and in the midst was [a little house]858-a little house built of post and pan , and thatched with yellow straw , as if it were new done .

Then [Walter]35-walter looked this way and that , and wondered at first , and tried to think in [his]35-walter mind what should come next , and how matters would go with [him]35-walter ; but [his]35-walter thought would not dwell steady on any other matter than the beauty of [the Lady]576-the lady amidst the beauty of [the garden]860-the garden ; and withal [she]576-the lady was now grown so sweet and kind , and even somewhat timid and shy with [him]35-walter , that scarce did [he]35-walter know whose hand [he]35-walter held , or whose fragrant bosom and sleek side went so close to [him]35-walter .

So [they]850-they wandered here and there through the waning of the day , and when [they]850-they entered at last into [the cool dusk house]861-the cool dusk house , then [they]850-they loved and played together , as if [they]850-they were [a pair of lovers]862-a pair of lovers guileless , with no fear for the morrow , and no seeds of enmity and death sown betwixt [them]850-they .

CHAPTER XVIII : [THE MAID]543-the maid GIVES [WALTER]35-walter TRYST

Now , on the morrow , when [Walter]35-walter was awake , [he]35-walter found there was [no one]597-no one lying beside [him]35-walter , and the day was no longer very young ; so [he]35-walter arose , and went through [the garden]860-the garden from end to end , and all about , and there was none there ; and albeit that [he]35-walter dreaded to meet [the Lady there]866-the lady there , yet was [he]35-walter sad at heart and fearful of what might betide . Howsoever , [he]35-walter found the gate whereby [they]850-they had entered yesterday , and [he]35-walter went out into [the little dale]867-the little dale ; but when [he]35-walter had gone a step or two [he]35-walter turned about , and could see neither [garden]868-garden nor fence , nor any sign of what [he]35-walter had seen thereof but lately . [He]35-walter knit [his]35-walter brow and stood still to think of it , and [his]35-walter heart grew the heavier thereby ; but presently [he]35-walter went [his]35-walter ways and crossed [the stream]459-the stream , but had scarce come up on to the grass on the further side , ere [he]35-walter saw [a woman]526-a woman coming to meet [him]35-walter , and at first , full as [he]35-walter was of the tide of yesterday and [the wondrous garden]871-the wondrous garden , deemed that it would be [the Lady]576-the lady ; but [the woman]873-the woman stayed [her]873-the woman feet , and , stooping , laid a hand on [her]873-the woman right ankle , and [he]35-walter saw that it was [the Maid]543-the maid . [He]35-walter drew anigh to [her]873-the woman , and saw that [she]873-the woman was nought so sad of countenance as the last time [she]873-the woman had met [him]35-walter , but flushed of cheek and bright - eyed .

As [he]35-walter came up to [her]873-the woman [she]873-the woman made a step or two to meet [him]35-walter , holding out [her]873-the woman two hands , and then refrained [her]873-the woman , and said smiling : " Ah , [friend]1695-friend , belike this shall be the last time that [I]873-the woman shall say to [thee]873-the woman , touch [me]873-the woman not , nay , not so much as [my]873-the woman hand , or if it were but the hem of [my]873-the woman raiment . "[873-the woman]

The joy grew up in [his]35-walter heart , and [he]35-walter gazed on [her]873-the woman fondly , and said : " Why , what hath befallen of late ? "[35-walter]

" O [friend]1695-friend , "[873-the woman] [she]873-the woman began , " this hath befallen . "[873-the woman]

But as [he]35-walter looked on [her]873-the woman , the smile died from [her]873-the woman face , and [she]873-the woman became deadly pale to the very lips ; [she]873-the woman looked askance to [her]873-the woman left side , whereas ran [the stream]459-the stream ; and [Walter]35-walter followed [her]873-the woman eyes , and deemed for one instant that [he]35-walter saw the misshapen yellow visage of [the dwarf]182-the dwarf peering round from a grey rock , but the next there was nothing . Then [the Maid]543-the maid , though [she]543-the maid were as pale as death , went on in a clear , steady , hard voice , wherein was no joy or kindness , keeping [her]543-the maid face to [Walter]35-walter and [her]543-the maid back to [the stream]459-the stream : " This hath befallen , [friend]1695-friend , that there is no longer any need to refrain [thy]543-the maid love nor [mine]2123-mine ; therefore [I]543-the maid say to [thee]543-the maid , come to [[my]543-the maid chamber]2044-my chamber and it is the red chamber over against thine , though [thou]543-the maid knewest it not an hour before this next midnight , and then [thy]543-the maid sorrow and [mine]2123-mine shall be at an end : and now [I]543-the maid must needs depart . Follow [me]543-the maid not , but remember ! "[543-the maid]

And therewith [she]543-the maid turned about and fled like the wind down [the stream]459-the stream .

But [Walter]35-walter stood wondering , and knew not what to make of it , whether it were for good or ill : for [he]35-walter knew now that [she]543-the maid had paled and been seized with terror because of the upheaving of the ugly head ; and yet [she]543-the maid had seemed to speak out the very thing [she]543-the maid had to say . Howsoever it were , [he]35-walter spake aloud to [himself]35-walter : Whatever comes , [I]0-i will keep tryst with [her]543-the maid .

Then [he]35-walter drew [his]35-walter sword , and turned this way and that , looking all about if [he]35-walter might see any sign of the Evil Thing ; but nought might [his]35-walter eyes behold , save the grass , and [the stream]459-the stream , and the bushes of [the dale]881-the dale . So then , still holding [his]35-walter naked sword in [his]35-walter hand , [he]35-walter clomb the bent out of [the dale]881-the dale ; for that was the only way [he]35-walter knew to [the Golden House]15-the golden house ; and when [he]35-walter came to the top , and the summer breeze blew in [his]35-walter face , and [he]35-walter looked down a fair green slope beset with goodly oaks and chestnuts , [he]35-walter was refreshed with the life of [the earth]1629-the earth , and [he]35-walter felt the good sword in [his]35-walter fist , and knew that there was might and longing in [him]35-walter , and [the world]118-the world seemed open unto [him]35-walter .

So [he]35-walter smiled , if it were somewhat grimly , and sheathed [his]35-walter sword and went on toward [the house]112-the house .

CHAPTER XIX : [WALTER]35-walter GOES TO FETCH [HOME THE LION 'S HIDE]69-home the lion 's hide

[He]35-walter entered the cool dusk through [the porch]567-the porch , and , looking down [the pillared hall]887-the pillared hall , saw beyond the fountain a gleam of gold , and when [he]35-walter came past [the said fountain]888-the said fountain [he]35-walter looked up to the high - seat , and [lo]50-lo ! [the Lady sitting there]889-the lady sitting there clad in [her]889-the lady sitting there queenly raiment . [She]889-the lady sitting there called to [him]35-walter , and [he]35-walter came ; and [she]889-the lady sitting there hailed [him]35-walter , and spake graciously and calmly , yet as if [she]889-the lady sitting there knew nought of [him]35-walter save as [the leal servant of [her]889-the lady sitting there]890-the leal servant of her , [a high Lady]891-a high lady . " [Squire]61-squire , "[889-the lady sitting there] [she]889-the lady sitting there said , " [we]2125-we have deemed it meet to have the hide of [the servant of the Enemy]2126-the servant of the enemy , the lion to wit , whom [thou]2127-thou slewest yesterday , for a carpet to [our]2125-we feet ; wherefore go now , take [thy]2127-thou wood - knife , and flay the beast , and bring [me]889-the lady sitting there home [his]2126-the servant of the enemy skin . This shall be all [thy]2127-thou service for this day , so mayst [thou]2127-thou do it at [thine]2127-thou own leisure , and not weary thyself . May good go with [thee]2127-thou . "[889-the lady sitting there]

[He]35-walter bent the knee before [her]889-the lady sitting there , and [she]889-the lady sitting there smiled on [him]35-walter graciously , but reached out no hand for [him]35-walter to kiss , and heeded [him]35-walter but little . Wherefore , in spite of [himself]35-walter , and though [he]35-walter knew somewhat of [her]889-the lady sitting there guile , [he]35-walter could not help marvelling that this should be [she]889-the lady sitting there who had lain in [his]35-walter arms night - long but of late .

Howso that might be , [he]35-walter took [his]35-walter way toward the thicket where [he]35-walter had slain the lion , and came thither by then it was afternoon , at the hottest of the day . So [he]35-walter entered therein , and came to the very place whereas [the Lady]576-the lady had lain , when [she]576-the lady fell down before the terror of the lion ; and there was the mark of [her]576-the lady body on the grass where [she]576-the lady had lain that while , like as it were the form of a hare . But when [Walter]35-walter went on to where [he]35-walter had slain that great beast , [lo]893-lo ! [he]35-walter was gone , and there was no sign of [him]35-walter ; but there were [Walter]35-walter 's own footprints , and the two shafts which [he]35-walter had shot , one feathered red , and one blue . [He]35-walter said at first : [Belike]70-belike [someone]894-someone hath been [here]2104-here , and [hath]896-hath had [the carcase]897-the carcase away . Then [he]35-walter laughed in very despite , and said : How may that be , since there are no signs of dragging away of so huge a body , and no blood or fur on the grass if [they]898-they had cut [him]35-walter up , and moreover no trampling of feet , as if there had been [many men]899-many men at the deed . Then was [he]35-walter all abashed , and again laughed in scorn of [himself]35-walter , and said : Forsooth [I]0-i deemed [I]0-i had done manly ; but now forsooth [I]0-i shot nought , and nought there was before the sword of [[my]0-i father 's son]900-my father 's son . And what may [I]0-i deem now , but that this is [a land of mere lies]901-a land of mere lies , and that there is nought real and alive therein save [me]0-i . [Yea]902-yea , belike even these trees and the green grass will presently depart from [me]0-i , and leave [me]0-i falling down through the clouds .

Therewith [he]35-walter turned away , and gat [him]35-walter to [the road that led to [the Golden House]1846-the golden house]903-the road that led to the golden house , wondering what next should befall [him]35-walter , and going slowly as [he]35-walter pondered [his]35-walter case . So came [he]35-walter to [that first thicket where [they]906-they had lost [their]906-they quarry by water]905-that first thicket where they had lost their quarry by water ; so [he]35-walter entered the same , musing , and bathed [him]35-walter in the pool that was therein , after [he]35-walter had wandered about it awhile , and found nothing new .

So again [he]35-walter set [him]35-walter to [the homeward road]907-the homeward road , when the day was now waning , and it was near sunset that [he]35-walter was come nigh unto [the house]112-the house , though [it]112-the house was hidden from [him]35-walter as then by a low bent that rose before [him]35-walter ; and there [he]35-walter abode and looked about [him]35-walter .

Now as [he]35-walter looked , over the said bent came the figure of [a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about [her]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about , and then ran swiftly down to meet [Walter]35-walter , who saw at once that it was [the Maid]543-the maid .

[She]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about made no stay then till [she]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about was but three paces from [him]35-walter , and then [she]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about stooped down and made the sign to [him]35-walter , and then spake to [him]35-walter breathlessly , and said : " Hearken ! but speak not till [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about have done : [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about bade [thee]35-walter to - night 's meeting because [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about saw that there was one anigh whom [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about must needs beguile . But by thine oath , and [thy]35-walter love , and all that [thou]35-walter art , [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about adjure [thee]35-walter come not unto [me]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about this night as [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about bade [thee]35-walter ! but be hidden in the hazel - copse outside [the house]112-the house , as it draws toward midnight , and abide [me]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about there . Dost [thou]35-walter hearken , and wilt [thou]35-walter ? Say yes or no in haste , for [I]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about may not tarry a moment of time . Who knoweth what is behind [me]909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about ? "[909-a woman , who stayed on the brow thereof and looked all about]

" Yes , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter hastily ; " but [friend]1695-friend and love - "[35-walter]

" No more , "[911-she] [she]911-she said ; " hope the best ; "[911-she] and turning from [him]35-walter [she]911-she ran away swiftly , not by the way [she]911-she had come , but sideways , as though to reach [the house]112-the house by fetching a compass .

But [Walter]35-walter went slowly on [his]35-walter way , thinking within [himself]35-walter that now at that present moment there was nought for it but to refrain [him]35-walter from doing , and to let [others]113-others do ; yet deemed [he]35-walter that it was little manly to be as the pawn upon the board , pushed about by the will of [others]113-others .

Then , as [he]35-walter went , [he]35-walter bethought [him]35-walter of [the Maiden]183-the maiden 's face and aspect , as [she]911-she came running to [him]35-walter , and stood before [him]35-walter for that minute ; and all eagerness [he]35-walter saw in [her]911-she , and sore love of [him]35-walter , and distress of soul , all blent together .

So came [he]35-walter to the brow of the bent whence [he]35-walter could see lying before [him]35-walter , scarce more than a bow - shot away , [the Golden House]15-the golden house now gilded again and reddened by the setting sun . And even therewith came a gay image toward [him]35-walter , flashing back the level rays from gold and steel and silver ; and lo ! there was come [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son . [They]917-they met presently , and [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son turned to go beside [him]1781-the king 's son , and said merrily : " [I]1781-the king 's son give [thee]1781-the king 's son good even , [[my]1781-the king 's son Lady 's Squire]2130-my lady 's squire ! [I]1781-the king 's son owe [thee]1781-the king 's son something of courtesy , whereas it is by [thy]1781-the king 's son means that [I]1781-the king 's son shall be made happy , both to - night , and to - morrow , and many to - morrows ; and sooth it is , that but little courtesy have [I]1781-the king 's son done [thee]1781-the king 's son hitherto . "[1781-the king 's son]

[His]1781-the king 's son face was full of joy , and the eyes of [him]1781-the king 's son shone with gladness . [He]1781-the king 's son was [a goodly man]1817-a goodly man , but to [Walter]35-walter [he]1781-the king 's son seemed [an ill one]921-an ill one ; and [he]35-walter hated [him]1781-the king 's son so much , that [he]35-walter found it no easy matter to answer [him]1781-the king 's son ; but [he]35-walter refrained [himself]35-walter , and said : " [I]35-walter can [thee]1781-the king 's son thank , [King 's Son]1928-king 's son ; and good it is that [someone]894-someone is happy in [this strange land]2133-this strange land . "[35-walter]

" Art [thou]1781-the king 's son not happy then , Squire of [[my]922-the other Lady]1767-my lady ? "[922-the other] said [the other]922-the other .

[Walter]35-walter had no mind to show [this man]923-this man [his]35-walter heart , nay , nor even a corner thereof ; for [he]35-walter deemed [him]923-this man [an enemy]2019-an enemy . So [he]35-walter smiled sweetly and somewhat foolishly , as [a man luckily in love]925-a man luckily in love , and said : " O yea , [yea]2135-thee , why should [I]35-walter not be so ? How might [I]35-walter be otherwise ? "[35-walter]

" [Yea]2135-thee then , "[1781-the king 's son] said [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son , " why didst [thou]1781-the king 's son say that [thou]1781-the king 's son wert glad [someone]894-someone is happy ? Who is unhappy , deemest [thou]1781-the king 's son ? "[1781-the king 's son] and [he]1781-the king 's son looked on [him]1781-the king 's son keenly .

[Walter]35-walter answered slowly : " Said [I]35-walter so ? [I]35-walter suppose then that [I]35-walter was thinking of [thee]2135-thee ; for when first [I]35-walter saw [thee]2135-thee , [yea]2135-thee , and afterwards , [thou]2135-thee didst seem heavy - hearted and ill - content . "[35-walter]

The face of [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son cleared at this word , and [he]35-walter said : " [Yea]2135-thee , so it was ; for look [you]2135-thee , both ways it was : [I]35-walter was unfree , and [I]35-walter had sown the true desire of [my]35-walter heart whereas it waxed not . But now [I]35-walter am on the brink and verge of freedom , and presently shall [my]35-walter desire be blossomed . Nay now , [Squire]1985-squire , [I]35-walter deem [thee]2135-thee [a good fellow]2138-a good fellow , though it may be somewhat of [a fool]1982-a fool ; so [I]35-walter will no more speak riddles to [thee]2135-thee . Thus it is : [the Maid]543-the maid hath promised [me]35-walter all [mine]35-walter asking , and is [mine]35-walter ; and in two or three days , by [her]543-the maid helping also , [I]35-walter shall see [the world]118-the world again . "[35-walter]

[Quoth Walter]35-walter , smiling askance on [him]35-walter : " And [the Lady]576-the lady ? what shall [she]576-the lady say to this matter ? "[35-walter]

[[The King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son reddened , but smiled falsely enough , and said : " [Sir Squire]61-squire , [thou]2135-thee knowest enough not to need to ask this . Why should [I]1781-the king 's son tell [thee]2135-thee that [she]576-the lady accounteth more of [thy]2135-thee little finger than of [my]1781-the king 's son whole body ? Now [I]1781-the king 's son tell [thee]2135-thee hereof freely ; first , because this [my]1781-the king 's son fruition of love , and [my]1781-the king 's son freeing from [thralldom]16-thralldom , is , in a way , of [thy]2135-thee doing . For [thou]2135-thee art become [my]1781-the king 's son supplanter , and hast taken [thy]2135-thee place with [yonder lovely tyrant]2143-yonder lovely tyrant . Fear not for [me]1781-the king 's son ! [she]576-the lady will let [me]1781-the king 's son go . As for [thyself]2144-thyself , see [thou]2135-thee to it ! But again [I]1781-the king 's son tell [thee]2135-thee hereof because [my]1781-the king 's son heart is light and full of joy , and telling [thee]2135-thee will pleasure [me]1781-the king 's son , and can not do [me]1781-the king 's son any harm . For if [thou]2135-thee say : How if [I]1781-the king 's son carry the tale to [[my]1781-the king 's son Lady]1767-my lady ? [I]1781-the king 's son answer , [thou]2135-thee wilt not . For [I]1781-the king 's son know that thine heart hath been somewhat set on the jewel that [my]1781-the king 's son hand holdeth ; and [thou]2135-thee knowest well on whose head [the Lady]576-the lady 's wrath would fall , and that would be neither thine nor [mine]1781-the king 's son . "[1781-the king 's son]

" [Thou]2135-thee sayest sooth , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter ; " neither is treason [[my]35-walter wo nt]2147-my wo nt . "[35-walter]

So [they]930-they walked on silently a while , and then [Walter]35-walter said : " But how if [the Maiden]183-the maiden had nay - said [thee]933-thou ; what hadst [thou]933-thou done then ? "[35-walter]

" By the heavens ! "[1780-the king] said [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son fiercely , ' [she]933-thou should have paid for [her]933-thou nay - say ; then would [I]0-i - " But [he]0-i broke off , and said quietly , yet somewhat doggedly : "[0-i] Why talk of what might have been ? [She]933-thou gave [me]0-i [her]933-thou yea - say pleasantly and sweetly . "[933-thou]

Now [Walter]35-walter knew that [the man]1710-the man lied , so [he]35-walter held [his]35-walter peace thereon ; but presently [he]35-walter said : " When [thou]933-thou art free wilt [thou]933-thou go to [thine own land]2119-thine own land again ? "[35-walter]

" Yea , "[1781-the king 's son] said [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son ; ' [she]933-thou will lead [me]0-i thither . "[933-thou]

" And wilt [thou]933-thou make [her]933-thou [[thy]933-thou lady]1770-thy lady and [queen]2151-queen when [thou]933-thou comest to [[thy]933-thou father]1583-thy father 's land ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

[[The King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son knit [his]1781-the king 's son brow , and said : " When [I]1781-the king 's son am in [[mine]1781-the king 's son own land]2153-mine own land [I]1781-the king 's son may do with [her]933-thou what [I]1781-the king 's son will ; but [I]1781-the king 's son look for it that [I]1781-the king 's son shall do no otherwise with [her]933-thou than that [she]933-thou shall be well - content . "[1781-the king 's son]

Then the talk between [them]938-them dropped , and [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son turned off toward [the wood]1758-the wood , singing and joyous ; but [Walter]35-walter went soberly toward [the house]112-the house . Forsooth [he]35-walter was not greatly cast down , for besides that [he]35-walter knew that [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son was false , [he]35-walter deemed that under this double tryst lay something which was a - doing in [his]35-walter own behalf . Yet was [he]35-walter eager and troubled , if not down - hearted , and [his]35-walter soul was cast about betwixt hope and fear .

CHAPTER XX : [WALTER]35-walter IS BIDDEN TO ANOTHER TRYST

So came [he]35-walter into [the pillared hall]887-the pillared hall , and there [he]35-walter found [the Lady]576-the lady walking to and fro by the high - seat ; and when [he]35-walter drew nigh [she]576-the lady turned on [him]35-walter , and said in a voice rather eager than angry : " What hast [thou]35-walter done , [Squire]1985-squire ? Why art [thou]35-walter come before [me]576-the lady ? "[576-the lady]

[He]35-walter was abashed , and bowed before [her]576-the lady and said : " [O gracious Lady]2155-o gracious lady , [thou]35-walter badest [me]35-walter service , and [I]35-walter have been about it . "[35-walter]

[She]576-the lady said : " Tell [me]576-the lady then , tell [me]576-the lady , what hath betided ? "[576-the lady]

" [Lady]1863-lady , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter , " when [I]35-walter entered the thicket of [thy]35-walter swooning [I]35-walter found there no carcase of the lion , nor any sign of the dragging away of [him]35-walter . "[35-walter]

[She]576-the lady looked full in [his]35-walter face for a little , and then went to [her]576-the lady chair , and sat down therein ; and in a little while spake to [him]35-walter in a softer voice , and said : " Did [I]576-the lady not tell [thee]35-walter that [some enemy]2157-some enemy had done that unto [me]576-the lady ? and lo ! now [thou]35-walter seest that so it is . "[576-the lady]

Then was [she]576-the lady silent again , and knit [her]576-the lady brows and set [her]576-the lady teeth ; and thereafter [she]576-the lady spake harshly and fiercely : " But [I]576-the lady will overcome [her]576-the lady , and make [her]576-the lady days evil , but keep death away from [her]576-the lady , that [she]576-the lady may die many times over ; and know all the sickness of the heart , when foes be nigh , and [friends]2158-friends afar , and there is none to deliver ! "[576-the lady]

[Her]576-the lady eyes flashed , and [her]576-the lady face was dark with anger ; but [she]576-the lady turned and caught [Walter]35-walter 's eyes , and the sternness of [his]35-walter face , and [she]576-the lady softened at once , and said : " But [thou]35-walter ! this hath little to do with [thee]35-walter ; and now to [thee]35-walter [I]576-the lady speak : Now cometh even and night . Go [thou]35-walter to [[thy]35-walter chamber]1887-thy chamber , and there shalt [thou]35-walter find raiment worthy of [thee]35-walter , what [thou]35-walter now art , and what [thou]35-walter shalt be ; do on the same , and make [thyself]35-walter most goodly , and then come [thou]35-walter hither and eat and drink with [me]576-the lady , and afterwards depart whither [thou]35-walter wilt , till the night has worn to its midmost ; and then come [thou]35-walter to [[my]576-the lady chamber]2044-my chamber , to wit , through the ivory door in the gallery above ; and then and there shall [I]576-the lady tell [thee]35-walter a thing , and it shall be for the weal both of [thee]35-walter and of [me]576-the lady , but for the grief and woe of [the Enemy]2036-the enemy . "[576-the lady]

Therewith [she]946-she reached [her]946-she hand to [him]947-he , and [he]947-he kissed it , and departed and came to [[his]947-he chamber]259-his chamber , and found raiment therebefore rich beyond measure ; and [he]947-he wondered if any new snare lay therein : yet if there were , [he]947-he saw no way whereby [he]947-he might escape it , so [he]947-he did it on , and became as [the most glorious of [kings]950-kings , and yet lovelier than [any king of [the world]118-the world]951-any king of the world]949-the most glorious of kings , and yet lovelier than any king of the world .

Sithence [he]947-he went [his]947-he way into [the pillared hall]887-the pillared hall , when it was now night , and without the moon was up , and the trees of the wood as still as images .
