But within [the hall]1860-the hall shone bright with many candles , and the fountain glittered in the light of them , as it ran tinkling sweetly into [the little stream]955-the little stream ; and the silvern bridges gleamed , and the pillars shone all round about .

And there on the dais was a table dight most royally , and [the Lady]576-the lady sitting thereat , clad in [her]576-the lady most glorious array , and behind [her]576-the lady [the Maid]543-the maid standing humbly , yet clad in precious web of shimmering gold , but with feet unshod , and the iron ring upon [her]543-the maid ankle .

So [Walter]35-walter came [his]35-walter ways to the high - seat , and [the Lady]576-the lady rose and greeted [him]35-walter , and took [him]35-walter by the hands , and kissed [him]35-walter on either cheek , and sat [him]35-walter down beside [her]576-the lady . So [they]959-they fell to [their]959-they meat , and [the Maid]543-the maid served [them]959-they ; but [the Lady]576-the lady took no more heed of [her]576-the lady than if [she]576-the lady were [one of the pillars of [the hall]1860-the hall]962-one of the pillars of the hall ; but [Walter]35-walter [she]576-the lady caressed oft with sweet words , and the touch of [her]576-the lady hand , making [him]35-walter drink out of [her]576-the lady cup and eat out of [her]576-the lady dish . As to [him]35-walter , [he]35-walter was bashful by seeming , but verily fearful ; [he]35-walter took [the Lady]576-the lady 's caresses with what grace [he]35-walter might , and durst not so much as glance at [[her]576-the lady Maid]781-her maid . Long indeed seemed that banquet to [him]35-walter , and longer yet endured the weariness of [his]35-walter abiding there , kind to [[his]35-walter foe]966-his foe and unkind to [[his]35-walter friend]967-his friend ; for after the banquet [they]968-they still sat a while , and [the Lady]576-the lady talked much to [Walter]35-walter about many things of the ways of [the world]118-the world , and [he]35-walter answered what [he]35-walter might , distraught as [he]35-walter was with the thought of those two trysts which [he]35-walter had to deal with .

At last spake [the Lady]576-the lady and said : " Now must [I]576-the lady leave [thee]576-the lady for a little , and [thou]576-the lady wottest where and how [we]968-they shall meet next ; and meanwhile disport [thee]576-the lady as [thou]576-the lady wilt , so that [thou]576-the lady weary not [thyself]2162-thyself , for [I]576-the lady love to see [thee]576-the lady joyous . "[576-the lady]

Then [she]576-the lady arose stately and grand ; but [she]576-the lady kissed [Walter]35-walter on the mouth ere [she]576-the lady turned to go out of [the hall]1860-the hall . [The Maid]543-the maid followed [her]576-the lady ; but or ever [she]543-the maid was quite gone , [she]543-the maid stooped and made that sign , and looked over [her]543-the maid shoulder at [Walter]35-walter , as if in entreaty to [him]35-walter , and there was fear and anguish in [her]543-the maid face ; but [he]35-walter nodded [his]35-walter head to [her]543-the maid in yea - say of the tryst in the hazel - copse , and in a trice [she]543-the maid was gone .

[Walter]35-walter went down [the hall]1860-the hall , and forth into the early night ; but in the jaws of [the porch]567-the porch [he]35-walter came up against [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , who , gazing at [his]35-walter attire glittering with all its gems in the moonlight , laughed out , and said : " Now may it be seen how [thou]2163-thou art risen in degree above [me]1781-the king 's son , whereas [I]1781-the king 's son am but [[a king]2164-a king 's son]1879-a king 's son , and [that a king of [a far country]2167-a far country]2166-that a king of a far country ; whereas [thou]2163-thou art [a king of kings]2168-a king of kings , or shalt be this night , yea , and of [this very country wherein [we]2170-we both are]2169-this very country wherein we both are . "[1781-the king 's son]

Now [Walter]35-walter saw the mock which lay under [his]35-walter words ; but [he]35-walter kept back [his]35-walter wrath , and answered : " Fair sir , art [thou]2163-thou as well contented with [thy]2163-thou lot as when the sun went down ? Hast [thou]2163-thou no doubt or fear ? Will [the Maid]543-the maid verily keep tryst with [thee]2163-thou , or hath [she]543-the maid given [thee]2163-thou yea - say but to escape [thee]2163-thou this time ? Or , again , may [she]543-the maid not turn to [the Lady]576-the lady and appeal to [her]576-the lady against [thee]2163-thou ? "[35-walter]

Now when [he]35-walter had spoken these words , [he]35-walter repented thereof , and feared for [himself]35-walter and [the Maid]543-the maid , lest [he]35-walter had stirred some misgiving in [that young man]979-that young man 's foolish heart . But [the King 's Son]1781-the king 's son did but laugh , and answered nought but to [Walter]35-walter 's last words , and said : " [Yea]2173-yea , [yea]2173-yea ! this word of thine showeth how little [thou]2163-thou wottest of that which lieth betwixt [[my]1781-the king 's son darling]1795-my darling and thine . Doth the lamb appeal from [the shepherd]2175-the shepherd to the wolf ? Even so shall [the Maid]72-the maid appeal from [me]1781-the king 's son to [[thy]2163-thou Lady]1770-thy lady . What ! ask [[thy]2163-thou Lady]1770-thy lady at [thy]1770-thy lady leisure what [her]1770-thy lady wo nt hath been with [her]1770-thy lady thrall ; [she]1770-thy lady shall think it a fair tale to tell [thee]2163-thou thereof . But thereof is [[my]1781-the king 's son Maid]1942-my maid all whole now by reason of [her]1942-my maid wisdom in leechcraft , or somewhat more . And now [I]1781-the king 's son tell [thee]2163-thou again , that [the beforesaid Maid]2179-the beforesaid maid must needs do [my]1781-the king 's son will ; for if [I]1781-the king 's son be [the deep sea]2180-the deep sea , and [I]1781-the king 's son deem not so ill of [myself]1781-the king 's son , that other one is the devil ; as belike [thou]2163-thou shalt find out for [thyself]2163-thou later on . Yea , all is well with [me]1781-the king 's son , and more than well . "[1781-the king 's son]

And therewith [he]981-he swung merrily into [the litten hall]982-the litten hall . But [Walter]35-walter went out into the moonlit night , and wandered about for an hour or more , and stole warily into [the hall]1860-the hall and thence into [[his]35-walter own chamber]984-his own chamber . There [he]35-walter did off that royal array , and did [his]35-walter own raiment upon [him]35-walter ; [he]35-walter girt [him]35-walter with sword and knife , took [his]35-walter bow and quiver , and stole down and out again , even as [he]35-walter had come in . Then [he]35-walter fetched a compass , and came down into [the hazel - coppice]985-the hazel - coppice from [the north]986-the north , and lay hidden there while the night wore , till [he]35-walter deemed it would lack but little of midnight .

CHAPTER XXI : [WALTER]35-walter AND [THE MAID]543-the maid FLEE FROM [THE GOLDEN HOUSE]1846-the golden house

There [he]35-walter abode amidst the hazels , hearkening every littlest sound ; and the sounds were nought but the night voices of [the wood]1758-the wood , till suddenly there burst forth from [the house]112-the house a great wailing cry . [Walter]35-walter 's heart came up into [his]35-walter mouth , but [he]35-walter had no time to do aught , for following hard on the cry came the sound of light feet close to [him]35-walter , the boughs were thrust aside , and there was come [the Maid]543-the maid , and [she]543-the maid but in [her]543-the maid white coat , and barefoot . And then first [he]35-walter felt the sweetness of [her]543-the maid flesh on [his]35-walter , for [she]543-the maid caught [him]35-walter by the hand and said breathlessly : " Now , now ! there may yet be time , or even too much , it may be . For the saving of breath ask [me]543-the maid no questions , but come ! "[543-the maid]

[He]35-walter dallied not , but went as [she]543-the maid led , and [they]992-they were lightfoot , both of [them]992-they .

[They]992-they went the same way , due south to wit , whereby [he]35-walter had gone a - hunting with [the Lady]576-the lady ; and whiles [they]992-they ran and whiles [they]992-they walked ; but so fast [they]992-they went , that by grey of the dawn [they]992-they were come as far as that coppice or thicket of [the Lion]17-the lion ; and still [they]992-they hastened onward , and but little had [the Maid]543-the maid spoken , save here and there a word to hearten up [Walter]35-walter , and here and there a shy word of endearment . At last the dawn grew into early day , and as [they]992-they came over the brow of a bent , [they]992-they looked down over [a plain land]995-a plain land whereas the trees grew scatter - meal , and beyond [the plain]404-the plain rose up [the land]101-the land into [long green hills]998-long green hills , and over those again were blue mountains great and far away .

Then spake [the Maid]72-the maid : " Over yonder lie [the outlying mountains of [the Bears]44-god]2181-the outlying mountains of the bears , and through [them]2181-the outlying mountains of the bears [we]992-they needs must pass , to [our]992-they great peril . Nay , [friend]1695-friend , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said , as [he]35-walter handled [his]35-walter sword - hilt , " it must be patience and wisdom to bring [us]992-they through , and not the fallow blade of [one man]2183-one man , though [he]2183-one man be [a good one]2184-a good one . But look ! below there runs a stream through [the first of [the plain]404-the plain]2185-the first of the plain , and [I]543-the maid see nought for it but [we]992-they must now rest [our]992-they bodies . Moreover [I]543-the maid have a tale to tell [thee]543-the maid which is burning [my]543-the maid heart ; for maybe there will be a pardon to ask of [thee]543-the maid moreover ; wherefore [I]543-the maid fear [thee]543-the maid . "[543-the maid]

Quoth [Walter]35-walter : " How may that be ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid answered [him]35-walter not , but took [his]35-walter hand and led [him]35-walter down the bent . But [he]35-walter said : " [Thou]543-the maid sayest , rest ; but are [we]992-they now out of all peril of the chase ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid said : " [I]543-the maid can not tell till [I]543-the maid know what hath befallen [her]543-the maid . If [she]543-the maid be not to hand to set on [her]543-the maid trackers , [they]2187-they will scarce happen on [us]992-they now ; if it be not for that one . "[543-the maid]

And [she]543-the maid shuddered , and [he]35-walter felt [her]543-the maid hand change as [he]35-walter held it .

Then [she]543-the maid said : " But peril or no peril , needs must [we]992-they rest ; for [I]543-the maid tell [thee]35-walter again , what [I]543-the maid have to say to [thee]35-walter burneth [my]543-the maid bosom for fear of [thee]35-walter , so that [I]543-the maid can go no further until [I]543-the maid have told [thee]35-walter . "[543-the maid]

Then [he]35-walter said : " [I]35-walter wot not of [this Queen]2188-this queen and [her]2188-this queen mightiness and [[her]2188-this queen servants]2189-her servants . [I]35-walter will ask thereof later . But besides [the others]258-the others , is there not [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , [he]1781-the king 's son who loves [thee]35-walter so unworthily ? "[35-walter]

[She]999-she paled somewhat , and said : " As for [him]1781-the king 's son , there had been nought for [thee]35-walter to fear in [him]1781-the king 's son , save [his]1781-the king 's son treason : but now shall [he]1781-the king 's son neither love nor hate any more ; [he]1781-the king 's son died last midnight . "[999-she]

" [Yea]2193-yea , and how ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

" Nay , "[999-she] [she]999-she said , " let [me]999-she tell [my]999-she tale all together once for all , lest [thou]35-walter blame [me]999-she overmuch . But first [we]1000-they will wash [us]1000-they and comfort [us]1000-they as best [we]1000-they may , and then amidst [our]1000-they resting shall the word be said . "[999-she]

By then were [they]1000-they come down to [the stream - side]1001-the stream - side , which ran fair in pools and stickles amidst [rocks and sandy banks]1002-rocks and sandy banks . [She]999-she said : " There behind [the great grey rock]2194-the great grey rock is [[my]999-she bath]2195-my bath , [friend]1695-friend ; and here is thine ; and lo ! the uprising of the sun ! "[999-she]

So [she]999-she went [her]999-she ways to [the said rock]1003-the said rock , and [he]1004-he bathed [him]1004-he , and washed the night off [him]1004-he , and by then [he]1004-he was clad again [she]999-she came back fresh and sweet from the water , and with [her]999-she lap full of cherries from a wilding which overhung [her]999-she bath . So [they]1000-they sat down together on the green grass above [the sand]1005-the sand , and ate the breakfast of [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness : and [Walter]35-walter was full of content as [he]35-walter watched [her]999-she , and beheld [her]999-she sweetness and [her]999-she loveliness ; yet were [they]1000-they , [either of [them]1000-they]1007-either of them , somewhat shy and shamefaced each with [the other]922-the other ; so that [he]35-walter did but kiss [her]999-she hands once and again , and though [she]999-she shrank not from [him]35-walter , yet had [she]999-she no boldness to cast [herself]999-she into [his]35-walter arms .

CHAPTER XXII : OF [THE DWARF AND THE PARDON]73-the dwarf

Now [she]999-she began to say : " [[My]999-she friend]1798-my friend , now shall [I]999-she tell [thee]1798-my friend what [I]999-she have done for [thee]1798-my friend and [me]999-she ; and if [thou]1798-my friend have a mind to blame [me]999-she , and punish [me]999-she , yet remember first , that what [I]999-she have done has been for [thee]1798-my friend and [our]2198-our hope of happy life . Well , [I]999-she shall tell [thee]1798-my friend - "[999-she]

But therewithal [her]999-she speech failed [her]999-she ; and , springing up , [she]999-she faced [the bent]1009-the bent and pointed with [her]999-she finger , and [she]999-she all deadly pale , and shaking so that [she]999-she might scarce stand , and might speak no word , though a feeble gibbering came from [her]999-she mouth .

[Walter]35-walter leapt up and put [his]35-walter arm about [her]999-she , and looked whitherward [she]999-she pointed , and at first saw nought ; and then nought but a brown and yellow rock rolling down the bent : and then at last [he]35-walter saw that it was the Evil Thing which had met [him]35-walter when first [he]35-walter came into [that land]342-that land ; and now it stood upright , and [he]35-walter could see that it was clad in a coat of yellow samite .

Then [Walter]35-walter stooped down and gat [his]35-walter bow into [his]35-walter hand , and stood before [the Maid]543-the maid , while [he]35-walter nocked an arrow . But [the monster]1829-the monster made ready [his]1829-the monster tackle while [Walter]35-walter was stooping down , and or ever [he]35-walter could loose , [his]35-walter bow - string twanged , and an arrow flew forth and grazed [the Maid]543-the maid 's arm above the elbow , so that the blood ran , and [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf gave forth a harsh and horrible cry . Then flew [Walter]35-walter 's shaft , and true was it aimed , so that it smote [the monster]1829-the monster full on the breast , but fell down from [him]35-walter as if [he]35-walter were made of stone . Then [the creature]507-the creature set up [his]507-the creature horrible cry again , and loosed withal , and [Walter]35-walter deemed that [he]35-walter had smitten [the Maid]543-the maid , for [she]543-the maid fell down in a heap behind [him]35-walter . Then waxed [Walter wood - wroth]35-walter , and cast down [his]35-walter bow and drew [his]35-walter sword , and strode forward towards the bent against [the Dwarf]73-the dwarf . But [he]35-walter roared out again , and there were words in [his]35-walter roar , and [he]35-walter said " [Fool]1771-fool ! [thou]1771-fool shalt go free if [thou]1771-fool wilt give up [the Enemy]2036-the enemy . "[35-walter]

" And who , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter , " is [the Enemy]2036-the enemy ? "[35-walter]

Yelled [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf : " [She]543-the maid , the pink and white thing lying there ; [she]543-the maid is not dead yet ; [she]543-the maid is but dying for fear of [me]182-the dwarf . Yea , [she]543-the maid hath reason ! [I]182-the dwarf could have set the shaft in [her]543-the maid heart as easily as scratching [her]543-the maid arm ; but [I]182-the dwarf need [her]543-the maid body alive , that [I]182-the dwarf may wreak [me]182-the dwarf on [her]543-the maid . "[182-the dwarf]

" What wilt [thou]2202-thee do with [her]543-the maid ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter ; for now [he]35-walter had heard that [the Maid]543-the maid was not slain [he]35-walter had waxed wary again , and stood watching [his]35-walter chance .

[The Dwarf]182-the dwarf yelled so at [his]182-the dwarf last word , that no word came from the noise a while , and then [he]182-the dwarf said : " What will [I]182-the dwarf with [her]543-the maid ? Let [me]182-the dwarf at [her]543-the maid , and stand by and look on , and then shalt [thou]2202-thee have a strange tale to carry off with [thee]2202-thee . For [I]182-the dwarf will let [thee]2202-thee go this while . "[182-the dwarf]

Said [Walter]35-walter : " But what need to wreak [thee]2202-thee ? What hath [she]543-the maid done to [thee]2202-thee ? "[182-the dwarf]

" What need ! what need ! "[182-the dwarf] roared [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf ; " have [I]182-the dwarf not told [thee]2202-thee that [she]543-the maid is [the Enemy]2036-the enemy ? And [thou]2202-thee askest of what [she]543-the maid hath done ! of what ! [Fool]1771-fool , [she]543-the maid is [the murderer]2205-the murderer ! [she]543-the maid hath slain [the Lady that was [[our]2207-our Lady]1924-our lady , and that made [us]2207-our ; [she]543-the maid whom all [we]2207-our worshipped and adored]2206-the lady that was our lady , and that made us ; she whom all we worshipped and adored . [O impudent fool]2209-o impudent fool ! "[182-the dwarf]

Therewith [he]182-the dwarf nocked and loosed another arrow , which would have smitten [Walter]35-walter in the face , but that [he]182-the dwarf lowered [his]182-the dwarf head in the very nick of time ; then with a great shout [he]182-the dwarf rushed up the bent , and was on [the Dwarf]73-the dwarf before [he]182-the dwarf could get [his]182-the dwarf sword out , and leaping aloft dealt [the creature]507-the creature a stroke amidmost of the crown ; and so mightily be smote , that [he]182-the dwarf drave the heavy sword right through to the teeth , so that [he]182-the dwarf fell dead straightway .

[Walter]35-walter stood over [him]73-the dwarf a minute , and when [be]35-walter saw that [he]182-the dwarf moved not , [he]182-the dwarf went slowly down to [the stream]459-the stream , whereby [the Maid]543-the maid yet lay cowering down and quivering all over , and covering [her]543-the maid face with [her]543-the maid hands . Then [he]182-the dwarf took [her]543-the maid by the wrist and said : " Up , [Maiden]55-maiden , up ! and tell [me]182-the dwarf this tale of the slaying . "[182-the dwarf]

But [she]543-the maid shrunk away from [him]182-the dwarf , and looked at [him]182-the dwarf with wild eyes , and said : " What hast [thou]543-the maid done with [him]182-the dwarf ? Is [he]182-the dwarf gone ? "[543-the maid]

" [He]182-the dwarf is dead , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter ; " [I]35-walter have slain [him]182-the dwarf ; there lies [he]182-the dwarf with cloven skull on the bent - side : unless , forsooth , [he]182-the dwarf vanish away like the lion [I]35-walter slew ! or else , perchance , [he]182-the dwarf will come to life again ! And art [thou]543-the maid a lie like to [the rest of [them]2210-the rest of them]2210-the rest of them ? let [me]35-walter hear of this slaying . "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid rose up , and stood before [him]182-the dwarf trembling , and said : " O , [thou]543-the maid art angry with [me]543-the maid , and [thine]543-the maid anger [I]543-the maid can not bear . Ah , what have [I]543-the maid done ? [Thou]543-the maid hast slain one , and [I]543-the maid , maybe , the other ; and never had [we]2211-we escaped till [both these twain]2212-both these twain were dead . Ah ! [thou]543-the maid dost not know ! [thou]543-the maid dost not know ! O [me]543-the maid ! what shall [I]543-the maid do to appease [thy]543-the maid wrath ! "[543-the maid]

[He]182-the dwarf looked on [her]543-the maid , and [his]182-the dwarf heart rose to [his]182-the dwarf mouth at the thought of sundering from [her]543-the maid . Still [he]182-the dwarf looked on [her]543-the maid , and [her]543-the maid piteous friendly face melted all [his]182-the dwarf heart ; [he]182-the dwarf threw down [his]182-the dwarf sword , and took [her]543-the maid by the shoulders , and kissed [her]543-the maid face over and over , and strained [her]543-the maid to [him]182-the dwarf , so that [he]182-the dwarf felt the sweetness of [her]543-the maid bosom . Then [he]182-the dwarf lifted [her]543-the maid up like [a child]1025-a child , and set [her]543-the maid down on the green grass , and went down to [the water]527-the water , and filled [his]182-the dwarf hat therefrom , and came back to [her]543-the maid ; then [he]182-the dwarf gave [her]543-the maid to drink , and bathed [her]543-the maid face and [her]543-the maid hands , so that the colour came aback to the cheeks and lips of [her]543-the maid : and [she]543-the maid smiled on [him]182-the dwarf and kissed [his]182-the dwarf hands , and said : " O now [thou]182-the dwarf art kind to [me]543-the maid . "[543-the maid]

" [Yea]2213-yea , "[182-the dwarf] said [he]182-the dwarf , " and true it is that if [thou]182-the dwarf hast slain , [I]182-the dwarf have done no less , and if [thou]182-the dwarf hast lied , even so have [I]182-the dwarf ; and if [thou]182-the dwarf hast played [the wanton]2214-the wanton , as [I]182-the dwarf deem not that [thou]182-the dwarf hast , [I]182-the dwarf full surely have so done . So now [thou]182-the dwarf shalt pardon [me]182-the dwarf , and when [thy]182-the dwarf spirit has come back to [thee]182-the dwarf , [thou]182-the dwarf shalt tell [me]182-the dwarf [thy]182-the dwarf tale in all friendship , and in all loving - kindness will [I]182-the dwarf hearken the same . "[182-the dwarf]

Therewith [he]182-the dwarf knelt before [her]1027-she and kissed [her]1027-she feet . But [she]1027-she said : " [Yea]2215-yea , [yea]2215-yea ; what [thou]182-the dwarf willest , that will [I]1027-she do . But first tell [me]1027-she one thing . Hast [thou]182-the dwarf buried this horror and hidden [him]182-the dwarf in [the earth]1629-the earth ? "[1027-she]

[He]182-the dwarf deemed that fear had bewildered [her]1027-she , and that [she]1027-she scarcely yet knew how things had gone . But [he]182-the dwarf said : " [Fair sweet friend]2217-fair sweet friend , [I]182-the dwarf have not done it as yet ; but now will [I]182-the dwarf go and do it , if it seem good to [thee]1027-she . "[182-the dwarf]

" Yea , "[1027-she] [she]1027-she said , " but first must [thou]182-the dwarf smite off [his]182-the dwarf head , and lie it by [his]182-the dwarf buttocks when [he]182-the dwarf is in [the earth]1629-the earth ; or evil things will happen else . This of the burying is no idle matter , [I]1027-she bid [thee]1027-she believe . "[1027-she]

" [I]182-the dwarf doubt it not , "[182-the dwarf] said [he]182-the dwarf ; ' surely such malice as was in this one will be hard to slay . " And [he]182-the dwarf picked up [his]182-the dwarf sword , and turned to go to [the field of deed]2219-the field of deed .[182-the dwarf]

[She]1027-she said : " [I]1027-she must needs go with [thee]182-the dwarf ; terror hath so filled [my]1027-she soul , that [I]1027-she durst not abide here without [thee]182-the dwarf . "[1027-she]

So [they]1028-they went both together to where the creature lay . [The Maid]543-the maid durst not look on the dead monster , but [Walter]35-walter noted that [he]35-walter was girt with a big ungainly sax ; so [he]35-walter drew it from the sheath , and there smote off the hideous head of [the fiend]1030-the fiend with [his]35-walter own weapon . Then [they]1028-they twain together laboured [the earth]1629-the earth , [she]543-the maid with [Walter]35-walter 's sword , [he]35-walter with the ugly sax , till [they]1028-they had made a grave deep and wide enough ; and therein [they]1028-they thrust [the creature]507-the creature , and covered [him]507-the creature up , weapons and all together .

CHAPTER XXIII : OF THE PEACEFUL ENDING OF THAT WILD DAY

Thereafter [Walter]35-walter led [the Maid]543-the maid down again , and said to [her]543-the maid : " Now , sweetling , shall the story be told . "[35-walter]

" Nay , [friend]1695-friend , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said , " not [here]2104-here . [This place]407-this place hath been polluted by [my]543-the maid craven fear , and the horror of [the vile wretch]2223-the vile wretch , of whom no words may tell [his]2223-the vile wretch vileness . Let [us]1028-they hence and onward . [Thou]2224-thou seest [I]543-the maid have once more come to life again . "[543-the maid]

" But , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter , " [thou]2224-thou hast been hurt by [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf 's arrow . "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid laughed , and said : " Had [I]543-the maid never had greater hurt from [them]2226-them than that , little had been the tale thereof : yet whereas [thou]2224-thou lookest dolorous about it , [we]1028-they will speedily heal it . "[543-the maid]

Therewith [she]543-the maid sought about , and found nigh [the stream - side]1001-the stream - side certain herbs ; and [she]543-the maid spake words over them , and bade [Walter]35-walter lay them on the wound , which , forsooth , was of the least , and [he]35-walter did so , and bound a strip of [his]35-walter shirt about [her]543-the maid arm ; and then would [she]543-the maid set forth . But [he]35-walter said : " [Thou]2224-thou art all unshod ; and but if that be seen to , [our]1028-they journey shall be stayed by [thy]2224-thou foot - soreness : [I]35-walter may make a shift to fashion [thee]2224-thou brogues . "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid said : " [I]543-the maid may well go barefoot . And in any case , [I]543-the maid entreat [thee]35-walter that [we]1028-they tarry here no longer , but go away hence , if it be but for a mile . "[543-the maid]

And [she]543-the maid looked piteously on [him]35-walter , so that [he]35-walter might not gainsay [her]543-the maid .

So then [they]1035-us crossed [the stream]459-the stream , and set forward , when amidst all these haps the day was worn to midmorning . But after [they]1035-us had gone a mile , [they]1035-us sat [them]1035-us down on a knoll under the shadow of a big thorn - tree , within sight of [the mountains]317-the mountains . Then said [Walter]35-walter : " Now will [I]35-walter cut [thee]2224-thou the brogues from the skirt of [my]35-walter buff - coat , which shall be well meet for such work ; and meanwhile shalt [thou]2224-thou tell [me]35-walter [thy]2224-thou tale . "[35-walter]

" [Thou]2224-thou art kind , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said ; " but be kinder yet , and abide [my]543-the maid tale till [we]1035-us have done [our]1035-us day 's work . For [we]1035-us were best to make no long delay here ; because , though [thou]2224-thou hast slain [the King - dwarf]2227-the king - dwarf , yet there be others of [his]2227-the king - dwarf kindred , who swarm in [some parts of [the wood]1758-the wood]2228-some parts of the wood as the rabbits in a warren . Now true it is that [they]2224-thou have but little understanding , less , it may be , than the very brute beasts ; and that , as [I]543-the maid said afore , unless [they]2224-thou be set on [our]1035-us slot like to hounds , [they]2224-thou shall have no inkling of where to seek [us]1035-us , yet might [they]2224-thou happen upon [us]1035-us by mere misadventure . And moreover , [friend]1695-friend , "[543-the maid] quoth [she]543-the maid , blushing , " [I]543-the maid would beg of [thee]1695-friend some little respite ; for though [I]543-the maid scarce fear [thy]2224-thou wrath any more , since [thou]2224-thou hast been so kind to [me]543-the maid , yet is there shame in that which [I]543-the maid have to tell [thee]1695-friend . Wherefore , since the fairest of the day is before [us]1035-us , let [us]1035-us use it all [we]1035-us may , and , when [thou]2224-thou hast done [me]543-the maid [my]543-the maid new foot - gear , get [us]1035-us gone forward again . "[543-the maid]

[He]1038-he kissed [her]543-the maid kindly and yea - said [her]543-the maid asking : [he]1038-he had already fallen to work on the leather , and in a while had fashioned [her]543-the maid the brogues ; so [she]543-the maid tied them to [her]543-the maid feet , and arose with a smile and said : " Now am [I]543-the maid hale and strong again , what with the rest , and what with [thy]2224-thou loving - kindness , and [thou]2224-thou shalt see how nimble [I]543-the maid shall be to leave [this land]1735-this land , for as fair as [it]1735-this land is . Since forsooth [a land of lies]2232-a land of lies [it]1735-this land is , and of grief to [the children of [Adam]49-adam]2233-the children of adam . "[543-the maid]

So [they]1039-they went [their]1039-they ways thence , and fared nimbly indeed , and made no stay till some three hours after noon , when [they]1039-they rested by a thicket - side , where the strawberries grew plenty ; [they]1039-they ate thereof what [they]1039-they would : and from a great oak hard by [Walter]35-walter shot [him]1038-he first one culver , and then another , and hung [them]1040-them to [his]1038-he girdle to be for [their]1039-they evening 's meal ; sithence [they]1039-they went forward again , and nought befell [them]1039-they to tell of , till [they]1039-they were come , whenas it lacked scarce an hour of sunset , to [the banks of [another river]1042-another river]1041-the banks of another river , not right great , but bigger than the last one . There [the Maid]543-the maid cast [herself]543-the maid down and said : " [Friend]1695-friend , no further will [[thy]1695-friend friend]2235-thy friend go this even ; nay , to say sooth , [she]2235-thy friend can not . So now [we]1039-they will eat of [thy]543-the maid venison , and then shall [my]543-the maid tale be , since [I]543-the maid may no longer delay it ; and thereafter shall [our]1039-they slumber be sweet and safe as [I]543-the maid deem . "[543-the maid]

[She]543-the maid spake merrily now , and as [one who feared nothing]1044-one who feared nothing , and [Walter]35-walter was much heartened by [her]543-the maid words and [her]543-the maid voice , and [he]35-walter fell to and made a fire , and a woodland oven in [the earth]1629-the earth , and sithence dighted [his]35-walter fowl , and baked them after the manner of [wood - men]1046-wood - men . And [they]1047-they ate , both of [them]1047-they , in all love , and in good - liking of life , and were much strengthened by [their]1047-they supper . And when [they]1047-they were done , [Walter]35-walter eked [his]35-walter fire , both against the chill of the midnight and dawning , and for a guard against wild beasts , and by that time night was come , and the moon arisen . Then [the Maiden]183-the maiden drew up to the fire , and turned to [Walter]35-walter and [spake]35-walter .

CHAPTER XXIV : [THE MAID]72-the maid TELLS OF WHAT HAD BEFALLEN [HER]543-the maid

" Now , [friend]1695-friend , by the clear of the moon and this firelight will [I]72-the maid tell what [I]72-the maid may and can of [my]72-the maid tale . Thus it is : If [I]72-the maid be wholly of the race of [Adam]49-adam [I]72-the maid wot not nor can [I]72-the maid tell [thee]2237-thee how many years old [I]72-the maid may be . For there are , as it were , shards or gaps in [my]72-the maid life , wherein are but a few things dimly remembered , and doubtless many things forgotten . [I]72-the maid remember well when [I]72-the maid was [a little child]2238-a little child , and right happy , and there were people about [me]72-the maid whom [I]72-the maid loved , and who loved [me]72-the maid . It was not in [this land]1735-this land ; but all things were lovely there ; the year 's beginning , the happy mid - year , the year 's waning , the year 's ending , and then again its beginning . That passed away , and then for a while is more than dimness , for nought [I]72-the maid remember save that [I]72-the maid was . Thereafter [I]72-the maid remember again , and am [a young maiden]2240-a young maiden , and [I]72-the maid know some things , and long to know more . [I]72-the maid am nowise happy ; [I]72-the maid am amongst people who bid [me]72-the maid go , and [I]72-the maid go ; and do this , and [I]72-the maid do it : [none]2241-none loveth [me]72-the maid , none tormenteth [me]72-the maid ; but [I]72-the maid wear [my]72-the maid heart in longing for [I]72-the maid scarce know what . Neither then am [I]72-the maid in [this land]1735-this land , but in [a land that [I]72-the maid love not]2243-a land that i love not , and [a house that is big and stately , but nought lovely]2244-a house that is big and stately , but nought lovely . Then is a dim time again , and sithence a time not right clear ; an evil time , wherein [I]72-the maid am older , [wellnigh grown to womanhood]2245-wellnigh grown to womanhood . There are a many folk about [me]72-the maid , and [they]2246-them foul , and greedy , and hard ; and [my]72-the maid spirit is fierce , and [my]72-the maid body feeble ; and [I]72-the maid am set to tasks that [I]72-the maid would not do , by [them]2246-them that are unwiser than [I]72-the maid ; and smitten [I]72-the maid am by [them]2246-them that are less valiant than [I]72-the maid ; and [I]72-the maid know lack , and stripes , and divers misery . But all that is now become but a dim picture to [me]72-the maid , save that amongst [all these unfriends]2247-all these unfriends is [a friend to [me]72-the maid]2248-a friend to me ; [an old woman , who telleth [me]72-the maid sweet tales of other life , wherein all is high and goodly , or at the least valiant and doughty]2249-an old woman , who telleth me sweet tales of other life , wherein all is high and goodly , or at the least valiant and doughty , and [she]2249-an old woman , who telleth me sweet tales of other life , wherein all is high and goodly , or at the least valiant and doughty setteth hope in [my]72-the maid heart and learneth [me]72-the maid , and maketh [me]72-the maid to know much . . . O much . . . so that at last [I]72-the maid am grown wise , and wise to be mighty if [I]72-the maid durst . Yet am [I]72-the maid nought in [this land]1735-this land all this while , but , as [meseemeth]2251-meseemeth , in a great and [a foul city]2252-a foul city . "[72-the maid]

" And then , as it were , [I]72-the maid fall asleep ; and in [my]72-the maid sleep is nought , save here and there a wild dream , somedeal lovely , somedeal hideous : but of this dream is [[my]72-the maid Mistress]1816-my mistress a part , and the monster , withal , whose head [thou]2254-thou didst cleave to - day . But when [I]72-the maid am awaken from it , then am [I]72-the maid verily in [this land]1735-this land , and [myself]72-the maid , as [thou]2254-thou seest [me]72-the maid to - day . And the first part of [my]72-the maid life here is this , that [I]72-the maid am in the pillared ball yonder , half - clad and with bound hands ; and [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf leadeth [me]72-the maid to [the Lady]576-the lady , and [I]72-the maid hear [his]182-the dwarf horrible croak as [he]182-the dwarf sayeth : ' [Lady]1863-lady , will [this one]2259-this one do ? ' and then the sweet voice of [the Lady]576-the lady saying : ' [This one]2259-this one will do ; [thou]2254-thou shalt have [thy]2254-thou reward : now , set [thou]2254-thou the token upon [her]576-the lady . ' Then [I]72-the maid remember [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf dragging [me]72-the maid away , and [my]72-the maid heart sinking for fear of [him]182-the dwarf : but for that time [he]182-the dwarf did [me]72-the maid no more harm than the rivetting upon [my]72-the maid leg this iron ring which here [thou]2254-thou seest . "[72-the maid]

" So from that time forward [I]72-the maid have lived in [this land]1735-this land , and been the thrall of [the Lady]576-the lady ; and [I]72-the maid remember [my]72-the maid life here day by day , and no part of it has fallen into the dimness of dreams . [Thereof]2265-thereof will [I]72-the maid tell [thee]2254-thou but little : but this [I]72-the maid will tell [thee]2254-thou , that in spite of [my]72-the maid past dreams , or it may be because of them , [I]72-the maid had not lost the wisdom which [the old woman]2266-the old woman had erst learned [me]72-the maid , and for more wisdom [I]72-the maid longed . Maybe this longing shall now make both [thee]2254-thou and [me]72-the maid happy , but for the passing time it brought [me]72-the maid grief . For at first [[my]72-the maid Mistress]1816-my mistress was indeed wayward with [me]72-the maid , but as [any great lady]2268-any great lady might be with [her]1816-my mistress bought thrall , whiles caressing [me]72-the maid , and whiles chastising [me]72-the maid , as [her]1816-my mistress mood went ; but [she]1816-my mistress seemed not to be cruel of malice , or with any set purpose . But so it was rather little by little than by any great sudden uncovering of [my]72-the maid intent , that [she]1816-my mistress came to know that [I]72-the maid also had some of the wisdom whereby [she]1816-my mistress lived [her]1816-my mistress queenly life . That was about two years after [I]72-the maid was first [her]1816-my mistress thrall , and three weary years have gone by since [she]1816-my mistress began to see in [me]72-the maid the enemy of [her]1816-my mistress days . Now why or wherefore [I]72-the maid know not , but it seemeth that it would not avail [her]1816-my mistress to slay [me]72-the maid outright , or suffer [me]72-the maid to die ; but nought withheld [her]1816-my mistress from piling up griefs and miseries on [my]72-the maid head . At last [she]1816-my mistress set [[her]1816-my mistress servant]2269-her servant , [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf , upon [me]72-the maid , even [he]182-the dwarf whose head [thou]72-the maid clavest to - day . Many things [I]72-the maid bore from [him]182-the dwarf whereof it were unseemly for [my]72-the maid tongue to tell before [thee]72-the maid ; but the time came when [he]182-the dwarf exceeded , and [I]72-the maid could bear no more ; and then [I]72-the maid showed [him]182-the dwarf this sharp knife wherewith [I]72-the maid would have thrust [me]72-the maid through to the heart if [thou]72-the maid hadst not pardoned [me]72-the maid e'en now , and [I]72-the maid told [him]182-the dwarf that if [he]182-the dwarf forbore [me]72-the maid not , [I]72-the maid would slay , not [him]182-the dwarf , but [myself]72-the maid ; and this [he]182-the dwarf might not away with because of the commandment of [the Lady]576-the lady , who had given [him]182-the dwarf the word that in any case [I]72-the maid must be kept living . And [her]576-the lady hand , withal , fear held somewhat hereafter . Yet was there need to [me]72-the maid of all [my]72-the maid wisdom ; for with all this [her]576-the lady hatred grew , and whiles raged within [her]576-the lady so furiously that it overmastered [her]576-the lady fear , and at such times [she]576-the lady would have put [me]72-the maid to death if [I]72-the maid had not escaped [her]576-the lady by some turn of [my]72-the maid lore . "[72-the maid]

" Now further , [I]1049-i shall tell [thee]576-the lady that somewhat more than a year ago hither to [this land]1735-this land came [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , [the second goodly man]2275-the second goodly man , as [thou]2276-thou art the third , whom [her]576-the lady sorceries have drawn hither since [I]1049-i have dwelt [here]2104-here . Forsooth , when [he]1781-the king 's son first came , [he]1781-the king 's son seemed to [us]2278-us , to [me]1049-i , and yet more to [[my]1049-i Lady]1767-my lady , to be as beautiful as [an angel]2280-an angel , and sorely [she]1767-my lady loved [him]1781-the king 's son ; and [he]1781-the king 's son [her]1767-my lady , after [his]1781-the king 's son fashion : but [he]1781-the king 's son was light - minded , and cold - hearted , and in a while [he]1781-the king 's son must needs turn [his]1781-the king 's son eyes upon [me]1049-i , and offer [me]1049-i [his]1781-the king 's son love , which was but foul and unkind as it turned out ; for when [I]1049-i nay - said [him]1781-the king 's son , as maybe [I]1049-i had not done save for fear of [[my]1049-i Mistress]1816-my mistress , [he]1781-the king 's son had no pity upon [me]1049-i , but spared not to lead [me]1049-i into the trap of [her]1816-my mistress wrath , and leave [me]1049-i without help , or a good word . But , [O friend]2282-o friend , in spite of all grief and anguish , [I]1049-i learned still , and waxed wise , and wiser , abiding the day of [my]1049-i deliverance , which has come , and [thou]2283-thou art come . "[1049-i]

Therewith [she]1049-i took [Walter]35-walter 's hands and kissed them ; but [he]35-walter kissed [her]1049-i face , and [her]1049-i tears wet [her]1049-i lips . Then [she]1049-i went on : " But sithence , months ago , [the Lady]576-the lady began to weary of [this dastard]2285-this dastard , despite of [his]2285-this dastard beauty ; and then it was [thy]576-the lady turn to be swept into [her]1049-i net ; [I]1049-i partly guess how . For on a day in broad daylight , as [I]1049-i was serving [[my]1049-i Mistress]1816-my mistress in [the hall]1860-the hall , and [the Evil Thing , whose head is now cloven]2288-the evil thing , whose head is now cloven , was lying across the threshold of the door , as it were a dream fell upon [me]1049-i , though [I]1049-i strove to cast it off for fear of chastisement ; for [the pillared hall]887-the pillared hall wavered , and vanished from [my]1049-i sight , and [my]1049-i feet were treading a rough stone pavement instead of the marble wonder of [the hall]1860-the hall , and there was the scent of [the salt sea]2291-the salt sea and of the tackle of [ships]2292-ships , and behind [me]1049-i were [tall houses]2293-tall houses , and before [me]1049-i [the ships]2294-the ships indeed , with [their]2294-the ships ropes beating and [their]2294-the ships sails flapping and [their]2294-the ships masts wavering ; and in [mine]1049-i ears was the hale and how of [mariners]2295-mariners ; things that [I]1049-i had seen and heard in the dimness of [my]1049-i life gone by . "[1049-i]

" And there was [I]1049-i , and [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf before [me]1049-i , and [the Lady]576-the lady after [me]1049-i , going over the gangway aboard of [a tall ship]138-a tall ship , and [she]1050-i gathered way and was gotten out of [the haven]1551-the haven , and straightway [I]1049-i saw [the mariners]136-the mariners cast abroad [their]136-the mariners ancient . "[1049-i]

Quoth [Walter]35-walter : " What then ! Sawest [thou]2301-thou the blazon thereon , of a wolf - like beast ramping up against [a maiden]171-a maiden ? And that might well have been [thou]2301-thou . "[35-walter]

[She]1050-i said : " Yea , so it was ; but refrain [thee]35-walter , that [I]1050-i may tell on [my]1050-i tale ! [The ship]155-the ship and [the sea]89-the sea vanished away , but [I]1050-i was not back in [the hall of the Golden House]2305-the hall of the golden house ; and again were [we]2306-we three in [the street of [the self - same town which [we]2306-we had but just left]2308-the self - same town which we had but just left]2307-the street of the self - same town which we had but just left ; but somewhat dim was [my]1050-i vision thereof , and [I]1050-i saw little save the door of [a goodly house]2309-a goodly house before [me]1050-i , and speedily it died out , and [we]2306-we were again in [the pillared hall]887-the pillared hall , wherein [my]1050-i thralldom was made manifest . "[1050-i]

" [Maiden]55-maiden , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter , " one question [I]35-walter would ask [thee]1051-i ; to wit , didst [thou]1051-i see [me]35-walter on [the quay]2311-the quay by [the ships]2294-the ships ? "[35-walter]

" Nay , "[1051-i] [she]1051-i said , " there were [many folk about]2313-many folk about , but they were all as images of [the aliens]2314-the aliens to [me]1051-i . Now hearken further : three months thereafter came the dream upon [me]1051-i again , when [we]2306-we were all three together in [the Pillared Hall]887-the pillared hall ; and again was the vision somewhat dim . Once more [we]2306-we were in [the street of [a busy town]2317-a busy town]2316-the street of a busy town , but all unlike to that other one , and there were [men]165-men standing together on [our]2306-we right hands by the door of [a house]2319-a house . "[1051-i]

" [Yea]2320-yea , [yea]2320-yea , "[35-walter] quoth [Walter]35-walter ; " and , forsooth , one of [them]165-men was who but [I.]1051-i "[35-walter]

" Refrain [thee]35-walter , [beloved]2321-beloved ! "[1051-i] [she]1051-i said ; " for [my]1051-i tale draweth to its ending , and [I]1051-i would have [thee]35-walter hearken heedfully : for maybe [thou]35-walter shalt once again deem [my]1051-i deed past pardon . Some twenty days after this last dream , [I]1051-i had some leisure from [[my]1051-i Mistress]1816-my mistress 's service , so [I]1051-i went to disport [me]1051-i by the Well of the Oak - tree or forsooth [she]1051-i might have set in [my]1051-i mind the thought of going there , that [I]1051-i might meet [thee]1051-i and give [her]1051-i some occasion against [me]1051-i ; and [I]1051-i sat thereby , nowise loving [the earth]1629-the earth , but sick at heart , because of late [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son had been more than ever instant with [me]1051-i to yield [him]1781-the king 's son [my]1051-i body , threatening [me]1051-i else with casting [me]1051-i into all that the worst could do to [me]1051-i of torments and shames day by day . [I]1051-i say [my]1051-i heart failed [me]1051-i , and [I]1051-i was wellnigh brought to the point of yea- saying [his]1781-the king 's son desires , that [I]1051-i might take the chance of something befalling [me]1051-i that were less bad than the worst . But here must [I]1051-i tell [thee]1051-i a thing , and pray [thee]1051-i to take it to heart . This , more than aught else , had given [me]1051-i strength to nay - say that dastard , that [my]1051-i wisdom both hath been , and now is , the wisdom of [a wise maid]2326-a wise maid , and not of [a woman]526-a woman , and all the might thereof shall [I]1051-i lose with [my]1051-i maidenhead . Evil wilt [thou]1051-i think of [me]1051-i then , for all [I]1051-i was tried so sore , that [I]1051-i was at point to cast it all away , so wretchedly as [I]1051-i shrank from the horror of [the Lady]576-the lady 's wrath . "[1051-i]

" But there as [I]1052-i sat pondering these things , [I]1052-i saw [a man]229-a man coming , and thought no otherwise thereof but that it was [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , till [I]1052-i saw [the stranger]2332-the stranger drawing near , and [his]2332-the stranger golden hair , and [his]2332-the stranger grey eyes ; and then [I]1052-i heard [his]2332-the stranger voice , and [his]2332-the stranger kindness pierced [my]1052-i heart , and [I]1052-i knew that [[my]1052-i friend]1798-my friend had come to see [me]1052-i ; and O , [friend]1695-friend , these tears are for the sweetness of that past hour ! "[1052-i]

Said [Walter]35-walter : " [I]35-walter came to see [[my]35-walter friend]1798-my friend , [I]35-walter also . Now have [I]35-walter noted what [thou]1798-my friend badest [me]35-walter ; and [I]35-walter will forbear all as [thou]1798-my friend commandest [me]35-walter , till [we]2336-we be safe out of [the desert]478-the desert and far away from all evil things ; but wilt [thou]1798-my friend ban [me]35-walter from all caresses ? "[35-walter]

[She]1052-i laughed amidst of [her]1052-i tears , and said : " O , nay , [poor lad]2338-poor lad , if [thou]1798-my friend wilt be but wise . "[1052-i]

Then [she]1052-i leaned toward [him]35-walter , and took [his]35-walter face betwixt [her]1052-i hands and kissed [him]35-walter oft , and the tears started in [his]35-walter eyes for love and pity of [her]1052-i .

Then [she]1052-i said : " Alas , [friend]1695-friend ! even yet mayst [thou]1798-my friend doom [me]1052-i guilty , and all [thy]1798-my friend love may turn away from [me]1052-i , when [I]1052-i have told [thee]35-walter all that [I]1052-i have done for the sake of [thee]35-walter and [me]1052-i . O , if then there might be some chastisement for [the guilty woman]2340-the guilty woman , and not mere sundering ! "[1052-i]

" Fear nothing , [sweetling]2341-sweetling , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter ; " for indeed [I]35-walter deem that already [I]35-walter know partly what [thou]1798-my friend hast done . "[35-walter]

[She]1052-i sighed , and said : " [I]1052-i will tell [thee]35-walter next , that [I]1052-i banned [thy]1798-my friend kissing and caressing of [me]1052-i till to - day because [I]1052-i knew that [[my]1052-i Mistress]1816-my mistress would surely know if [a man]229-a man , if [thou]1798-my friend , hadst so much as touched a finger of [mine]1052-i in love , it was to try [me]1052-i herein that on the morning of the hunting [she]1816-my mistress kissed and embraced [me]1052-i , till [I]1052-i almost died thereof , and showed [thee]35-walter [my]1052-i shoulder and [my]1052-i limbs ; and to try [thee]35-walter withal , if [thine]1798-my friend eye should glister or [thy]1798-my friend cheek flush thereat ; for indeed [she]1816-my mistress was raging in jealousy of [thee]35-walter . Next , [[my]1052-i friend]1798-my friend , even whiles [we]2345-we were talking together at [the Well of [the Rock]19-the rock]2346-the well of the rock , [I]1052-i was pondering on what [we]2345-we should do to escape from [this land of lies]2347-this land of lies . Maybe [thou]35-walter wilt say : Why didst [thou]35-walter not take [my]1052-i hand and flee with [me]1052-i as [we]2345-we fled to - day ? [Friend]1695-friend , it is most true , that were [she]1816-my mistress not dead [we]2345-we had not escaped thus far . For [[her]1816-my mistress trackers]2349-her trackers would have followed [us]2345-we , set on by [her]1816-my mistress , and brought [us]2345-we back to an evil fate . Therefore [I]1052-i tell [thee]35-walter that from the first [I]1052-i did plot the death of [those two]686-those two , [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf and [the Mistress]1828-the mistress . For no otherwise mightest [thou]35-walter live , or [I]1052-i escape from death in life . But as to [the dastard who threatened [me]1052-i with a thrall 's pains]2353-the dastard who threatened me with a thrall 's pains , [I]1052-i heeded [him]2353-the dastard who threatened me with a thrall 's pains nought to live or die , for well [I]1052-i knew that [thy]35-walter valiant sword , [yea]35-walter , or [thy]35-walter bare hands , would speedily tame [him]2353-the dastard who threatened me with a thrall 's pains . Now first [I]1052-i knew that [I]1052-i must make a show of yielding to [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son ; and somewhat how [I]1052-i did therein , [thou]35-walter knowest . But no night and no time did [I]1052-i give [him]1781-the king 's son to bed [me]1052-i , till after [I]1052-i had met [thee]35-walter as [thou]35-walter wentest to [the Golden House]15-the golden house , before the adventure of fetching the lion 's skin ; and up to that time [I]1052-i had scarce known what to do , save ever to bid [thee]35-walter , with sore grief and pain , to yield [thee]35-walter to [the wicked woman]2356-the wicked woman 's desire . But as [we]2357-we spake together there by [the stream]459-the stream , and [I]1052-i saw that [the Evil Thing whose head [thou]35-walter clavest e'en]2359-the evil thing whose head thou clavest e'en now was spying on [us]2357-we , then amidst the sickness of terror which ever came over [me]1052-i whensoever [I]1052-i thought of [him]1781-the king 's son , and much more when [I]1052-i saw [him]1781-the king 's son ah ! [he]1781-the king 's son is dead now ! , it came flashing into [my]1052-i mind how [I]1052-i might destroy [[my]1052-i enemy]2360-my enemy . Therefore [I]1052-i made [the Dwarf [my]1052-i messenger]2361-the dwarf my messenger to [her]2356-the wicked woman , by bidding [thee]2356-the wicked woman to [my]1052-i bed in such wise that [he]1781-the king 's son might hear it . And wot [thou]2356-the wicked woman well , that [he]1781-the king 's son speedily carried [her]2356-the wicked woman the tidings . Meanwhile [I]1052-i hastened to lie to [[the King]1780-the king 's Son]1781-the king 's son , and all privily bade [him]1781-the king 's son come to [me]1052-i and not [thee]2356-the wicked woman . And thereafter , by dint of waiting and watching , and taking the only chance that there was , [I]1052-i met [thee]2356-the wicked woman as [thou]2356-the wicked woman camest back from fetching the skin of the lion that never was , and gave [thee]2356-the wicked woman that warning , or else had [we]2364-we been undone indeed . "[1052-i]

Said [Walter]35-walter : " Was the lion of [her]2356-the wicked woman making or of thine then ? "[35-walter]

[She]1053-she said : " Of [hers]2356-the wicked woman : why should [I]1053-she deal with such a matter ? "[1053-she]

" [Yea]2365-yea , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter , " but [she]2356-the wicked woman verily swooned , and [she]2356-the wicked woman was verily wroth with [the Enemy]2036-the enemy . "[35-walter]

[The Maid]543-the maid smiled , and said : " If [her]2356-the wicked woman lie was not like very sooth , then had [she]2356-the wicked woman not been [the crafts - master]2367-the crafts - master that [I]543-the maid knew [her]2356-the wicked woman : one may lie otherwise than with the tongue alone : yet indeed [her]2356-the wicked woman wrath against [the Enemy]2036-the enemy was nought feigned ; for [the Enemy]75-the enemy was even [I]543-the maid , and in these latter days never did [her]2356-the wicked woman wrath leave [me]543-the maid . But to go on with [my]543-the maid tale . "[543-the maid]

" Now doubt [thou]2369-thee not , that , when [thou]2369-thee camest into [the hall]1860-the hall yester eve , [the Mistress]1828-the mistress knew of [thy]2369-thee counterfeit tryst with [me]543-the maid , and meant nought but death for [thee]2369-thee ; yet first would [she]1828-the mistress have [thee]2369-thee in [her]1828-the mistress arms again , therefore did [she]1828-the mistress make much of [thee]2369-thee at table and that was partly for [my]543-the maid torment also , and therefore did [she]1828-the mistress make that tryst with [thee]2369-thee , and deemed doubtless that [thou]2369-thee wouldst not dare to forgo it , even if [thou]2369-thee shouldst go to [me]543-the maid thereafter . "[543-the maid]

" Now [I]543-the maid had trained that dastard to [me]543-the maid as [I]543-the maid have told [thee]2369-thee , but [I]543-the maid gave [him]2369-thee a sleepy draught , so that when [I]543-the maid came to the bed [he]2369-thee might not move toward [me]543-the maid nor open [his]2369-thee eyes : but [I]543-the maid lay down beside [him]2369-thee , so that [the Lady]576-the lady might know that [my]543-the maid body had been there ; for well had [she]576-the lady wotted if it had not . Then as there [I]543-the maid lay [I]543-the maid cast over [him]2369-thee [thy]2369-thee shape , so that none might have known but that [thou]2369-thee wert lying by [my]543-the maid side , and there , trembling , [I]543-the maid abode what should befall . Thus [I]543-the maid passed through the hour whenas [thou]2369-thee shouldest have been at [[her]576-the lady chamber]695-her chamber , and the time of [my]543-the maid tryst with [thee]2369-thee was come as [the Mistress]1828-the mistress would be deeming ; so that [I]543-the maid looked for [her]576-the lady speedily , and [my]543-the maid heart wellnigh failed [me]543-the maid for fear of [her]576-the lady cruelty . "[543-the maid]

" Presently then [I]543-the maid heard a stirring in [[her]576-the lady chamber]695-her chamber , and [I]543-the maid slipped from out the bed , and hid [me]543-the maid behind the hangings , and was like to die for fear of [her]576-the lady ; and lo , presently [she]576-the lady came stealing in softly , holding a lamp in one hand and a knife in the other . And [I]543-the maid tell [thee]2369-thee of a sooth that [I]543-the maid also had a sharp knife in [my]543-the maid hand to defend [my]543-the maid life if need were . [She]576-the lady held the lamp up above [her]576-the lady head before [she]576-the lady drew near to the bed - side , and [I]543-the maid heard [her]576-the lady mutter : ' [She]576-the lady is not there then ! but [she]576-the lady shall be taken . ' Then [she]576-the lady went up to the bed and stooped over it , and laid [her]576-the lady hand on the place where [I]543-the maid had lain ; and therewith [her]576-the lady eyes turned to that false image of [thee]2369-thee lying there , and [she]576-the lady fell a - trembling and shaking , and the lamp fell to the ground and was quenched but there was bright moonlight in [the room]2376-the room , and still [I]543-the maid could see what betid . But [she]576-the lady uttered a noise like the low roar of a wild beast , and [I]543-the maid saw [her]576-the lady arm and hand rise up , and the flashing of the steel beneath the hand , and then down came the hand and the steel , and [I]543-the maid went nigh to swooning lest perchance [I]543-the maid had wrought over well , and thine image were [thy]2369-thee very self . [The dastard]2377-the dastard died without a groan : why should [I]543-the maid lament [him]2377-the dastard ? [I]543-the maid can not . But [the Lady]576-the lady drew [him]2377-the dastard toward [her]576-the lady , and snatched the clothes from off [his]2377-the dastard shoulders and breast , and fell a - gibbering sounds mostly without meaning , but broken here and there with words . Then [I]543-the maid heard [her]576-the lady say : ' [I]543-the maid shall forget ; [I]543-the maid shall forget ; and the new days shall come . ' Then was there silence of [her]576-the lady a little , and thereafter [she]576-the lady cried out in a terrible voice : ' O no , no , no ! [I]543-the maid can not forget ; [I]543-the maid can not forget ; ' and [she]576-the lady raised a great wailing cry that filled all the night with horror didst [thou]2369-thee not hear it ? , and caught up the knife from the bed and thrust it into [her]576-the lady breast , and fell down a dead heap over the bed and on to [the man whom [she]576-the lady had slain]2379-the man whom she had slain . And then [I]543-the maid thought of [thee]2380-thou , and joy smote across [my]543-the maid terror ; how shall [I]543-the maid gainsay it ? And [I]543-the maid fled away to [thee]2380-thou , and [I]543-the maid took [thine]2380-thou hands in [mine]543-the maid , [thy]2380-thou dear hands , and [we]2381-we fled away together . Shall [we]2381-we be still together ? "[543-the maid]

[He]1055-i spoke slowly , and touched [her]1056-her not , and [she]1056-her , forbearing all sobbing and weeping , sat looking wistfully on [him]1055-i . [He]1055-i said : " [I]1055-i think [thou]2380-thou hast told [me]1055-i all ; and whether [thy]2380-thou guile slew [her]1056-her , or [her]1056-her own evil heart , [she]1056-her was slain last night who lay in [mine]1055-i arms the night before . It was ill , and ill done of [me]1055-i , for [I]1055-i loved not [her]1056-her , but [thee]1056-her , and [I]1055-i wished for [her]1056-her death that [I]1055-i might be with [thee]1056-her . [Thou]2380-thou wottest this , and still [thou]2380-thou lovest [me]1055-i , it may be overweeningly . What have [I]1055-i to say then ? If there be any guilt of guile , [I]1055-i also was in the guile ; and if there be any guilt of murder , [I]1055-i also was in the murder . Thus [we]2382-we say to [each other]421-each other ; and to [God]44-god and [[his]1055-i Hallows]1671-his hallows [we]2382-we say : ' [We]2382-we two have conspired to slay [the woman who tormented one of [us]2382-we]2385-the woman who tormented one of us , and would have slain [the other]922-the other ; and if [we]2382-we have done amiss therein , then shall [we]2382-we two together pay the penalty ; for in this have [we]2382-we done as [one body and one soul]2387-one body and one soul . ' "[1055-i]

Therewith [he]1057-he put [his]1057-he arms about [her]1058-her and kissed [her]1058-her , but soberly and friendly , as if [he]1057-he would comfort [her]1058-her . And thereafter [he]1057-he said to [her]1058-her : " Maybe to - morrow , in the sunlight , [I]1057-he will ask [thee]1058-her of [this woman]592-this woman , what [she]592-this woman verily was ; but now let [her]592-this woman be . And [thou]1058-her , [thou]1058-her art over - wearied , and [I]1057-he bid [thee]1058-her sleep . "[1057-he]

So [he]1057-he went about and gathered of bracken a great heap for [her]1058-her bed , and did [his]1057-he coat thereover , and led [her]1058-her thereto , and [she]1058-her lay down meekly , and smiled and crossed [her]1058-her arms over [her]1058-her bosom , and presently fell asleep . But as for [him]1057-he , [he]1057-he watched by the fire - side till dawn began to glimmer , and then [he]1057-he also laid [him]1057-he down and slept .

CHAPTER XXV : OF THE TRIUMPHANT SUMMER ARRAY OF [THE MAID]543-the maid

When the day was bright [Walter]35-walter arose , and met [the Maid]543-the maid coming from [the river - bank]1061-the river - bank , fresh and rosy from the water . [She]543-the maid paled a little when [they]1062-they met face to face , and [she]543-the maid shrank from [him]35-walter shyly . But [he]35-walter took [her]543-the maid hand and kissed [her]543-the maid frankly ; and [the two]1063-the two were glad , and had no need to tell [each other]421-each other of [their]1063-the two joy , though much else [they]1063-the two deemed [they]1063-the two had to say , could [they]1063-the two have found words thereto .

So [they]1063-the two came to [their]1063-the two fire and sat down , and fell to breakfast ; and ere [they]1063-the two were done , [the Maid]543-the maid said : " [[My]543-the maid Master]1599-my master , [thou]2390-thou seest [we]1063-the two be come nigh unto [the hill - country]2391-the hill - country , and to - day about sunset , belike , [we]1063-the two shall come into [the Land of [the Bear - folk]1687-the bear - folk]2392-the land of the bear - folk ; and both it is , that there is peril if [we]1063-the two fall into [their]1687-the bear - folk hands , and that [we]1063-the two may scarce escape [them]1687-the bear - folk . Yet [I]543-the maid deem that [we]1063-the two may deal with the peril by wisdom . "[543-the maid]

" What is the peril ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter ; " [I]35-walter mean , what is the worst of it ? "[35-walter]

Said [the Maid]543-the maid : " To be offered up in sacrifice to [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god . "[543-the maid]

" But if [we]1063-the two escape death at [their]1687-the bear - folk hands , what then ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

" One of two things , "[543-the maid] said [she]543-the maid ; " the first that [they]1687-the bear - folk shall take [us]1063-the two into [[their]1687-the bear - folk tribe]2395-their tribe . "[543-the maid]

" And will [they]1687-the bear - folk sunder [us]1063-the two in that case ? "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

" Nay , "[543-the maid] said [she]543-the maid .

[Walter]35-walter laughed and said : " Therein is little harm then . But what is the other chance ? "[35-walter]

Said [she]543-the maid : " That [we]1063-the two leave [them]1687-the bear - folk with [their]1687-the bear - folk goodwill , and come back to [one of [the lands of [Christendom]20-christendom]2397-the lands of christendom]2396-one of the lands of christendom . "[543-the maid]

Said [Walter]35-walter : " [I]35-walter am not all so sure that this is the better of the two choices , though , forsooth , [thou]2398-thou seemest to think so . But tell [me]35-walter now , what like is [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god , that [they]1687-the bear - folk should offer up new - comers to [him]2394-their god ? "[35-walter]

" [[Their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god is [a woman]526-a woman , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said , " and [the Mother of [[their]1687-the bear - folk nation and tribes]2403-their nation and tribes]2402-the mother of their nation and tribes or so [they]1687-the bear - folk deem before the days when [they]1687-the bear - folk had [chieftains]2404-chieftains and [Lords of Battle]2405-lords of battle . "[543-the maid]

" That will be long ago , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter ; " how then may [she]543-the maid be living now ? "[35-walter]

Said [the Maid]543-the maid : " Doubtless that [woman of yore agone]2406-woman of yore agone is dead this many and many a year ; but [they]1687-the bear - folk take to [them]1687-the bear - folk still [a new woman]2407-a new woman , one after other , as [they]1687-the bear - folk may happen on [them]1687-the bear - folk , to be in the stead of [the Ancient Mother]2408-the ancient mother . And to tell [thee]2409-thee the very truth right out , [she]543-the maid that lieth dead in [the Pillared Hall]887-the pillared hall was even the last of these ; and now , if [they]1687-the bear - folk knew it , [they]1687-the bear - folk lack [a God]1807-a god . This shall [we]2412-we tell [them]1687-the bear - folk . "[543-the maid]

" Yea , yea ! "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter , " a goodly welcome shall [we]2412-we have of [them]1687-the bear - folk then , if [we]2412-we come amongst [them]1687-the bear - folk with [our]2412-we hands red with the blood of [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god ! "[35-walter]

[She]1068-she smiled on [him]35-walter and said : " If [I]1068-she come amongst [them]1687-the bear - folk with the tidings that [I]1068-she have slain [her]1068-she , and [they]1687-the bear - folk trow therein , without doubt [they]1687-the bear - folk shall make [me]1068-she [Lady]1863-lady and [Goddess]2415-goddess in [her]1068-she stead . "[1068-she]

" This is a strange word , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter " but if so [they]1687-the bear - folk do , how shall that further [us]2416-us in reaching [the kindreds of [the world]118-the world]2417-the kindreds of the world , and [the folk of [Holy Church]2420-holy church]2419-the folk of holy church ? "[1068-she]

[She]1068-she laughed outright , so joyous was [she]1068-she grown , now that [she]1068-she knew that [his]35-walter life was yet to be a part of [hers]1068-she . " [Sweetheart]76-sweetheart , "[1068-she] [she]1068-she said , " now [I]1068-she see that [thou]2421-thou desirest wholly what [I]1068-she desire ; yet in any case , abiding with [them]1687-the bear - folk would be living and not dying , even as [thou]2421-thou hadst it e'en now . But , forsooth , [they]1687-the bear - folk will not hinder [our]2416-us departure if [they]1687-the bear - folk deem [me]1068-she [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god ; [they]1687-the bear - folk do not look for it , nor desire it , that [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god should dwell with [them]1687-the bear - folk daily . Have no fear . "[1068-she] Then [she]1068-she laughed again , and said : " What ! [thou]2421-thou lookest on [me]1068-she and deemest [me]1068-she to be but a sorry image of [a goddess]2424-a goddess ; and [me]1068-she with [my]1068-she scanty coat and bare arms and naked feet ! But wait ! [I]1068-she know well how to array [me]1068-she when the time cometh . [Thou]2421-thou shalt see it ! And now , [[my]1068-she Master]1599-my master , were it not meet that [we]1069-they took to [the road]1731-the road ? "[1068-she]

So [they]1069-they arose , and found [a ford of [the river]334-the river]1070-a ford of the river that took [the Maid]72-the maid but to the knee , and so set forth up the greensward of the slopes whereas there were but few trees ; so went [they]1069-they faring toward [the hill - country]2391-the hill - country .

At the last [they]1069-they were come to the feet of [the very hills]1073-the very hills , and in the hollows betwixt the buttresses of [them]1073-the very hills grew nut and berry trees , and the greensward round about [them]1069-they was both thick and much flowery . There [they]1069-they stayed [them]1069-they and dined , whereas [Walter]35-walter had shot a hare by the way , and [they]1069-they had found a bubbling spring under a grey stone in [a bight of [the coppice]1075-the coppice]1074-a bight of the coppice , wherein now the birds were singing their best .

When [they]1069-they had eaten and had rested somewhat , [the Maid]543-the maid arose and said : " Now shall [the Queen]2427-the queen array [herself]543-the maid , and seem like [a very goddess]2428-a very goddess . "[543-the maid]

Then [she]543-the maid fell to work , while [Walter]35-walter looked on ; and [she]543-the maid made a garland for [her]543-the maid head of eglantine where the roses were the fairest ; and with mingled flowers of the summer [she]543-the maid wreathed [her]543-the maid middle about , and let the garland of them hang down to below [her]543-the maid knees ; and knots of the flowers [she]543-the maid made fast to the skirts of [her]543-the maid coat , and did them for arm - rings about [her]543-the maid arms , and for anklets and sandals for [her]543-the maid feet . Then [she]543-the maid set a garland about [Walter]35-walter 's head , and then stood a little off from [him]35-walter and set [her]543-the maid feet together , and lifted up [her]543-the maid arms , and said : " Lo now ! am [I]543-the maid not as like to [the Mother of Summer]2429-the mother of summer as if [I]543-the maid were clad in silk and gold ? and even so shall [I]543-the maid be deemed by [the folk of [the Bear]77-the bear]2430-the folk of the bear . Come now , [thou]2431-thou shalt see how all shall be well . "[543-the maid]

[She]543-the maid laughed joyously ; but [he]35-walter might scarce laugh for pity of [his]35-walter love . Then [they]1077-they set forth again , and began to climb [the hills]1078-the hills , and the hours wore as [they]1077-they went in sweet converse ; till at last [Walter]35-walter looked on [the Maid]543-the maid , and smiled on [her]543-the maid , and said : " One thing [I]35-walter would say to [thee]543-the maid , [lovely friend]2432-lovely friend , to wit : wert [thou]543-the maid clad in silk and gold , [thy]543-the maid stately raiment might well suffer a few stains , or here and there a rent maybe ; but stately would it be still when [the folk of the Bear]2430-the folk of the bear should come up against [thee]543-the maid . But as to this flowery array of thine , in a few hours it shall be all faded and nought . Nay , even now , as [I]35-walter look on [thee]543-the maid , the meadow - sweet that hangeth from [thy]543-the maid girdle - stead has waxen dull , and welted ; and the blossoming eyebright that is for a hem to the little white coat of [thee]543-the maid is already forgetting how to be bright and blue . What sayest [thou]543-the maid then ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid laughed at [his]35-walter word , and stood still , and looked back over [her]543-the maid shoulder , while with [her]543-the maid fingers [she]543-the maid dealt with the flowers about [her]543-the maid side like to a bird preening [his]35-walter feathers . Then [she]543-the maid said : " Is it verily so as [thou]543-the maid sayest ? Look again ! "[543-the maid]

So [he]35-walter looked , and wondered ; for lo ! beneath [his]35-walter eyes the spires of [the meadow]373-the meadow - sweet grew crisp and clear again , the eyebright blossoms shone once more over the whiteness of [her]543-the maid legs ; the eglantine roses opened , and all was as fresh and bright as if it were still growing on its own roots .

[He]35-walter wondered , and was even somedeal aghast ; but [she]543-the maid said : " [Dear friend]1824-dear friend , be not troubled ! did [I]543-the maid not tell [thee]1824-dear friend that [I]543-the maid am wise in hidden lore ? But in [my]543-the maid wisdom shall be no longer any scathe to [any man]2435-any man . And again , this [my]543-the maid wisdom , as [I]543-the maid told [thee]1824-dear friend erst , shall end on the day whereon [I]543-the maid am made all happy . And it is [thou]1824-dear friend that shall wield it all , [[my]543-the maid Master]1599-my master . Yet must [my]543-the maid wisdom needs endure for a little season yet . Let [us]1081-they on then , boldly and happily . "[543-the maid]

CHAPTER XXVI : [THEY]1081-they COME TO [THE FOLK OF THE BEARS]23-the folk of the bears

On [they]1081-they went , and before long [they]1081-they were come up on to [the down - country]1082-the down - country , where was scarce a tree , save gnarled and knotty thorn - bushes here and there , but nought else higher than the whin . And here on [these upper lands]1083-these upper lands [they]1081-they saw that [the pastures]1084-the pastures were much burned with the drought , albeit summer was not worn old . Now [they]1081-they went making due south toward [the mountains]317-the mountains , whose heads [they]1081-they saw from time to time rising deep blue over the bleak greyness of [the down - land ridges]1086-the down - land ridges . And so [they]1081-they went , till at last , hard on sunset , after [they]1081-they had climbed long over a high bent , [they]1081-they came to the brow thereof , and , looking down , beheld new tidings .

There was [a wide valley below [them]1081-they]1087-a wide valley below them , greener than [the downs which [they]1081-they had come over]1088-the downs which they had come over , and greener yet amidmost , from the watering of [a stream which , all beset with willows]1089-a stream which , all beset with willows , wound about the bottom . [Sheep]1090-sheep and [neat]1091-neat were pasturing about [the dale]881-the dale , and moreover a long line of smoke was going up straight into [the windless heavens]1093-the windless heavens from the midst of a ring of [little round houses built of turfs]1094-little round houses built of turfs , and thatched with reed . And beyond that , toward [an eastward - lying bight of [the dale]881-the dale]1095-an eastward - lying bight of the dale , [they]1081-they could see what looked like to a doom - ring of big stones , though there were no rocky places in [that land]342-that land . About the cooking - fire amidst of [the houses]1098-the houses , and here and there otherwhere , [they]1081-they saw , standing or going to and fro , huge figures of [men]165-men and [women]750-women , with [children]1101-children playing about betwixt [them]1081-they .

[They]1081-they stood and gazed down at it for a minute or two , and though [all were at peace]1102-all were at peace [there]1739-there , yet to [Walter]35-walter , at least , it seemed strange and awful . [He]35-walter spake softly , as though [he]35-walter would not have [his]35-walter voice reach [those men]1104-those men , though [they]1104-those men were , forsooth , out of earshot of anything save a shout : " Are these then [the children of [the Bear]77-the bear]2437-the children of the bear ? What shall [we]1081-they do now ? "[35-walter]

[She]1105-she said : " Yea , of the Bear [they]2437-the children of the bear be , though there be [other folks of [them]2437-the children of the bear]2438-other folks of them far and far away to the northward and eastward , near to [the borders of [the sea]89-the sea]2439-the borders of the sea . And as to what [we]1081-they shall do , let [us]1081-they go down at once , and peacefully . Indeed , by now there will be no escape from [them]2437-the children of the bear ; for lo [you]35-walter ! [they]2437-the children of the bear have seen [us]1081-they . "[1105-she]

[Forsooth]58-forsooth , [some three or four of [the big men]1744-the big men]1106-some three or four of the big men had turned [them]1104-those men toward the bent whereon stood the twain , and were hailing [them]1104-those men in huge , rough voices , wherein , howsoever , seemed to be no anger or threat . So [the Maid]543-the maid took [Walter]35-walter by the hand , and thus [they]1109-we went down quietly , and [the Bear- folk]1691-the bear- folk , seeing [them]1109-we , stood all together , facing [them]1109-we , to abide [their]1109-we coming . [Walter]35-walter saw of [them]1109-we , that though [they]1109-we were very tall and bigly made , [they]1109-we were not so far above the stature of [men as to be marvels]1111-men as to be marvels . [The carles]1112-the carles were long - haired , and shaggy of beard , and [their]1112-the carles hair all red or tawny ; [their]1112-the carles skins , where [their]1112-the carles naked flesh showed , were burned brown with sun and weather , but to a fair and pleasant brown , nought like to blackamoors . [The queans]1113-the queans were comely and well - eyed ; nor was there anything of fierce or evil - looking about either [the carles]1112-the carles or [the queans]1113-the queans , but somewhat grave and solemn of aspect were [they]1113-the queans . Clad were [they]1109-we all , saving [the young men]1116-the young men - [children]1101-children , but somewhat scantily , and in nought save sheep - skins or deer - skins .

For weapons [they]1109-we saw amongst [them]1109-we clubs , and spears headed with bone or flint , and ugly axes of big flints set in wooden handles ; nor was there , as far as [they]1109-we could see , either now or afterward , any bow amongst [them]1109-we . But [some of [the young men]1116-the young men]1118-some of the young men seemed to have slings done about [their]1118-some of the young men shoulders .

Now when [they]1109-we were come but three fathom from [them]1109-we , [the Maid]543-the maid lifted up [her]543-the maid voice , and spake clearly and sweetly : " Hail , [[ye]1116-the young men folk of [the Bears]44-god]2441-ye folk of the bears ! [we]1109-we have come amongst [you]1116-the young men , and that for [your]1116-the young men good and not for [your]1116-the young men hurt : wherefore [we]1109-we would know if [we]1109-we be welcome . "[543-the maid]
