There was [an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins worked very goodly , and with a gold ring on [his]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins arm , and a chaplet of blue stones on [his]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins head , and [he]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins spake : " Little are [ye]1116-the young men , but so goodly , that if [ye]1116-the young men were but bigger , [we]1109-we should deem that [ye]1116-the young men were come from [[the Gods]2442-the gods ' House]2443-the gods ' house . Yet have [I]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins heard , that how mighty soever may [the Gods]2442-the gods be , and chiefly [[our]1109-we God]2445-our god , [they]2442-the gods be at whiles nought so bigly made as [[we]1109-we of [the Bears]1660-the bears]2446-we of the bears . How this may be , [I]1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins wot not . But if [ye]1116-the young men be not of [the Gods]2442-the gods or [[their]2442-the gods kindred]2449-their kindred , then are [ye]1116-the young men [mere aliens]2450-mere aliens ; and [we]1109-we know not what to do with [aliens]137-aliens , save [we]1109-we meet [them]137-aliens in battle , or give [them]137-aliens to [the God]2452-the god , or save [we]1109-we make [them]137-aliens [children of [the Bear]77-the bear]2453-children of the bear . But yet again , [ye]1116-the young men may be [messengers of [some folk who would bind friendship and alliance with [us]1109-we]2455-some folk who would bind friendship and alliance with us : in which case [ye]1116-the young men shall at the least depart in peace , and whiles [ye]1116-the young men are with [us]1109-we shall be [[our]1109-we guests]2456-our guests in all good cheer]2454-messengers of some folk who would bind friendship and alliance with us : in which case ye shall at the least depart in peace , and whiles ye are with us shall be our guests in all good cheer . Now , therefore , [we]1109-we bid [you]1116-the young men declare the matter unto [us]1109-we . "[1121-an old man who stood foremost in the midst , clad in a mantle of deer - skins]

Then spake [the Maid]543-the maid : " [Father]51-father , it were easy for [us]1109-we to declare what [we]1109-we be unto [you]51-father here present . But , [meseemeth]2457-meseemeth , [[ye]1116-the young men who be gathered round the fire here this evening are less than the whole tale of [the children of [the Bear]77-the bear]2437-the children of the bear]2458-ye who be gathered round the fire here this evening are less than the whole tale of the children of the bear . "[543-the maid]

" So it is , [Maiden]55-maiden , "[127-the elder] said [the elder]127-the elder , " that [many more children]2460-many more children hath [the Bear]77-the bear . "[127-the elder]

" This then [we]1109-we bid [you]1116-the young men , "[543-the maid] said [the Maid]543-the maid , " that [ye]1116-the young men send the tokens round and gather [[your]1116-the young men people]2461-your people to [you]1116-the young men , and when [they]2461-your people be assembled in [the Doom - ring]2462-the doom - ring , then shall [we]1109-we put [our]1109-we errand before [you]1116-the young men ; and according to that , shall [ye]1116-the young men deal with [us]1109-we . "[543-the maid]

" [Thou]2463-thou hast spoken well , "[127-the elder] said [the elder]127-the elder ; " and even so had [we]1109-we bidden [you]1116-the young men [ourselves]1109-we . To - morrow , before noon , shall [ye]1116-the young men stand in the Doom - ring in [this Dale]25-the dale , and speak with [the children of [the Bear]77-the bear]2437-the children of the bear . "[127-the elder]

Therewith [he]127-the elder turned to [[his]127-the elder own folk]244-his own folk and called out something , whereof [those twain]577-those twain knew not the meaning ; and there came to [him]127-the elder , one after another , [six young men]1128-six young men , unto each of whom [he]127-the elder gave a thing from out [his]127-the elder pouch , but what it was [Walter]35-walter might not see , save that it was little and of small account : to each , also , [he]127-the elder spake a word or two , and straight [they]1128-six young men set off running , one after the other , turning toward the bent which was over against that whereby [the twain]201-the twain had come into [the Dale]25-the dale , and were soon out of sight in the gathering dusk .

Then [the elder]127-the elder turned [him]127-the elder again to [Walter]35-walter and [the Maid]543-the maid , and spake : " [Man]1630-man and [woman]1875-woman , whatsoever [ye]1128-six young men may be , or whatsoever may abide [you]1128-six young men to - morrow , to - night , [ye]1128-six young men are [welcome guests to [us]1128-six young men]2467-welcome guests to us ; so [we]1128-six young men bid [you]1128-six young men come eat and drink at [our]1128-six young men fire . "[127-the elder]

So [they]1128-six young men sat all together upon the grass round about the embers of the fire , and ate curds and cheese , and drank milk in abundance ; and as the night grew on [them]1128-six young men [they]1128-six young men quickened the fire , that [they]1128-six young men might have light . [This wild folk]1132-this wild folk talked merrily amongst [themselves]1132-this wild folk , with laughter enough and friendly jests , but to [the new - comers]1133-the new - comers [they]1132-this wild folk were few - spoken , though , as [the twain]201-the twain deemed , for no enmity that [they]1132-this wild folk bore [them]1132-this wild folk . But this found [Walter]35-walter , that [the younger ones]1135-the younger ones , [both men]1136-both men and [women]750-women , seemed to find it a hard matter to keep [their]1135-the younger ones eyes off [them]1132-this wild folk ; and seemed , withal , to gaze on [them]1132-this wild folk with somewhat of doubt , or , it might be , of fear .

So when the night was wearing a little , [the elder]127-the elder arose and bade [the twain]201-the twain to come with [him]127-the elder , and led [them]201-the twain to [a small house]1140-a small house or booth , which was amidmost of all , and somewhat bigger than the others , and [he]127-the elder did [them]201-the twain to wit that [they]201-the twain should rest there that night , and bade [them]201-the twain sleep in peace and without fear till the morrow . So [they]201-the twain entered , and found beds thereon of heather and ling , and [they]201-the twain laid [them]201-the twain down sweetly , like [brother]1141-brother and [sister]1142-sister , when [they]201-the twain had kissed [each other]421-each other . But [they]201-the twain noted that [four brisk men]1144-four brisk men lay without the booth , and across the door , with [their]1144-four brisk men weapons beside [them]1144-four brisk men , so that [they]1144-four brisk men must needs look upon [themselves]1144-four brisk men as [captives]1145-captives .

Then [Walter]35-walter might not refrain [him]35-walter , but spake : " [Sweet and dear friend]2468-sweet and dear friend , [I]35-walter have come a long way from [the quay at [Langton]35-walter]545-the quay at langton , and the vision of [the Dwarf]182-the dwarf , [the Maid]543-the maid , and [the Lady]576-the lady ; and for this kiss wherewith [I]35-walter have kissed [thee]2468-sweet and dear friend e'en now , and the kindness of thine eyes , it was worth the time and the travail . But to - morrow , [meseemeth]35-walter , [I]35-walter shall go no further in [this world]1606-this world , though [my]35-walter journey be far longer than from [Langton]35-walter hither . And now may [God]44-god and [All Hallows]78-all hallows keep [thee]2468-sweet and dear friend amongst [this wild folk]1132-this wild folk , whenas [I]35-walter shall be gone from [thee]2468-sweet and dear friend . "[35-walter]

[She]1146-i laughed low and sweetly , and said : " [Dear friend]1824-dear friend , dost [thou]2468-sweet and dear friend speak to [me]1146-i thus mournfully to move [me]1146-i to love [thee]1824-dear friend better ? Then is [thy]2468-sweet and dear friend labour lost ; for no better may [I]1146-i love [thee]1824-dear friend than now [I]1146-i do ; and that is with [mine]1146-i whole heart . But keep a good courage , [I]1146-i bid [thee]1824-dear friend ; for [we]2476-we be not sundered yet , nor shall [we]2476-we be . Nor do [I]1146-i deem that [we]2476-we shall die here , or to - morrow ; but many years hence , after [we]2476-we have known all the sweetness of life . Meanwhile , [I]1146-i bid [thee]1824-dear friend good - night , [fair friend]2477-fair friend ! "[1146-i]

CHAPTER XXVII : MORNING AMONGST [THE BEARS]1660-the bears

So [Walter]35-walter laid [him]35-walter down and fell asleep , and knew no more till [he]35-walter awoke in bright daylight with [the Maid]543-the maid standing over [him]35-walter . [She]543-the maid was fresh from the water , for [she]543-the maid had been to [the river]334-the river to bathe [her]543-the maid , and the sun through the open door fell streaming on [her]543-the maid feet close to [Walter]35-walter 's pillow . [He]35-walter turned about and cast [his]35-walter arm about [them]1150-them , and caressed [them]1150-them , while [she]543-the maid stood smiling upon [him]35-walter ; then [he]35-walter arose and looked on [her]543-the maid , and said : " How [thou]543-the maid art fair and bright this morning ! And yet . . . and yet . . . were it not well that [thou]543-the maid do off [thee]543-the maid all this faded and drooping bravery of leaves and blossoms , that maketh [thee]543-the maid look like to [a jongleur 's damsel on a morrow of May - day]2478-a jongleur 's damsel on a morrow of may - day ? "[35-walter]

And [he]35-walter gazed ruefully on [her]543-the maid .

[She]543-the maid laughed on [him]35-walter merrily , and said : " [Yea]2479-yea , and belike [these others]2480-these others think no better of [my]543-the maid attire , or not much better ; for yonder [they]2480-these others are gathering small wood for the burnt - offering ; which , forsooth , shall be [thou]543-the maid and [I]543-the maid , unless [I]543-the maid better it all by means of the wisdom [I]543-the maid learned of [the old woman]2266-the old woman , and perfected betwixt the stripes of [[my]543-the maid Mistress]1816-my mistress , whom a little while ago [thou]543-the maid lovedst somewhat . "[543-the maid]

And as [she]543-the maid spake [her]543-the maid eyes sparkled , [her]543-the maid cheek flushed , and [her]543-the maid limbs and [her]543-the maid feet seemed as if [they]1151-they could scarce refrain from dancing for joy . Then [Walter]35-walter knit [his]35-walter brow , and for a moment a thought half - framed was in [his]35-walter mind : Is it so , that [she]543-the maid will bewray [me]0-i and live without [me]0-i ? and [he]35-walter cast [his]35-walter eyes on to the ground . But [she]543-the maid said : " Look up , and into [mine]543-the maid eyes , [friend]1695-friend , and see if there be in [them]2484-them any falseness toward [thee]35-walter ! For [I]543-the maid know [thy]35-walter thought ; [I]543-the maid know [thy]35-walter thought . Dost [thou]35-walter not see that [my]543-the maid joy and gladness is for the love of [thee]35-walter , and the thought of the rest from trouble that is at hand ? "[543-the maid]

[He]35-walter looked up , and [his]35-walter eyes met the eyes of [her]543-the maid love , and [he]35-walter would have cast [his]35-walter arms about [her]543-the maid ; but [she]543-the maid drew aback and said : " Nay , [thou]35-walter must refrain [thee]35-walter awhile , [dear friend]1824-dear friend , lest [these folk]2486-these folk cast eyes on [us]2487-us , and deem [us]2487-us over lover - like for what [I]543-the maid am to bid [them]2486-these folk deem [me]543-the maid . Abide a while , and then shall all be in [me]543-the maid according to [thy]35-walter will . But now [I]543-the maid must tell [thee]35-walter that it is not very far from noon , and that [the Bears]1660-the bears are streaming into [the Dale]25-the dale , and already there is an host of [men at the Doom- ring]2489-men at the doom- ring , and , as [I]543-the maid said , the bale for the burnt - offering is wellnigh dight , whether it be for [us]2487-us , or for [some other creature]2490-some other creature . And now [I]543-the maid have to bid [thee]35-walter this , and it will be a thing easy for [thee]35-walter to do , to wit , that [thou]35-walter look as if [thou]35-walter wert of [the race of [the Gods]2442-the gods]2491-the race of the gods , and not to blench , or show sign of blenching , whatever betide : to yea - say both [my]543-the maid yea - say and [my]543-the maid nay- say : and lastly this , which is the only hard thing for [thee]35-walter but [thou]35-walter hast already done it before somewhat , to look upon [me]543-the maid with no masterful eyes of love , nor as if [thou]35-walter wert at once praying [me]543-the maid and commanding [me]543-the maid ; rather [thou]35-walter shalt so demean [thee]35-walter as if [thou]35-walter wert [[my]543-the maid man]2493-my man all simply , and nowise [[my]543-the maid master]1599-my master . "[543-the maid]

" [O friend beloved]2495-o friend beloved , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter , " here at least art [thou]35-walter [the master]307-the master , and [I]35-walter will do all [thy]35-walter bidding , in certain hope of this , that either [we]1152-them shall live together or die together . "[35-walter]

But as [they]1152-them spoke , in came [the elder]127-the elder , and with [him]127-the elder [a young maiden]2240-a young maiden , bearing with [them]1152-them [their]1152-them breakfast of curds arid cream and strawberries , and [he]127-the elder bade [them]1152-them eat . So [they]1152-them ate , and were not unmerry ; and the while of [their]1152-them eating [the elder]127-the elder talked with [them]1152-them soberly , but not hardly , or with any seeming enmity : and ever [his]127-the elder talk gat on to the drought , which was now burning up [the down - pastures]1156-the down - pastures ; and how the grass in [the watered dales]1157-the watered dales , which was [no wide spread of land]1158-no wide spread of land , would not hold out much longer unless [the God]2452-the god sent [them]1152-them rain . And [Walter]35-walter noted that [those two]686-those two , [the elder]127-the elder and [the Maid]543-the maid , eyed [each other]421-each other curiously amidst of this talk ; [the elder]127-the elder intent on what [she]543-the maid might say , and if [she]543-the maid gave heed to [his]127-the elder words ; while on [her]543-the maid side [the Maid]543-the maid answered [his]127-the elder speech graciously and pleasantly , but said little that was of any import : nor would [she]543-the maid have [him]127-the elder fix [her]543-the maid eyes , which wandered lightly from this thing to that ; nor would [her]543-the maid lips grow stern and stable , but ever smiled in answer to the light of [her]543-the maid eyes , as [she]543-the maid sat there with [her]543-the maid face as the very face of the gladness of the summer day .

CHAPTER XXVIII : OF [THE NEW GOD OF THE BEARS]44-god

At last [the old man]208-the old man said : " [[My]208-the old man children]2497-my children , [ye]2497-my children shall now come with [me]208-the old man unto the Doom - ring of [[our]2498-our folk]2499-our folk , [the Bears of [the Southern Dales]26-the southern dales]2500-the bears of the southern dales , and deliver to [them]2500-the bears of the southern dales [your]2497-my children errand ; and [I]208-the old man beseech [you]2497-my children to have pity upon [your]2497-my children own bodies , as [I]208-the old man have pity on [them]2500-the bears of the southern dales ; on thine especially , [Maiden]55-maiden , so fair and bright a creature as [thou]2501-thou art ; for so it is , that if [ye]2497-my children deal [us]2498-our out light and lying words after the manner of dastards , [ye]2497-my children shall miss the worship and glory of wending away amidst of the flames , a gift to [the God]2452-the god and a hope to [the people]2503-the people , and shall be passed by the rods of [the folk]252-the folk , until [ye]2497-my children faint and fail amongst [them]252-the folk , and then shall [ye]2497-my children be thrust down into the flow at [the Dale 's End]27-the dale 's end , and a stone - laden hurdle cast upon [you]2497-my children , that [we]2498-our may thenceforth forget [your]2497-my children folly . "[208-the old man]

[The Maid]543-the maid now looked full into [his]1168-his eyes , and [Walter]35-walter deemed that [the old man]208-the old man shrank before [her]543-the maid ; but [she]543-the maid said : " [Thou]2505-thou art old and wise , [O great man of the Bears]2506-o great man of the bears , yet nought [I]543-the maid need to learn of [thee]1168-his . Now lead [us]2498-our on [our]2498-our way to [the Stead of the Errands]2507-the stead of the errands . "[543-the maid]

So [the elder]127-the elder brought [them]1171-them along to [the Doom - ring]2462-the doom - ring at [the eastern end of [the Dale]25-the dale]1173-the eastern end of the dale ; and it was now [all peopled]1174-all peopled with [those huge men]1723-those huge men , weaponed after [their]1723-those huge men fashion , and standing up , so that the grey stones thereof but showed a little over [their]1723-those huge men heads . But amidmost of [the said Ring]1176-the said ring was a big stone , fashioned as a chair , whereon sat [a very old man]1177-a very old man , long - hoary and white - bearded , and on either side of [him]1177-a very old man stood [a great - limbed woman clad in war - gear , holding , each of [them]1171-them]1178-a great - limbed woman clad in war - gear , holding , each of them , a long spear , and with a flint- bladed knife in the girdle ; and there were [no other women in all the Mote]1179-no other women in all the mote .

Then [the elder]127-the elder led [those twain]577-those twain into [the midst of [the Mote]28-the mote]1182-the midst of the mote , and there bade [them]1171-them go up on to a wide , flat - topped stone , six feet above the ground , just over against [the ancient chieftain]1183-the ancient chieftain ; and [they]1171-them mounted [it]1184-it by a rough stair , and stood there before [that folk]1677-that folk ; [Walter]35-walter in [his]35-walter array of [the outward world]1186-the outward world , which had been fair enough , of crimson cloth and silk , and white linen , but was now travel - stained and worn ; and [the Maid]543-the maid with nought upon [her]543-the maid , save the smock wherein [she]543-the maid had fled from [the Golden House of [the Wood]14-the wood beyond [the World]1-the world]1188-the golden house of the wood beyond the world , decked with the faded flowers which [she]543-the maid had wreathed about [her]543-the maid yesterday . Nevertheless , so it was , that [those big men]1189-those big men eyed [her]543-the maid intently , and with somewhat of worship .

Now did [Walter]35-walter , according to [her]543-the maid bidding , sink down on [his]35-walter knees beside [her]543-the maid , and drawing [his]35-walter sword , hold it before [him]35-walter , as if to keep [all interlopers]1190-all interlopers aloof from [the Maid]543-the maid . And there was silence in [the Mote]28-the mote , and all eyes were fixed on [those twain]577-those twain .

At last [the old chief]1193-the old chief arose and spake : " [[Ye]1189-those big men men]2508-ye men , here are come [a man]229-a man and [a woman]526-a woman , [we]2508-ye men know not whence ; whereas [they]1189-those big men have given word to [[our]2508-ye men folk who first met [them]1189-those big men]2511-our folk who first met them , that [they]1189-those big men would tell [their]1189-those big men errand to none save [the Mote of [the People]2503-the people]2512-the mote of the people ; which it was [their]1189-those big men due to do , if [they]1189-those big men were minded to risk it . For either [they]1189-those big men be aliens without an errand hither , save , it may be , to beguile [us]2508-ye men , in which case [they]1189-those big men shall presently die an evil death ; or [they]1189-those big men have come amongst [us]2508-ye men that [we]2508-ye men may give [them]1189-those big men to [the God with flint- edge and fire]2514-the god with flint- edge and fire ; or [they]1189-those big men have a message to [us]2508-ye men from [some folk]2515-some folk or other , on the issue of which lieth life or death . Now shall [ye]2508-ye men hear what [they]1189-those big men have to say concerning [themselves]1189-those big men and [their]1189-those big men faring hither . But , [meseemeth]65-meseemeth , it shall be [the woman who is [the chief]2517-the chief and hath the word in [her]2516-the woman who is the chief and hath the word in her mouth mouth]2516-the woman who is the chief and hath the word in her mouth ; for , lo [you]2508-ye men ! [the man]1710-the man kneeleth at [her]2516-the woman who is the chief and hath the word in her mouth feet , as one who would serve and worship [her]2516-the woman who is the chief and hath the word in her mouth . Speak out then , [woman]1875-woman , and let [[our]2508-ye men warriors]2520-our warriors hear [thee]2516-the woman who is the chief and hath the word in her mouth . "[1193-the old chief]

Then [the Maid]543-the maid lifted up [her]543-the maid voice , and spake out clear and shrilling , like to a flute of the best of [the minstrels]1195-the minstrels : " [[Ye]2508-ye men men of [the Children of the Bear]2437-the children of the bear]2521-ye men of the children of the bear , [I]543-the maid would ask [you]2508-ye men a question , and let [the chieftain]2523-the chieftain who sitteth before [me]543-the maid answer it . "[543-the maid]

[The old man]208-the old man nodded [his]208-the old man head , and [she]543-the maid went on : " Tell [me]543-the maid , [Children of the Bear]2453-children of the bear , how long a time is worn since [ye]2508-ye men saw [the God of [your]2508-ye men worship]2525-the god of your worship made manifest in the body of [a woman]526-a woman ! "[543-the maid]

Said [the elder]127-the elder : " Many winters have worn since [[[my]127-the elder father]1578-my father 's father]2528-my father 's father was [a child]1025-a child , and saw [the very God]2530-the very god in the bodily form of [a woman]526-a woman . "[127-the elder]

Then [she]543-the maid said again : " Did [ye]2508-ye men rejoice at [her]543-the maid coming , and would [ye]2508-ye men rejoice if once more [she]543-the maid came amongst [you]2508-ye men ? "[543-the maid]

" [Yea]2532-yea , "[1198-the old chieftain] said [the old chieftain]1198-the old chieftain , " for [she]543-the maid gave [us]2533-us gifts , and learned [us]2533-us lore , and came to [us]2533-us in no terrible shape , but as [a young woman]2534-a young woman as goodly as [thou]2535-thou . "[1198-the old chieftain]

Then said [the Maid]543-the maid : " Now , then , is the day of [your]2508-ye men gladness come ; for [the old body]2536-the old body is dead , and [I]543-the maid am the new body of [[your]2508-ye men God]2537-your god , come amongst [you]2508-ye men for [your]2508-ye men welfare . "[543-the maid]

Then fell a great silence on [the Mote]28-the mote , till [the old man]208-the old man spake and said : " What shall [I]208-the old man say and live ? For if [thou]2535-thou be verily [the God]2452-the god , and [I]208-the old man threaten [thee]2535-thou , wilt [thou]2535-thou not destroy [me]208-the old man ? But [thou]2535-thou hast spoken a great word with a sweet mouth , and hast taken the burden of blood on [thy]2535-thou lily hands ; and if [the Children of [the Bear]77-the bear]2437-the children of the bear be befooled of [light liars]2540-light liars , how shall [they]2437-the children of the bear put the shame off [them]2437-the children of the bear ? Therefore [I]208-the old man say , show to [us]2541-us a token ; and if [thou]2535-thou be [the God]2452-the god , this shall be easy to [thee]2535-thou ; and if [thou]2535-thou show it not , then is [thy]2535-thou falsehood manifest , and [thou]2535-thou shalt dree the weird . For [we]2541-us shall deliver [thee]2535-thou into the hands of [these women here]2543-these women here , who shall thrust [thee]2535-thou down into the flow which is hereby , after [they]2543-these women here have wearied [themselves]2543-these women here with whipping [thee]2535-thou . But [[thy]2535-thou man that kneeleth at [thy]2535-thou feet]2544-thy man that kneeleth at thy feet shall [we]2541-us give to [the true God]2545-the true god , and [he]1202-he shall go to [her]1201-her by [the road of the flint]2546-the road of the flint and the fire . Hast [thou]2535-thou heard ? Then give to [us]2541-us the sign and the token . "[208-the old man]

[She]1201-her changed countenance no whit at [his]1202-he word ; but [her]1201-her eyes were the brighter , and [her]1201-her cheek the fresher and [her]1201-her feet moved a little , as if they were growing glad before the dance ; and [she]1201-her looked out over [the Mote]1203-the mote , and spake in [her]1201-her clear voice : " [Old man]1650-old man , [thou]2535-thou needest not to fear for [thy]2535-thou words . Forsooth it is not [me]1201-her whom [thou]2535-thou threatenest with stripes and a foul death , but [some light fool]2548-some light fool and liar , who is not here . Now hearken ! [I]1201-her wot well that [ye]2535-thou would have somewhat of [me]1201-her , to wit , that [I]1201-her should send [you]2535-thou rain to end this drought , which otherwise seemeth like to lie long upon [you]2535-thou : but this rain , [I]1201-her must go into [the mountains of [the south]2550-the south]2549-the mountains of the south to fetch it [you]2535-thou ; therefore shall [certain of [[your]2535-thou warriors]2552-your warriors bring [me]1201-her on [my]1201-her way , with [this [my]1201-her man]2553-this my man , up to [the great pass of [the said mountains]2555-the said mountains]2554-the great pass of the said mountains]2551-certain of your warriors bring me on my way , with this my man , up to the great pass of the said mountains , and [we]2556-we shall set out thitherward this very day . "[1201-her]

[She]1204-her was silent a while , and [all]107-all looked on [her]1204-her , but none spake or moved , so that they seemed as images of stone amongst the stones .

Then [she]1204-her spake again and said : " [Some]1715-some would say , [men of the Bear]2558-men of the bear , that this were a sign and a token great enough ; but [I]1204-her know [you]2535-thou , and how stubborn and perverse of heart [ye]2535-thou be ; and how that the gift not yet within [your]2535-thou hand is no gift to [you]2535-thou ; and the wonder [ye]2535-thou see not , [your]2535-thou hearts trow not . Therefore look [ye]2535-thou upon [me]1204-her as here [I]1204-her stand , [[I]1204-her who have come from [the fairer country]2560-the fairer country and the greenwood of [the lands]2561-the lands]2559-i who have come from the fairer country and the greenwood of the lands , and see if [I]1204-her bear not the summer with [me]1204-her , and the heart that maketh increase and the hand that giveth . "[1204-her]

Lo then ! as [she]1204-her spake , the faded flowers that hung about [her]1204-her gathered life and grew fresh again ; the woodbine round [her]1204-her neck and [her]1204-her sleek shoulders knit itself together and embraced [her]1204-her freshly , and cast its scent about [her]1204-her face . The lilies that girded [her]1204-her loins lifted up their heads , and the gold of their tassels fell upon [her]1204-her ; the eyebright grew clean blue again upon [her]1204-her smock ; the eglantine found its blooms again , and then began to shed the leaves thereof upon [her]1204-her feet ; the meadow - sweet wreathed amongst it made clear the sweetness of [her]1204-her legs , and the mouse- ear studded [her]1204-her raiment as with gems . There [she]1204-her stood amidst of the blossoms , like a great orient pearl against the fretwork of [the goldsmiths]1206-the goldsmiths , and the breeze that came up [the valley]1207-the valley from behind bore the sweetness of [her]1204-her fragrance all over [the Man - mote]1208-the man - mote .

Then , indeed , [the Bears]44-god stood up , and shouted and cried , and smote on [their]44-god shields , and tossed [their]44-god spears aloft . Then [the elder]127-the elder rose from [his]127-the elder seat , and came up humbly to where [she]1204-her stood , and prayed [her]1204-her to say what [she]1204-her would have done ; while [the others]258-the others drew about in knots , but durst not come very nigh to [her]1204-her . [She]1204-her answered [the ancient chief]1211-the ancient chief , and said , that [she]1204-her would depart presently toward [the mountains]317-the mountains , whereby [she]1204-her might send [them]1213-they the rain which [they]1213-they lacked , and that thence [she]1204-her would away to [the southward]1214-the southward for a while ; but that [they]1213-they should hear of [her]1204-her , or , it might be , see [her]1204-her , before [they who were now of middle age]1215-they who were now of middle age should be gone to [[their]1215-they who were now of middle age fathers]1216-their fathers .

Then [the old man]208-the old man besought [her]1204-her that [they]1213-they might make [her]1204-her a litter of fragrant green boughs , and so bear [her]1204-her away toward [the mountain pass]1218-the mountain pass amidst a triumph of [the whole folk]1219-the whole folk . But [she]1204-her leapt lightly down from the stone , and walked to and fro on [the greensward]1220-the greensward , while it seemed of [her]1204-her that [her]1204-her feet scarce touched the grass ; and [she]1204-her spake to [the ancient chief]1211-the ancient chief where [he]208-the old man still kneeled in worship of [her]1204-her , and said " Nay ; deemest [thou]2562-thou of [me]1204-her that [I]1204-her need bearing by [men]165-men 's hands , or that [I]1204-her shall tire at all when [I]1204-her am doing [my]1204-her will , and [I]1204-her , the very heart of the year 's increase ? So it is , that the going of [my]1204-her feet over [[your]2564-your pastures]2565-your pastures shall make [them]2565-your pastures to thrive , both this year and the coming years : surely will [I]1204-her go afoot . "[1204-her]

So [they]1222-they worshipped [her]1204-her the more , and blessed [her]1204-her ; and then first of all [they]1222-they brought meat , the daintiest [they]1222-they might , both for [her]1204-her and for [Walter]35-walter . But [they]1222-they would not look on [the Maid]543-the maid whiles [she]1204-her ate , or suffer [Walter]35-walter to behold [her]1204-her the while . Afterwards , when [they]1222-they had eaten , [some twenty men]1224-some twenty men , weaponed after [their]1224-some twenty men fashion , made [them]1224-some twenty men ready to wend with [the Maiden]183-the maiden up into [the mountains]317-the mountains , and anon [they]1224-some twenty men set out thitherward all together . Howbeit , [the huge men]1740-the huge men held [them]1224-some twenty men ever somewhat aloof from [the Maid]72-the maid ; and when [they]1224-some twenty men came to the resting - place for that night , where was [no house]1228-no house , for [it]1229-it was up amongst [the foot - hills]1230-the foot - hills before [the mountains]317-the mountains , then it was a wonder to see how carefully [they]1224-some twenty men built up a sleeping - place for [her]543-the maid , and tilted [it]1229-it over with [their]1224-some twenty men skin - cloaks , and how [they]1224-some twenty men watched nightlong about [her]543-the maid . But [Walter]35-walter [they]1224-some twenty men let sleep peacefully on the grass , a little way aloof from [the watchers]1232-the watchers round [the Maid]72-the maid .

CHAPTER XXIX : [WALTER]35-walter STRAYS IN [THE PASS]29-the pass AND IS SUNDERED FROM [THE MAID

Morning]72-the maid came , and [they]1224-some twenty men arose and went on [their]1224-some twenty men ways , and went all day till the sun was nigh set , and [they]1224-some twenty men were come up into [the very pass]457-the very pass ; and in the jaws thereof was an earthen howe . There [the Maid]543-the maid bade [them]1224-some twenty men stay , and [she]543-the maid went up on to [the howe]1235-the howe , and stood there and spake to [them]1224-some twenty men , and said : " [O men of the Bear]2566-o men of the bear , [I]543-the maid give [you]2566-o men of the bear thanks for [your]2566-o men of the bear following , and [I]543-the maid bless [you]2566-o men of the bear , and promise [you]2566-o men of the bear the increase of [the earth]1629-the earth . But now [ye]2566-o men of the bear shall turn aback , and leave [me]543-the maid to go [my]543-the maid ways ; and [[my]543-the maid man]2493-my man with the iron sword shall follow [me]543-the maid . Now , maybe , [I]543-the maid shall come amongst [the Bear - folk]1687-the bear - folk again before long , and yet again , and learn [them]1687-the bear - folk wisdom ; but for this time it is enough . And [I]543-the maid shall tell [you]2566-o men of the bear that [ye]2566-o men of the bear were best to hasten [home]1557-home straightway to [[your]2566-o men of the bear houses]2571-your houses in [the downland dales]2572-the downland dales , for the weather which [I]543-the maid have bidden for [you]2566-o men of the bear is even now coming forth from the forge of storms in [the heart of [the mountains]317-the mountains]2573-the heart of the mountains . Now this last word [I]543-the maid give [you]2566-o men of the bear , that times are changed since [I]543-the maid wore the last shape of [God]44-god that [ye]2566-o men of the bear have seen , wherefore a change [I]543-the maid command [you]2566-o men of the bear . If so be [aliens]137-aliens come amongst [you]2566-o men of the bear , [I]543-the maid will not that [ye]2566-o men of the bear send [them]137-aliens to [me]543-the maid by the flint and the fire ; rather , unless [they]137-aliens be baleful unto [you]2566-o men of the bear , and worthy of an evil death , [ye]2566-o men of the bear shall suffer [them]137-aliens to abide with [you]2566-o men of the bear ; [ye]2566-o men of the bear shall make [them]137-aliens become [children of the Bears]2576-children of the bears , if [they]137-aliens be goodly enough and worthy , and [they]137-aliens shall be [[my]543-the maid children]2497-my children as [ye]2566-o men of the bear be ; otherwise , if [they]137-aliens be ill - favoured and weakling , let [them]137-aliens live and be thralls to [you]2566-o men of the bear , but not join with [you]2566-o men of the bear , [man]1630-man to [woman]1875-woman . Now depart [ye]2566-o men of the bear with [my]543-the maid blessing . "[543-the maid]

Therewith [she]1236-she came down from [the mound]447-the mound , and went [her]1236-she ways up [the pass]439-the pass so lightly , that it was to [Walter]35-walter , standing amongst the Bears , as if [she]1236-she had vanished away . But [the men of that folk]1239-the men of that folk abode standing and worshipping [[their]1239-the men of that folk God]2394-their god for a little while , and that while [he]35-walter durst not sunder [him]35-walter from [their]1239-the men of that folk company . But when [they]1239-the men of that folk had blessed [him]35-walter and gone on [their]1239-the men of that folk way backward , [he]35-walter betook [him]35-walter in haste to following [the Maid]543-the maid , thinking to find [her]1236-she abiding [him]35-walter in [some nook of [the pass]439-the pass]1242-some nook of the pass .

Howsoever , it was now twilight or more , and , for all [his]35-walter haste , dark night overtook [him]35-walter , so that perforce [he]35-walter was stayed amidst the tangle of the mountain ways . And , moreover , ere the night was grown old , the weather came upon [him]35-walter on the back of a great south wind , so that the mountain nooks rattled and roared , and there was the rain and the hail , with thunder and lightning , monstrous and terrible , and all the huge array of a summer storm . So [he]35-walter was driven at last to crouch under a big rock and abide the day .

But not so were [his]35-walter troubles at an end . For under [the said rock]1003-the said rock [he]35-walter fell asleep , and when [he]35-walter awoke it was day indeed ; but as to [the pass]439-the pass , the way thereby was blind with the driving rain and the lowering lift ; so that , though [he]35-walter struggled as well as [he]35-walter might against the storm and the tangle , [he]35-walter made but little way .

And now once more the thought came on [him]35-walter , that [the Maid]543-the maid was of [the fays]1247-the fays , or of [some race even mightier]1248-some race even mightier ; and it came on [him]35-walter now not as erst , with half fear and whole desire , but with a bitter oppression of dread , of loss and misery ; so that [he]35-walter began to fear that [she]543-the maid had but won [his]35-walter love to leave [him]35-walter and forget [him]35-walter for a new - comer , after the wo nt of [fay - women]1249-fay - women , as old tales tell .

Two days [he]35-walter battled thus with storm and blindness , and wanhope of [his]35-walter life ; for [he]35-walter was growing weak and fordone . But the third morning the storm abated , though the rain yet fell heavily , and [he]35-walter could see [his]35-walter way somewhat as well as feel it : withal [he]35-walter found that now [his]35-walter path was leading [him]35-walter downwards . As it grew dusk , [he]35-walter came down into [a grassy valley]1250-a grassy valley with [a stream running through [it]1250-a grassy valley to the southward]1251-a stream running through it to the southward , and the rain was now but little , coming down but in dashes from time to time . So [he]35-walter crept down to [the stream - side]1001-the stream - side , and lay amongst the bushes there ; and said to [himself]35-walter , that on the morrow [he]35-walter would get [him]35-walter victual , so that [he]35-walter might live to seek [his]35-walter Maiden through [the wide world]1253-the wide world . [He]35-walter was of somewhat better heart : but now that [he]35-walter was laid quiet , and had no more for that present to trouble [him]35-walter about the way , the anguish of [his]35-walter loss fell upon [him]35-walter the keener , and [he]35-walter might not refrain [him]35-walter from lamenting [[his]35-walter dear]1254-his dear Maiden aloud , as one who deemed [himself]35-walter in [the empty wilderness]1255-the empty wilderness : and thus [he]35-walter lamented for [her]1254-his dear sweetness and [her]1254-his dear loveliness , and the kindness of [her]1254-his dear voice and [her]1254-his dear speech , and [her]1254-his dear mirth . Then [he]35-walter fell to crying out concerning the beauty of [her]1254-his dear shaping , praising the parts of [her]1254-his dear body , as [her]1254-his dear face , and [her]1254-his dear hands , and [her]1254-his dear shoulders , and [her]1254-his dear feet , and cursing the evil fate which had sundered [him]35-walter from the friendliness of [her]1254-his dear , and the peerless fashion of [her]1254-his dear .

CHAPTER XXX : NOW [THEY]1256-they MEET AGAIN

Complaining thus - wise , [he]35-walter fell asleep from sheer weariness , and when [he]35-walter awoke it was broad day , calm and bright and cloudless , with the scent of the earth refreshed going up into the heavens , and the birds singing sweetly in the bushes about [him]35-walter : for [the dale whereunto [he]35-walter was now come]1257-the dale whereunto he was now come was [a fair and lovely place amidst [the shelving slopes of [the mountains]317-the mountains]1259-the shelving slopes of the mountains]1258-a fair and lovely place amidst the shelving slopes of the mountains , [a paradise of the wilderness]1261-a paradise of the wilderness , and nought but pleasant and sweet things were to be seen there , now that [the morn]833-the morn was so clear and sunny .

[He]35-walter arose and looked about [him]35-walter , and saw where , a hundred yards aloof , was a thicket of small wood , as thorn and elder and whitebeam , all wreathed about with the bines of wayfaring tree ; it hid a bight of [the stream]459-the stream , which turned round about it , and betwixt [it]1264-it and [Walter]35-walter was the grass short and thick , and sweet , and all beset with flowers ; and [he]35-walter said to [himself]35-walter that it was even such a place as wherein [the angels]1265-the angels were leading the Blessed in [the great painted paradise in [the choir of [the big church]1268-the big church at [Langton]35-walter on [Holm]3-holm]1267-the choir of the big church at langton on holm]1266-the great painted paradise in the choir of the big church at langton on holm . But lo ! as [he]35-walter looked [he]35-walter cried aloud for joy , for forth from the thicket on to the flowery grass came one like to [an angel from out of the said picture , white - clad and bare - foot , sweet of flesh , with bright eyes and ruddy cheeks]1269-an angel from out of the said picture , white - clad and bare - foot , sweet of flesh , with bright eyes and ruddy cheeks ; for it was [the Maid herself]1270-the maid herself . So [he]35-walter ran to [her]1270-the maid herself , and [she]1270-the maid herself abode [him]35-walter , holding forth kind hands to [him]35-walter , and smiling , while [she]1270-the maid herself wept for joy of the meeting . [He]35-walter threw [himself]35-walter upon [her]1270-the maid herself , and spared not to kiss [her]1270-the maid herself , [her]1270-the maid herself cheeks and [her]1270-the maid herself mouth , and [her]1270-the maid herself arms and [her]1270-the maid herself shoulders , and wheresoever [she]1270-the maid herself would suffer it . Till at last [she]1270-the maid herself drew aback a little , laughing on [him]35-walter for love , and said : " Forbear now , [friend]1695-friend , for it is enough for this time , and tell [me]1270-the maid herself how [thou]2581-thou hast sped . "[1270-the maid herself]

" Ill , ill , "[35-walter] said [he]35-walter .

" What ails [thee]35-walter ? "[1270-the maid herself] [she]1270-the maid herself said .

" Hunger , "[35-walter] [he]35-walter said , " and longing for [thee]1270-the maid herself . "[35-walter]

" Well , "[1270-the maid herself] [she]1270-the maid herself said , " [me]1270-the maid herself [thou]2581-thou hast ; there is one ill quenched ; take [my]1270-the maid herself hand , and [we]2582-we will see to the other one . "[1270-the maid herself]

So [he]35-walter took [her]1270-the maid herself hand , and to hold it seemed to [him]35-walter sweet beyond measure . But [he]35-walter looked up , and saw a little blue smoke going up into the air from beyond the thicket ; and [he]35-walter laughed , for [he]35-walter was weak with hunger , and [he]35-walter said : " Who is at the cooking yonder ? "[35-walter]

" [Thou]2581-thou shalt see , "[1270-the maid herself] [she]1270-the maid herself said ; and led [him]35-walter therewith into the said thicket and through it , and lo ! [a fair little grassy place , full of flowers , betwixt the bushes and the bight of [the stream]459-the stream]1271-a fair little grassy place , full of flowers , betwixt the bushes and the bight of the stream ; and on [the little sandy ere]1273-the little sandy ere , just off [the greensward]1220-the greensward , was a fire of sticks , and beside it two trouts lying , fat and red - flecked .

" Here is the breakfast , "[1270-the maid herself] said [she]1270-the maid herself ; " when it was time to wash the night off [me]1270-the maid herself e'en now , [I]1270-the maid herself went down the strand here into [the rippling shallow]2583-the rippling shallow , and saw the bank below [it]2583-the rippling shallow , where the water draws together yonder , and deepens , that it seemed like to hold fish ; and whereas [I]1270-the maid herself looked to meet [thee]1270-the maid herself presently , [I]1270-the maid herself groped [the bank]345-the bank for them , going softly ; and lo [thou]1270-the maid herself ! Help [me]1270-the maid herself now , that [we]1275-they cook them . "[1270-the maid herself]

So [they]1275-they roasted them on the red embers , and fell to and ate well , both of [them]1275-they , and drank of the water of [the stream]459-the stream out of [each other]421-each other 's hollow hands ; and that feast seemed glorious to [them]1275-they , such gladness went with it .

But when [they]1275-they were done with [their]1275-they meat , [Walter]35-walter said to [the Maid]543-the maid : " And how didst [thou]1270-the maid herself know that [thou]1270-the maid herself shouldst see [me]35-walter presently ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid said , looking on [him]35-walter wistfully : " This needed no wizardry . [I]543-the maid lay not so far from [thee]35-walter last night , but that [I]543-the maid heard [thy]35-walter voice and knew it . "[543-the maid]

Said [he]35-walter , " Why didst [thou]1270-the maid herself not come to [me]35-walter then , since [thou]1270-the maid herself heardest [me]35-walter bemoaning [thee]35-walter ? "[35-walter]

[She]543-the maid cast [her]543-the maid eyes down , and plucked at the flowers and grass , and said : " It was dear to hear [thee]35-walter praising [me]543-the maid ; [I]543-the maid knew not before that [I]543-the maid was so sore desired , or that [thou]35-walter hadst taken such note of [my]543-the maid body , and found it so dear . "[543-the maid]

Then [she]543-the maid reddened sorely , and said : " [I]543-the maid knew not that aught of [me]543-the maid had such beauty as [thou]35-walter didst bewail . "[543-the maid]

And [she]543-the maid wept for joy . Then [she]543-the maid looked on [him]35-walter and smiled , and said : " Wilt [thou]35-walter have the very truth of it ? [I]543-the maid went close up to [thee]35-walter , and stood there hidden by the bushes and the night . And amidst [thy]35-walter bewailing , [I]543-the maid knew that [thou]35-walter wouldst soon fall asleep , and in sooth [I]543-the maid out - waked [thee]35-walter . "[543-the maid]

Then was [she]543-the maid silent again ; and [he]35-walter spake not , but looked on [her]543-the maid shyly ; and [she]543-the maid said , reddening yet more : " Furthermore , [I]543-the maid must needs tell [thee]35-walter that [I]543-the maid feared to go to [thee]35-walter in the dark night , and [my]543-the maid heart so yearning towards [thee]35-walter . "[543-the maid]

And [she]543-the maid hung [her]543-the maid head adown ; but [he]35-walter said : " Is it so indeed , that [thou]35-walter fearest [me]35-walter ? Then doth that make [me]35-walter afraid - afraid of [thy]35-walter nay - say . For [I]35-walter was going to entreat [thee]543-the maid , and say to [thee]543-the maid : Beloved , [we]2585-we have now gone through many troubles ; let [us]2585-we now take a good reward at once , and [we]2585-we d together , here amidst [this sweet and pleasant house of [the mountains]317-the mountains]2586-this sweet and pleasant house of the mountains , ere [we]2585-we go further on [our]2585-we way ; if indeed [we]2585-we go further at all . For where shall [we]2585-we find [any place sweeter or happier than this]2588-any place sweeter or happier than this ? "[35-walter]

But [she]543-the maid sprang up to [her]543-the maid feet , and stood there trembling before [him]35-walter , because of [her]543-the maid love ; and [she]543-the maid said : " [Beloved]2321-beloved , [I]543-the maid have deemed that it were good for [us]2585-we to go seek [mankind]2590-mankind as [they]2590-mankind live in [the world]118-the world , and to live amongst [them]2590-mankind . And as for [me]543-the maid , [I]543-the maid will tell [thee]2321-beloved the sooth , to wit , that [I]543-the maid long for this sorely . For [I]543-the maid feel afraid in [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness , and as if [I]543-the maid needed help and protection against [[my]543-the maid Mistress]1816-my mistress , though [she]1816-my mistress be dead ; and [I]543-the maid need the comfort of [many people]2594-many people , and the throngs of [the cities]2595-the cities . [I]543-the maid can not forget [her]1816-my mistress : it was but last night that [I]543-the maid dreamed [I]543-the maid suppose as the dawn grew a - cold that [I]543-the maid was yet under [her]1816-my mistress hand , and [she]1816-my mistress was stripping [me]543-the maid for the torment ; so that [I]543-the maid woke up panting and crying out . [I]543-the maid pray [thee]1816-my mistress be not angry with [me]543-the maid for telling [thee]1816-my mistress of [my]543-the maid desires ; for if [thou]1816-my mistress wouldst not have it so , then here will [I]543-the maid abide with [thee]1816-my mistress as [[thy]1816-my mistress mate]2596-thy mate , and strive to gather courage . "[543-the maid]

[He]1279-i rose up and kissed [her]1280-i face , and said : " Nay , [I]1279-i had in sooth no mind to abide here for ever ; [I]1279-i meant but that [we]2597-we should feast a while here , and then depart : sooth it is , that if [thou]1816-my mistress dreadest [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness , somewhat [I]1279-i dread [the city]117-the city . "[1279-i]

[She]1280-i turned pale , and said : " [Thou]1816-my mistress shalt have [thy]1816-my mistress will , [[my]1280-i friend]1798-my friend , if it must be so . But bethink [thee]1279-i [we]2597-we be not yet at [our]2597-we journey 's end , and may have many things and much strife to endure , before [we]2597-we be at peace and in welfare . Now shall [I]1280-i tell [thee]1280-i - did [I]1280-i not before ? - that while [I]1280-i am [a maid untouched]2601-a maid untouched , [my]1280-i wisdom , and somedeal of might , abideth with [me]1280-i , and only so long . Therefore [I]1280-i entreat [thee]1280-i , let [us]2597-we go now , side by side , out of [this fair valley]2602-this fair valley , even as [we]2597-we are , so that [my]1280-i wisdom and might may help [thee]1280-i at need . For , [[my]1280-i friend]1798-my friend , [I]1280-i would not that [our]2597-we lives be short , so much of joy as hath now come into [them]2604-them . "[1280-i]

" [Yea]1280-i , [beloved]2321-beloved , "[1281-he] [he]1281-he said , " let [us]2597-we on straightway then , and shorten the while that sundereth [us]2597-we . "[1281-he]

" Love , "[1282-i] [she]1282-i said , " [thou]1280-i shalt pardon [me]1282-i one time for all . But this is to be said , that [I]1282-i know somewhat of the haps that lie a little way ahead of [us]2597-we ; partly by [my]1282-i lore , and partly by what [I]1282-i learned of [this land of [the wild folk]2607-the wild folk]2606-this land of the wild folk whiles [thou]1280-i wert lying asleep that morning . "[1282-i]

So [they]1283-they left [that pleasant place by the water]1284-that pleasant place by the water , and came into [the open valley]1285-the open valley , and went [their]1283-they ways through [the pass]439-the pass ; and it soon became stony again , as [they]1283-they mounted the bent which went up from out [the dale]881-the dale . And when [they]1283-they came to [the brow of [the said bent]1289-the said bent]1288-the brow of the said bent , [they]1283-they had a sight of [the open country]1290-the open country lying fair and joyous in the sunshine , and amidst of [it]1290-the open country , against [the blue hills]1291-the blue hills , the walls and towers of [a great city]1994-a great city .

Then said [the Maid]543-the maid : " O , [dear friend]1824-dear friend , lo [you]1824-dear friend ! is not that [[our]1283-they abode that lieth yonder]2609-our abode that lieth yonder , and is so beauteous ? Dwell not [[our]1283-they friends]2610-our friends there , and [our]1283-they protection against uncouth wights , and mere evil things in guileful shapes ? O city , [I]543-the maid bid [thee]1824-dear friend hail ! "[543-the maid]

But [Walter]35-walter looked on [her]543-the maid , and smiled somewhat ; and said : " [I]35-walter rejoice in [thy]543-the maid joy . But there be evil things in [yonder city]2611-yonder city also , though they be not fays nor [devils]2612-devils , or it is like to [no city that [I]35-walter wot of]2613-no city that i wot of . And in [every city]2614-every city shall [foes]2615-foes grow up to [us]1283-they without rhyme or reason , and life therein shall be tangled unto [us]1283-they . "[35-walter]

" Yea , "[543-the maid] [she]543-the maid said ; " but in [the wilderness amongst the devils]2616-the wilderness amongst the devils , what was to be done by manly might or valiancy ? There hadst [thou]2617-thou to fall back upon the guile and wizardry which [I]543-the maid had filched from [my]543-the maid very foes . But when [we]1283-they come down yonder , then shall [thy]543-the maid valiancy prevail to cleave the tangle for [us]1283-they . Or at the least , it shall leave a tale of [thee]543-the maid behind , and [I]543-the maid shall worship [thee]543-the maid . "[543-the maid]

[He]543-the maid laughed , and [his]543-the maid face grew brighter : " [Mastery]79-mastery mows [the meadow]373-the meadow , "[543-the maid] quoth [he]543-the maid , " and [one man]2183-one man is of little might against [many]1596-many . But [I]543-the maid promise [thee]543-the maid [I]543-the maid shall not be slothful before [thee]543-the maid . "[543-the maid]

CHAPTER XXXI : [THEY]1294-they COME UPON [NEW FOLK]80-new folk

With that [they]1294-they went down from the bent again , and came to where [the pass]439-the pass narrowed so much , that [they]1294-they went betwixt [a steep wall of rock on either side]1296-a steep wall of rock on either side ; but after an hour 's going , the said wall gave back suddenly , and , or [they]1294-they were ware almost , [they]1294-they came on [another dale like to that which [they]1294-they had left]1297-another dale like to that which they had left , but not so fair , though [it]1297-another dale like to that which they had left was grassy and well watered , and not so big either . But here indeed befell a change to [them]1294-they ; for lo ! [tents]1298-tents and [pavilions]1299-pavilions pitched in [the said valley]1300-the said valley , and amidst of it a throng of [men]165-men , mostly weaponed , and with horses ready saddled at hand . So [they]1294-they stayed [their]1294-they feet , and [Walter]35-walter 's heart failed [him]35-walter , for [he]35-walter said to [himself]35-walter : Who wotteth what [these men]1302-these men may be , save that [they]1302-these men be [aliens]137-aliens ? It is most like that [we]1304-we shall be taken as thralls ; and then , at the best , [we]1304-we shall be sundered ; and that is [all one with the worst]1305-all one with the worst .

But [the Maid]543-the maid , when [she]543-the maid saw the horses , and the gay tents , and the pennons fluttering , and the glitter of spears , and gleaming of white armour , smote [her]543-the maid palms together for joy , and cried out : " Here now are come [the folk of [the city]117-the city for [our]1304-we welcoming]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming , and fair and lovely are [they]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming , and of many things shall [they]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming be thinking , and a many things shall [they]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming do , and [we]1304-we shall be [partakers thereof]2623-partakers thereof . Come then , and let [us]1304-we meet [them]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming , [fair friend]2477-fair friend ! "[543-the maid]

But [Walter]35-walter said : " Alas ! [thou]1307-they knowest not : would that [we]1304-we might flee ! But now is it over late ; so put [we]1304-we a good face on it , and go to [them]2621-the folk of the city for our welcoming quietly , as erewhile [we]1304-we did in [the Bear - country]1722-the bear - country . "[35-walter]

So did [they]1307-they ; and there sundered six from [the men - at - arms]1308-the men - at - arms and came to [those twain]577-those twain , and made humble obeisance to [Walter]35-walter , but spake no word . Then [they]1307-they made as [they]1307-they would lead [them]1307-they to [the others]258-the others , and [the twain]201-the twain went with [them]1307-they wondering , and came into the ring of [men - at - arms]1312-men - at - arms , and stood before [an old hoar knight]1313-an old hoar knight , armed all , save [his]1313-an old hoar knight head , with most goodly armour , and [he]1313-an old hoar knight also bowed before [Walter]35-walter , but spake no word . Then [they]1307-they took [them]1307-they to [the master pavilion]1314-the master pavilion , and made signs to [them]1307-they to sit , and [they]1307-they brought [them]1307-they dainty meat and good wine . And the while of [their]1307-they eating arose up a stir about [them]1307-they ; and when [they]1307-they were done with [their]1307-they meat , [the ancient knight]1315-the ancient knight came to [them]1307-they , still bowing in courteous wise , and did [them]1307-they to wit by signs that [they]1307-they should depart : and when [they]1307-they were without , [they]1307-they saw all the other tents struck , and [men]165-men beginning to busy [them]165-men with striking [the pavilion]1317-the pavilion , and [the others]258-the others mounted and ranked in good order for [the road]1731-the road ; and there were two horse - litters before [them]1307-they , wherein [they]1307-they were bidden to mount , [Walter]35-walter in one , and [the Maid]543-the maid in the other , and no otherwise might [they]1307-they do . Then presently was a horn blown , and [all]107-all took to [the road]1731-the road together ; and [Walter]35-walter saw betwixt the curtains of the litter that [men - at - arms]1312-men - at - arms rode on either side of [him]35-walter , albeit [they]1312-men - at - arms had left [him]35-walter [his]35-walter sword by [his]35-walter side .

So [they]1307-they went down [the mountain - passes]1324-the mountain - passes , and before sunset were gotten into [the plain]404-the plain ; but [they]1307-they made no stay for nightfall , save to eat a morsel and drink a draught , going through the night as [men who knew [their]1307-they way well]1326-men who knew their way well . As [they]1307-they went , [Walter]35-walter wondered what would betide , and if peradventure [they]1307-they also would be for offering [them]1307-they up to [[their]1307-they Gods]1327-their gods ; whereas [they]1307-they were [aliens for certain]1328-aliens for certain , and belike also [Saracens]81-saracens . Moreover there was a cold fear at [his]35-walter heart that [he]35-walter should be sundered from [the Maid]543-the maid , whereas [[their]1307-they masters]1330-their masters now were [mighty men of war]1331-mighty men of war , holding in [their]1307-they hands that which [all men]1332-all men desire , to wit , the manifest beauty of [a woman]526-a woman . Yet [he]35-walter strove to think the best of it that [he]35-walter might . And so at last , when the night was far spent , and dawn was at hand , [they]1307-they stayed at a great and mighty gate in a huge wall . There [they]1307-they blew loudly on the horn thrice , and thereafter the gates were opened , and [they]1307-they all passed through into [a street]1334-a street , which seemed to [Walter]35-walter in the glimmer to be both great and goodly amongst the abodes of [men]165-men . Then it was but a little ere [they]1307-they came into [a square]1336-a square , wide - spreading , one side whereof [Walter]35-walter took to be the front of [a most goodly house]558-a most goodly house . There the doors of [the court]1338-the court opened to [them]1307-they or ever the horn might blow , though , forsooth , blow it did loudly three times ; all [they]1307-they entered therein , and [men]165-men came to [Walter]35-walter and signed to [him]35-walter to alight . So did [he]35-walter , and would have tarried to look about for [the Maid]543-the maid , but [they]165-men suffered it not , but led [him]35-walter up [a huge stair]1341-a huge stair into [a chamber]1342-a chamber , very great , and but dimly lighted because of [its]1342-a chamber greatness . Then [they]165-men brought [him]35-walter to a bed dight as fair as might be , and made signs to [him]35-walter to strip and lie therein . Perforce [he]35-walter did so , and then [they]165-men bore away [his]35-walter raiment , and left [him]35-walter lying there . So [he]35-walter lay there quietly , deeming it no avail for [him]35-walter , [a mother - naked man]1343-a mother - naked man , to seek escape thence ; but it was long ere [he]35-walter might sleep , because of [his]35-walter trouble of mind . At last , pure weariness got the better of [his]35-walter hopes and fears , and [he]35-walter fell into slumber just as the dawn was passing into day .

CHAPTER XXXII : OF THE NEW KING OF [THE CITY]30-the city AND LAND OF [STARK - WALL]33-stark - wall

When [he]35-walter awoke again the sun was shining brightly into [that chamber]1344-that chamber , and [he]35-walter looked , and beheld that it was peerless of beauty and riches , amongst all that [he]35-walter had ever seen : the ceiling done with gold and over - sea blue ; the walls hung with arras of the fairest , though [he]35-walter might not tell what was the history done therein . The chairs and stools were of carven work well be - painted , and amidmost was a great ivory chair under a cloth of estate , of bawdekin of gold and green , much be - pearled ; and all the floor was of fine work alexandrine .

[He]35-walter looked on all this , wondering what had befallen [him]35-walter , when lo ! there came [folk]598-folk into [the chamber]194-the chamber , to wit , [two serving - men]1347-two serving - men well - bedight , and [three old men clad in rich gowns of silk]1348-three old men clad in rich gowns of silk . These came to [him]35-walter and still by signs , without speech bade [him]35-walter arise and come with [them]1347-two serving - men ; and when [he]35-walter bade [them]1347-two serving - men look to it that [he]35-walter was naked , and laughed doubtfully , [they]1347-two serving - men neither laughed in answer , nor offered [him]35-walter any raiment , but still would have [him]35-walter arise , and [he]35-walter did so perforce . [They]1347-two serving - men brought [him]35-walter with [them]1347-two serving - men out of [the chamber]194-the chamber , and through [certain passages]1350-certain passages pillared and goodly , till [they]1347-two serving - men came to a bath as fair as any might be ; and there [the serving - men]1351-the serving - men washed [him]35-walter carefully and tenderly , [the old men looking on the while]1352-the old men looking on the while . When it was done , still [they]1347-two serving - men offered not to clothe [him]35-walter , but led [him]35-walter out , and through [the passages]1353-the passages again , back to [the chamber]194-the chamber . Only this time [he]35-walter must pass between [a double hedge of [men]165-men]1355-a double hedge of men , some weaponed , [some in peaceful array]1357-some in peaceful array , but [all clad gloriously , and full chieftain - like of aspect , either for valiancy or wisdom]1358-all clad gloriously , and full chieftain - like of aspect , either for valiancy or wisdom .

In [the chamber]194-the chamber itself was now [a concourse of [men , of great estate]1361-men , of great estate by deeming of [their]1361-men , of great estate array]1360-a concourse of men , of great estate by deeming of their array ; but all these were standing orderly in a ring about the ivory chair aforesaid . Now said [Walter]35-walter to [himself]35-walter : Surely all this looks toward the knife and the altar for [me]0-i ; but [he]35-walter kept a stout countenance despite of all .

So [they]1347-two serving - men led [him]35-walter up to the ivory chair , and [he]35-walter beheld on either side thereof a bench , and on each was laid a set of raiment from the shirt upwards ; but there was much diversity betwixt these arrays . For one was all of robes of peace , glorious and be - gemmed , unmeet for any save [a great king]1362-a great king ; while the other was war - weed , seemly , well - fashioned , but little adorned ; nay rather , worn and bestained with weather , and the pelting of the spear - storm .

Now [those old men]1363-those old men signed to [Walter]35-walter to take which of those raiments [he]35-walter would , and do it on . [He]35-walter looked to the right and the left , and when [he]35-walter had looked on the war - gear , the heart arose in [him]35-walter , and [he]35-walter called to mind the array of the Goldings in the forefront of battle , and [he]35-walter made one step toward the weapons , and laid [his]35-walter hand thereon . Then ran a glad murmur through that concourse , and [the old men]1364-the old men drew up to [him]35-walter smiling and joyous , and helped [him]35-walter to do [them]1365-them on ; and as [he]35-walter took up the helm , [he]35-walter noted that over its broad brown iron sat a golden crown .

So when [he]35-walter was clad and weaponed , girt with a sword , and a steel axe in [his]35-walter hand , [the elders]1366-the elders showed [him]35-walter to the ivory throne , and [he]35-walter laid the axe on the arm of the chair , and drew forth the sword from the scabbard , and sat [him]35-walter down , and laid the ancient blade across [his]35-walter knees ; then [he]35-walter looked about on [those great men]1367-those great men , and spake : " How long shall [we]2626-we speak no word to [each other]421-each other , or is it so that [God]44-god hath stricken [you]35-walter dumb ? "[35-walter]

Then all [they]1367-those great men cried out with one voice : " All hail to [the King]1780-the king , [the King of Battle]2629-the king of battle ! "[1367-those great men]

[Spake Walter]35-walter : " If [I]35-walter be [king]1927-king , will [ye]35-walter do [my]35-walter will as [I]35-walter bid [you]35-walter ? "[35-walter]

Answered [the elder]127-the elder : " Nought have [we]2626-we will to do , [lord]2631-lord , save as [thou]2632-thou biddest . "[127-the elder]

Said [Walter]35-walter : " [Thou]2632-thou then , wilt [thou]2632-thou answer a question in all truth ? "[35-walter]

" [Yea]2633-yea , [lord]2631-lord , "[127-the elder] said [the elder]127-the elder , " if [I]127-the elder may live afterward . "[127-the elder]

Then said [Walter]35-walter : " [The woman that came with [me]35-walter into [[your]127-the elder Camp of [the Mountain]32-the mountain]2636-your camp of the mountain]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain , what hath befallen [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain ? "[35-walter]

[The elder]127-the elder answered : " Nought hath befallen [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain , either of good or evil , save that [she]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain hath slept and eaten and bathed [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain . What , then , is [the King]1780-the king 's pleasure concerning [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain ? "[127-the elder]

" That [ye]127-the elder bring [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain hither to [me]35-walter straightway , "[35-walter] said [Walter]35-walter .

" [Yea]127-the elder , "[127-the elder] said [the elder]127-the elder ; " and in what guise shall [we]2638-we bring [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain hither ? shall [she]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain be arrayed as [a servant]769-a servant , or [a great lady]691-a great lady ? "[127-the elder]

Then [Walter]35-walter pondered a while , and spake at last : " Ask [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain what is [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain will herein , and as [she]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain will have it , so let it be . But set [ye]127-the elder another chair beside [mine]35-walter , and lead [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain thereto . [[Thou]127-the elder wise [old man]1650-old man]2641-thou wise old man , send one or two to bring [her]2635-the woman that came with me into your camp of the mountain in hither , but abide [thou]127-the elder , for [I]127-the elder have a question or two to ask of [thee]127-the elder yet . And [ye]1375-the lords , [lords]2643-lords , abide here the coming of [my]127-the elder she - fellow , if it weary [you]1375-the lords not . "[127-the elder]

So [the elder]127-the elder spake to [three of [the most honourable of [the lords]1375-the lords]1374-the most honourable of the lords]1373-three of the most honourable of the lords , and [they]1373-three of the most honourable of the lords went [their]1373-three of the most honourable of the lords ways to bring in [the Maid]543-the maid .

CHAPTER XXXIII : CONCERNING THE FASHION OF [KING - MAKING]67-king IN [STARK - WALL]33-stark - wall

Meanwhile [the King]1780-the king spake to [the elder]127-the elder , and said : " Now tell [me]1780-the king whereof [I]1780-the king am become [king]1927-king , and what is the fashion and cause of [the king - making]2645-the king - making ; for wondrous it is to [me]1780-the king , whereas [I]1780-the king am but an alien amidst of [mighty men]2646-mighty men . "[1780-the king]

" [Lord]2631-lord , "[208-the old man] said [the old man]208-the old man , " [thou]1780-the king art become king of [a mighty city , which hath under [it]2648-a mighty city , which hath under it many other cities and wide lands [many other cities]2649-many other cities and [wide lands]2650-wide lands]2648-a mighty city , which hath under it many other cities and wide lands , and havens by [the sea- side]2651-the sea- side , and which lacketh no wealth which [men]165-men desire . [Many wise men]2653-many wise men dwell therein , and of fools not more than in [other lands]1554-other lands . [A valiant host]2655-a valiant host shall follow [thee]1780-the king to battle when needs must [thou]1780-the king wend afield ; an host not to be withstood , save by [the ancient God - folk]2656-the ancient god - folk , if any of [them]2656-the ancient god - folk were left upon [the earth]1629-the earth , as belike none are . And as to the name of [[our]2658-we said city]2659-our said city , it hight [the City of the Stark - wall]2660-the city of the stark - wall , or more shortly , [Stark]33-stark - wall - wall . Now as to the fashion of [[our]2658-we king]2661-our king - making : If [[our]2658-we king]2661-our king dieth and leaveth [an heir male]2663-an heir male , begotten of [his]2661-our king body , then is [he]2661-our king king after [him]2661-our king ; but if [he]2661-our king die and leave [no heir]2664-no heir , then send [we]2658-we out [a great lord]2665-a great lord , with [knights]2666-knights and [sergeants]2667-sergeants , to [that pass of the mountain whereto [ye]2669-ye came yesterday]2668-that pass of the mountain whereto ye came yesterday ; and [the first man that cometh unto [them]2665-a great lord]2670-the first man that cometh unto them , [they]2665-a great lord take and lead to [the city]117-the city , as [they]2665-a great lord did with [thee]2669-ye , [lord]2631-lord . For [we]2658-we believe and trow that of old time [[our]2658-we forefathers]2673-our forefathers came down from [the mountains]317-the mountains by [that same pass]2675-that same pass , poor and rude , but full of valiancy , before [they]2665-a great lord conquered [these lands]2676-these lands , and builded the Stark- wall . But now furthermore , when [we]2658-we have gotten [the said wanderer]2677-the said wanderer , and brought [him]2677-the said wanderer [home]1557-home to [[our]2658-we city]2011-our city , [we]2658-we behold [him]2677-the said wanderer mother - naked , [all the great men of [us]2658-we]2680-all the great men of us , [both sages]2681-both sages and [warriors]2682-warriors ; then if [we]2658-we find [him]2677-the said wanderer ill - fashioned and counterfeit of [his]2677-the said wanderer body , [we]2658-we roll [him]2677-the said wanderer in a great carpet till [he]2677-the said wanderer dies ; or whiles , if [he]2677-the said wanderer be but [a simple man]2683-a simple man , and without guile , [we]2658-we deliver [him]2677-the said wanderer for thrall to [some artificer amongst [us]2658-we]2684-some artificer amongst us , as [a shoemaker]2685-a shoemaker , [a wright]2686-a wright , or what not , and so forget [him]2677-the said wanderer . But in either case [we]2658-we make as if [no such man]2687-no such man had come to [us]2658-we , and [we]2658-we send again [the lord]2688-the lord and [[his]2688-the lord knights]2689-his knights to watch [the pass]439-the pass ; for [we]2658-we say that such an one [the Fathers of old time]2691-the fathers of old time have not sent [us]2658-we . But again , when [we]2658-we have seen to [the new - comer]2692-the new - comer that [he]2692-the new - comer is well - fashioned of [his]2692-the new - comer body , all is not done ; for [we]2658-we deem that never would [the Fathers]82-the fathers send [us]2658-we a dolt or [a craven]2693-a craven to be [[our]2658-we king]2661-our king . Therefore [we]2658-we bid [the naked one]2695-the naked one take to [him]2695-the naked one which [he]2695-the naked one will of these raiments , either the ancient armour , which now [thou]2696-thou bearest , [lord]2631-lord , or this golden raiment here ; and if [he]2695-the naked one take the war - gear , as [thou]2696-thou takedst it , [King]1927-king , it is well ; but if [he]2695-the naked one take the raiment of peace , then hath [he]2695-the naked one the choice either to be thrall of [some goodman of [the city]117-the city]2699-some goodman of the city , or to be proven how wise [he]2695-the naked one may be , and so fare the narrow edge betwixt death and kingship ; for if [he]2695-the naked one fall short of [his]2695-the naked one wisdom , then shall [he]2695-the naked one die the death . Thus is [thy]2696-thou question answered , [King]1927-king , and praise be to [the Fathers]2702-the fathers that [they]2702-the fathers have sent [us]2696-thou one whom [none may doubt , either for wisdom or valiancy]2703-none may doubt , either for wisdom or valiancy . "[208-the old man]

CHAPTER XXXIV : NOW [COMETH THE MAID]72-the maid TO [THE KING]1780-the king

Then all [they]1381-they bowed before [the King]1780-the king , and [he]1780-the king spake again : " What is that noise that [I]1780-the king hear without , as if it were the rising of [the sea]89-the sea on [a sandy shore]2705-a sandy shore , when the south - west wind is blowing . "[1780-the king]

Then [the elder]127-the elder opened [his]127-the elder mouth to answer ; but before [he]127-the elder might get out the word , there was a stir without the chamber door , and [the throng]1384-the throng parted , and lo ! amidst of [them]1381-they came [the Maid]543-the maid , and [she]543-the maid yet clad in nought save the white coat wherewith [she]543-the maid had won through [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness , save that on [her]543-the maid head was a garland of red roses , and [her]543-the maid middle was wreathed with the same . Fresh and fair [she]543-the maid was as the dawn of [June]83-june ; [her]543-the maid face bright , red - lipped , and clear - eyed , and [her]543-the maid cheeks flushed with hope and love . [She]543-the maid went straight to [Walter]35-walter where [he]35-walter sat , and lightly put away with [her]543-the maid hand [the elder who would lead [her]543-the maid to the ivory throne beside [the King]1780-the king]1387-the elder who would lead her to the ivory throne beside the king ; but [she]543-the maid knelt down before [him]35-walter , and laid [her]543-the maid hand on [his]35-walter steel - clad knee , and said : " O [[my]543-the maid lord]2050-my lord , now [I]543-the maid see that [thou]2707-thou hast beguiled [me]543-the maid , and that [thou]2707-thou wert all along [[a king]2164-a king - born man coming home to [[thy]2707-thou realm]2710-thy realm]2709-a king - born man coming home to thy realm . But so dear [thou]2707-thou hast been to [me]543-the maid ; and so fair and clear , and so kind withal do thine eyes shine on [me]543-the maid from under the grey war - helm , that [I]543-the maid will beseech [thee]2707-thou not to cast [me]543-the maid out utterly , but suffer [me]543-the maid to be [[thy]2707-thou servant]2711-thy servant and [handmaid]2712-handmaid for a while . Wilt [thou]2707-thou not ? "[543-the maid]

But [the King]1780-the king stooped down to [her]1390-her and raised [her]1390-her up , and stood on [his]1780-the king feet , and took [her]1390-her hands and kissed them , and set [her]1390-her down beside [him]1780-the king , and said to [her]1390-her : " [Sweetheart]2713-sweetheart , this is now [[thy]1390-her place till the night cometh , even by [my]1390-her side]2714-thy place till the night cometh , even by my side . "[1390-her]

So [she]1390-her sat down there meek and valiant , [her]1390-her hands laid in [her]1390-her lap , and [her]1390-her feet one over the other ; while [the King]1780-the king said : " [Lords]2643-lords , this is [[my]1780-the king beloved]2716-my beloved , and [[my]1780-the king spouse]2717-my spouse . Now , therefore , if [ye]2643-lords will have [me]1780-the king for [King]1927-king , [ye]2643-lords must worship [this one]2259-this one for [Queen]2151-queen and [Lady]1863-lady ; or else suffer [us]2722-our both to go [our]2722-our ways in peace . "[1780-the king]

Then [all [they]1392-all they that were in the chamber that were in [the chamber]194-the chamber]1392-all they that were in the chamber cried out aloud : " [The Queen]2427-the queen , [the Lady]576-the lady ! [The beloved of [[our]2722-our lord]2726-our lord]2725-the beloved of our lord ! "[1392-all they that were in the chamber]

And this cry came from [their]1392-all they that were in the chamber hearts , and not [their]1392-all they that were in the chamber lips only ; for as [they]1392-all they that were in the chamber looked on [her]1394-her , and the brightness of [her]1394-her beauty , [they]1392-all they that were in the chamber saw also the meekness of [her]1394-her demeanour , and the high heart of [her]1394-her , and [they]1392-all they that were in the chamber all fell to loving [her]1394-her .
