But [the young men of [them]1392-all they that were in the chamber]1395-the young men of them , [their]1395-the young men of them cheeks flushed as [they]1395-the young men of them beheld [her]1394-her , and [their]1395-the young men of them hearts went out to [her]1394-her , and [they]1395-the young men of them drew [their]1395-the young men of them swords and brandished [them]1396-them aloft , and cried out for [her]1394-her as [men made suddenly drunk with love]1397-men made suddenly drunk with love : " [The Queen]2427-the queen , [the Lady]576-the lady , [the lovely one]2729-the lovely one ! "[1395-the young men of them]

CHAPTER XXXV : OF [THE KING OF [STARK - WALL]84-stark - wall AND [HIS]1398-his QUEEN]84-stark - wall

But while this betid , that murmur without , which is aforesaid , grew louder ; and it smote on [the King]1780-the king 's ear , and [he]1780-the king said again to [the elder]127-the elder : " Tell [us]127-the elder now of that noise withoutward , what is it ? "[1780-the king]

Said [the elder]127-the elder : " If [thou]2730-ye , [King]1927-king , and [the Queen]2427-the queen , wilt but arise and stand in the window , and go forth into [the hanging gallery thereof]2733-the hanging gallery thereof , then shall [ye]2730-ye know at once what is this rumour , and therewithal shall [ye]2730-ye see a sight meet to rejoice the heart of [a king]2164-a king new come into kingship . "[127-the elder]

So [the King]1780-the king arose and took [the Maid]543-the maid by the hand , and went to the window and looked forth ; and lo ! [the great square of [the place]1405-the place]1404-the great square of the place all thronged with folk as thick as [they]1406-they could stand , and the more part of [the carles]1112-the carles with a weapon in hand , and [many armed right gallantly]1408-many armed right gallantly . Then [he]1780-the king went out into [the gallery]1409-the gallery with [[his]1780-the king Queen]1410-his queen , still holding [her]1410-his queen hand , and [[his]1780-the king lords]1411-his lords and [wise men]1412-wise men stood behind [him]1780-the king . Straightway then arose a cry , and a shout of joy and welcome that rent the very heavens , and [the great place]1413-the great place was all glittering and strange with the tossing up of spears and the brandishing of swords , and the stretching forth of hands .

But [the Maid]543-the maid spake softly to [King Walter]85-walter and said : " Here then is [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness left behind a long way , and here is warding and protection against the foes of [our]2736-our life and soul . O blessed be [thou]1410-his queen and [thy]1410-his queen valiant heart ! "[543-the maid]

But [Walter]85-walter spake nothing , but stood as one in a dream ; and yet , if that might be , [his]85-walter longing toward [her]1410-his queen increased manifold .

But down below , amidst of [the throng]1384-the throng , stood [two neighbours somewhat anigh to the window]1416-two neighbours somewhat anigh to the window ; and quoth one to [the other]922-the other : " See [thou]1410-his queen ! [the new man in the ancient armour of the Battle of the Waters]2737-the new man in the ancient armour of the battle of the waters , bearing the sword that slew [the foeman king on the Day of the Doubtful Onset]2738-the foeman king on the day of the doubtful onset ! Surely this is a sign of good - luck to [[us]2736-our all]2739-us all . "[1416-two neighbours somewhat anigh to the window]

" [Yea]2740-yea , "[1418-the second] said [the second]1418-the second , " [he]2737-the new man in the ancient armour of the battle of the waters beareth [his]2737-the new man in the ancient armour of the battle of the waters armour well , and the eyes are bright in the head of [him]2737-the new man in the ancient armour of the battle of the waters : but hast [thou]1410-his queen beheld well [his]2737-the new man in the ancient armour of the battle of the waters she - fellow , and what the like of [her]1410-his queen is ? "[1418-the second]

" [I]922-the other see [her]1410-his queen , "[922-the other] said [the other]922-the other , " that [she]1410-his queen is [a fair woman]2741-a fair woman ; yet somewhat worse clad than simply . [She]1410-his queen is in [her]1410-his queen smock , [man]1630-man , and were it not for the balusters [I]922-the other deem [ye]1630-man should see [her]1410-his queen barefoot . What is amiss with [her]1410-his queen ? "[922-the other]

" Dost [thou]1410-his queen not see [her]1410-his queen , "[1420-the second neighbour] said [the second neighbour]1420-the second neighbour , " that [she]1410-his queen is not only [a fair woman]2741-a fair woman , but yet more , one of those lovely ones that draw the heart out of [a man]229-a man 's body , one may scarce say for why ? Surely [Stark]84-stark - wall - wall hath cast a lucky net this time . And as to [her]1410-his queen raiment , [I]1420-the second neighbour see of [her]1410-his queen that [she]1410-his queen is clad in white and wreathed with roses , but that the flesh of [her]1410-his queen is so wholly pure and sweet that it maketh all [her]1410-his queen attire but a part of [her]1410-his queen body , and halloweth it , so that it hath the semblance of gems . Alas , [[my]1420-the second neighbour friend]1798-my friend ! let [us]2746-us hope that [this Queen]2188-this queen will fare abroad unseldom amongst [the people]2503-the people . "[1420-the second neighbour]

Thus , then , [they]1421-they spake ; but after a while [the King]1780-the king and [[his]1780-the king mate]1423-his mate went back into [the chamber]194-the chamber , and [he]1780-the king gave command that [the women of [the Queen]2427-the queen]1425-the women of the queen should come and fetch [her]2427-the queen away , to attire [her]2427-the queen in royal array . And thither came [the fairest of [the honourable damsels]1428-the honourable damsels]1427-the fairest of the honourable damsels , and were fain of being [[her]2427-the queen waiting- women]1429-her waiting- women . Therewithal [the King]1780-the king was unarmed , and dight most gloriously , but still [he]1780-the king bore the Sword of [the King]1780-the king 's Slaying : and sithence were [the King]1780-the king and [the Queen]2427-the queen brought into [the great hall of the palace]1434-the great hall of the palace , and [they]1421-they met on the dais , and kissed before [the lords]1375-the lords and [other folk that thronged [the hall]1860-the hall]1436-other folk that thronged the hall . There [they]1421-they ate a morsel and drank a cup together while [all]107-all beheld [them]1421-they ; and then [they]1421-they were brought forth , and a white horse of [the goodliest , well bedight]1439-the goodliest , well bedight , brought for each of [them]1421-they , and thereon [they]1421-they mounted and went [their]1421-they ways together , by [the lane which [the huge throng]1441-the huge throng made for [them]1421-they]1440-the lane which the huge throng made for them , to [the great church]1442-the great church , for the hallowing and the crowning ; and [they]1421-they were led by [one squire]1443-one squire alone , and [he]1443-one squire unarmed ; for such was the custom of Stark - wall when [a new king]1444-a new king should be hallowed : so came [they]1421-they to [the great church]1442-the great church for [that folk]1677-that folk was not miscreant , so to say , and [they]1421-they entered [it]1442-the great church , [they]1421-they two alone , and went into [the choir]1447-the choir : and when [they]1421-they had stood there a little while wondering at [their]1421-they lot , [they]1421-they heard how the bells fell a - ringing tunefully over [their]1421-they heads ; and then drew near the sound of many trumpets blowing together , and thereafter the voices of [many folk]1448-many folk singing ; and then were the great doors thrown open , and [the bishop]1449-the bishop and [[his]1449-the bishop priests]1450-his priests came into [the church]1451-the church with singing and minstrelsy , and thereafter came [the whole throng of [the folk]252-the folk]1452-the whole throng of the folk , and presently [the nave of [the church]1451-the church]1454-the nave of the church was filled by [it]1452-the whole throng of the folk , as when the water follows the cutting of the dam , and fills up [the dyke]1456-the dyke . Thereafter came [the bishop]1449-the bishop and [[his]1449-the bishop mates]1458-his mates into [the choir]1447-the choir , and came up to [the King]1780-the king , and gave [him]1780-the king and [the Queen]2427-the queen the kiss of peace . This was mass sung gloriously ; and thereafter was [the King]1780-the king anointed and crowned , and great joy was made throughout [the church]1451-the church . Afterwards [they]1464-they went back afoot to [the palace]1465-the palace , [[they]1464-they two alone together]1466-they two alone together , with none but [the esquire]1467-the esquire going before to show [them]1464-they the way . And as [they]1464-they went , [they]1464-they passed close beside [those two neighbours , whose talk has been told of afore]1468-those two neighbours , whose talk has been told of afore , and [the first one]1469-the first one , [he]1469-the first one who had praised [the King]1780-the king 's war - array , spake and said : " Truly , [neighbour]2749-neighbour , [thou]2750-thou art in the right of it ; and now [the Queen]2427-the queen has been dight duly , and hath a crown on [her]2427-the queen head , and is clad in white samite done all over with pearls , [I]1469-the first one see [her]2427-the queen to be of exceeding goodliness ; as goodly , maybe , as [the Lord King]2752-the lord king . "[1469-the first one]

Quoth [the other]922-the other : " Unto [me]922-the other [she]2427-the queen seemeth as [she]2427-the queen did e'en now ; [she]2427-the queen is clad in white , as then [she]2427-the queen was , and it is by reason of the pure and sweet flesh of [her]2427-the queen that the pearls shine out and glow , and by the holiness of [her]2427-the queen body is [her]2427-the queen rich attire hallowed ; but , forsooth , it seemed to [me]922-the other as [she]2427-the queen went past as though paradise had come anigh to [[our]2753-our city]2011-our city , and that all the air breathed of [it]2011-our city . So [I]922-the other say , praise be to [God]44-god and [[His]2752-the lord king Hallows who hath suffered [her]2427-the queen to dwell amongst [us]2753-our]2755-his hallows who hath suffered her to dwell amongst us ! "[922-the other]

Said [the first man]1472-the first man : " [Forsooth]58-forsooth , it is well ; but knowest [thou]1472-the first man at all whence [she]2427-the queen cometh , and of what lineage [she]2427-the queen may be ? "[1472-the first man]

" Nay , "[922-the other] said [the other]922-the other , " [I]922-the other wot not whence [she]2427-the queen is ; but this [I]922-the other wot full surely , that when [she]2427-the queen goeth away , [they]2756-they whom [she]2427-the queen leadeth with [her]2427-the queen shall be well bestead . Again , of [her]2427-the queen lineage nought know [I]922-the other ; but this [I]922-the other know , that [they]2756-they that come of [her]2427-the queen , to [the twentieth generation]2757-the twentieth generation , shall bless and praise the memory of [her]2427-the queen , and hallow [her]2427-the queen name little less than [they]2756-they hallow the name of [the Mother of God]2758-the mother of god . "[922-the other]

So spake [those two]686-those two ; but [the King]1780-the king and [Queen]2151-queen came back to [the palace]1465-the palace , and sat among [the lords]1375-the lords and at the banquet which was held thereafter , and long was the time of [their]686-those two glory , till the night was far spent and [all men]1332-all men must seek to [their]1332-all men beds .

CHAPTER XXXVI : OF [WALTER]85-walter AND [THE MAID]543-the maid IN THE DAYS OF THE KINGSHIP

Long it was , indeed , till [the women]1481-the women , by [the King]1780-the king 's command , had brought [the Maid]543-the maid to [[the King]1780-the king 's chamber]1485-the king 's chamber ; and [he]85-walter met [her]543-the maid , and took [her]543-the maid by the shoulders and kissed [her]543-the maid , and said : " Art [thou]2759-thou not weary , [sweetheart]2713-sweetheart ? Doth not [the city]117-the city , and [the thronging folk]2762-the thronging folk , and the watching eyes of [the great ones]2763-the great ones . . . doth it not all lie heavy on [thee]2759-thou , as it doth upon [me]85-walter ? "[85-walter]

[She]543-the maid said : " And where is [the city]117-the city now ? is not this [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness again , and [thou]2759-thou and [I]543-the maid alone together therein ? "[543-the maid]

[He]85-walter gazed at [her]543-the maid eagerly , and [she]543-the maid reddened , so that [her]543-the maid eyes shone light amidst the darkness of the flush of [her]543-the maid cheeks .

[He]85-walter spake trembling and softly , and said : " Is it not in one matter better than [the wilderness]1006-the wilderness ? is not the fear gone , yea , every whit thereof ? "[85-walter]

The dark flush had left [her]543-the maid face , and [she]543-the maid looked on [him]85-walter exceeding sweetly , and spoke steadily and clearly : " Even so it is , [beloved]2321-beloved . "[543-the maid] Therewith [she]543-the maid set [her]543-the maid hand to the girdle that girt [her]543-the maid loins , and did it off , and held it out toward [him]85-walter , and said : " Here is the token ; this is [a maid]2768-a maid 's girdle , and [the woman]873-the woman is ungirt . "[543-the maid]

So [he]85-walter took the girdle and [her]543-the maid hand withal , and cast [his]85-walter arms about [her]543-the maid : and amidst the sweetness of [their]1486-they love and [their]1486-they safety , and assured hope of many days of joy , [they]1486-they spake together of the hours when [they]1486-they fared the razor - edge betwixt guile and misery and death , and the sweeter yet it grew to [them]1486-they because of it ; and many things [she]543-the maid told [him]85-walter ere the dawn , of the evil days bygone , and the dealings of [the Mistress]1828-the mistress with [her]543-the maid , till the grey day stole into [the chamber]194-the chamber to make manifest [her]543-the maid loveliness ; which , forsooth , was better even than the deeming of [that man amidst the throng whose heart had been so drawn towards [her]543-the maid]1489-that man amidst the throng whose heart had been so drawn towards her . So [they]1486-they rejoiced together in the new day .

But when the full day was , and [Walter]85-walter arose , [he]85-walter called [[his]85-walter thanes]1490-his thanes and [wise men]1412-wise men to [the council]1492-the council ; and first [he]85-walter bade open the prison - doors , and feed [the needy]1493-the needy and clothe [them]1493-the needy , and make good cheer to [all men , high and low , rich and unrich]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich ; and thereafter [he]85-walter took counsel with [them]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich on many matters , and [they]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich marvelled at [his]85-walter wisdom and the keenness of [his]85-walter wit ; and so it was , that [some were but half pleased thereat]1495-some were but half pleased thereat , whereas [they]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich saw that [their]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich will was like to give way before [his]85-walter in all matters . But [the wiser of [them]1494-all men , high and low , rich and unrich]1496-the wiser of them rejoiced in [him]85-walter , and looked for good days while [his]85-walter life lasted .

Now of the deeds that [he]85-walter did , and [his]85-walter joys and [his]85-walter griefs , the tale shall tell no more ; nor of how [he]85-walter saw [Langton]35-walter again , and [his]85-walter dealings there .

In [Stark - wall]33-stark - wall [he]85-walter dwelt , and reigned [[a King]2164-a king , well beloved of [[his]85-walter folk]1499-his folk , sorely feared of [[their]1499-his folk foemen]1500-their foemen]1498-a king , well beloved of his folk , sorely feared of their foemen . Strife [he]85-walter had to deal with , at [home]1557-home and abroad ; but therein [he]85-walter was not quelled , till [he]85-walter fell asleep fair and softly , when [this world]1606-this world had no more of deeds for [him]85-walter to do . Nor may it be said that [the needy]1493-the needy lamented [him]85-walter ; for no needy had [he]85-walter left in [[his]85-walter own land]1504-his own land . And [few foes]1505-few foes [he]85-walter left behind to hate [him]85-walter .

As to [the Maid]543-the maid , [she]543-the maid so waxed in loveliness and kindness , that it was a year 's joy for any to have cast eyes upon [her]543-the maid in [street]255-street or on [field]1508-field . [All wizardry]1509-all wizardry left [her]543-the maid since the day of [her]543-the maid wedding ; yet of wit and wisdom [she]543-the maid had enough left , and to spare ; for [she]543-the maid needed no going about , and no guile , any more than hard commands , to have [her]543-the maid will done . So loved [she]543-the maid was by [all folk]1510-all folk , forsooth , that it was a mere joy for any to go about [her]543-the maid errands . To be short , [she]543-the maid was [the land]101-the land 's increase , and [the city]117-the city 's safeguard , and the bliss of [the folk]252-the folk .

Somewhat , as the days passed , it misgave [her]543-the maid that [she]543-the maid had beguiled [the Bear - folk]1687-the bear - folk to deem [her]543-the maid [[their]1687-the bear - folk God]2394-their god ; and [she]543-the maid considered and thought how [she]543-the maid might atone it .

So the second year after [they]1687-the bear - folk had come to [Stark - wall]33-stark - wall , [she]543-the maid went with [certain folk]1516-certain folk to [the head of the pass that led down to [the Bears]44-god]1517-the head of the pass that led down to the bears ; and there [she]543-the maid stayed [the men - at - arms]1308-the men - at - arms , and went on further with [a two score of [husbandmen]1520-husbandmen whom [she]543-the maid had redeemed from [thralldom]16-thralldom in [Stark - wall]33-stark - wall]1519-a two score of husbandmen whom she had redeemed from thralldom in stark - wall ; and when [they]1687-the bear - folk were hard on [the dales of [the Bears]44-god]1521-the dales of the bears , [she]543-the maid left [them]1687-the bear - folk there in [a certain little dale , with [their]1687-the bear - folk wains]1522-a certain little dale , with their wains and horses , and seed - corn , and iron tools , and went down all bird - alone to [the dwelling of [those huge men]1723-those huge men]1523-the dwelling of those huge men , unguarded now by sorcery , and trusting in nought but [her]543-the maid loveliness and kindness . Clad [she]543-the maid was now , as when [she]543-the maid fled from [the Wood]14-the wood beyond [the World]1-the world , in a short white coat alone , with bare feet and naked arms ; but the said coat was now embroidered with the imagery of blossoms in silk and gold , and gems , whereas now [her]543-the maid wizardry had departed from [her]543-the maid .

So [she]543-the maid came to [the Bears]44-god , and [they]44-god knew [her]543-the maid at once , and worshipped and blessed [her]543-the maid , and feared [her]543-the maid . But [she]543-the maid told [them]44-god that [she]543-the maid had a gift for [them]44-god , and was come to give it ; and therewith [she]543-the maid told [them]44-god of the art of tillage , and bade [them]44-god learn it ; and when [they]44-god asked [her]543-the maid how [they]44-god should do so , [she]543-the maid told [them]44-god of [the men who were abiding [them]44-god in [the mountain dale]1526-the mountain dale]1525-the men who were abiding them in the mountain dale , and bade [the Bears]44-god take [them]44-god for [[their]44-god brothers]1527-their brothers and [sons of [the ancient Fathers]1529-the ancient fathers]1528-sons of the ancient fathers , and then [they]44-god should be taught of [them]44-god . This [they]44-god behight [her]543-the maid to do , and so [she]543-the maid led [them]44-god to where [[her]543-the maid freedmen]1530-her freedmen lay , whom [the Bears]44-god received with all joy and loving - kindness , and took [them]44-god into [[their]44-god folk]1531-their folk .

So [they]44-god went back to [[their]44-god dales]1532-their dales together ; but [the Maid]543-the maid went [her]543-the maid ways back to [[her]543-the maid men]1534-her men - at - arms and [the city of Stark - wall]1535-the city of stark - wall .

Thereafter [she]543-the maid sent more gifts and messages to [the Bears]44-god , but never again went [herself]543-the maid to see [them]44-god ; for as good a face as [she]543-the maid put on it that last time , yet [her]543-the maid heart waxed cold with fear , and it almost seemed to [her]543-the maid that [[her]543-the maid Mistress]1536-her mistress was alive again , and that [she]543-the maid was escaping from [her]1536-her mistress and plotting against [her]1536-her mistress once more .

As for [the Bears]44-god , [they]44-god throve and multiplied ; till at last strife arose great and grim betwixt [them]44-god and [other peoples]1537-other peoples ; for [they]44-god had become mighty in battle : yea , once and again [they]44-god met [the host of [Stark - wall]84-stark - wall]1538-the host of stark - wall in fight , and overthrew and were overthrown . But that was a long while after [the Maid]72-the maid had passed away .

Now of [Walter]35-walter and [the Maid]543-the maid is no more to be told , saving that [they]1540-they begat between [them]1540-they [goodly sons]1541-goodly sons and [fair daughters]1542-fair daughters ; whereof came a great lineage in [Stark - wall]33-stark - wall ; which lineage was so strong , and endured so long a while , that by then it had died out , [folk]598-folk had clean forgotten [their]598-folk ancient Custom of king - making , so that after [Walter of Langton]35-walter there was never [another king that came down to [them]598-folk poor and lonely from out of [the Mountains of [the Bears]44-god]1545-the mountains of the bears]1544-another king that came down to them poor and lonely from out of the mountains of the bears .
